loans.name: Handaru

texts.en:
Handaru is a Javanese artisan who specializes in handcrafted batik art. He would like to invest in a purchase of wood, for his masks and sculptures.

Handaru has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I come from a region renowned for batik artistry. We transfer traditional textile batik techniques to wood. I specialize in Indonesian batik ornaments, but focus more in the classic styles of Yogya and Solo. The color I use is 'sogan,' or brown, a trademark of the Yogya-Solo style. I enjoy my work greatly, and hope that my customers take pleasure in sharing our rich cultural heritage.

"I want to share and sell my Javanese batik works that we hand-paint on wood. The crafting process can be long, and sometimes it fails due to the extreme weather. This microcredit will help me sell my works and allow the Javanese batik technique to be known in other continents."

Use the link below to view Handaru's handcrafted batik art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1572

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of wood for his masks and sculptures.

loans.name: Putu

texts.en:
Putu is a Balinese artisan who specializes in ceramic tableware and decor. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, so that he can increase his inventory ahead of the busy holiday season.

Putu has been selling through NOVICA since 2001. This is his story:

"I inherited my ceramic legacy from my mother, who pioneered ceramic artistry in 1980. At first, she undertook the entire design and crafting procedure by herself, and developed a reputation for fine design and high quality. In 1990, when she passed away, I took over her work, and eventually opened a showroom in her memory. I find inspiration in the luscious flora and fauna of Bali.

"I have received a microcredit loan on a past occasion, and it really helped my business. I want to express my gratitude to all of you who have supported us. This is a really good program that can help the small workshop to improve and develop. It will also let us create more and, hopefully, sell more, too. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Putu's ceramic tableware and decor on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2650

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, so that he can increase his inventory ahead of the busy holiday season.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
“My life journey brought me to a place where I want to help others and share both the joys and pains of life,” Julia said.

As the new owner of her practice in spiritual counseling, Julia taps into to her clients' mind, body, spirit and soul to offer another alternative towards healing. She graduated from what was formally known as the Institute of Transpersonal Psychology, Sofia University. As a recent graduate, she is preparing to become a licensed marriage and family therapist.  

“The transpersonal aspects of counseling psychology have become the bridge that fulfilled my spiritual passion and gave me a wonderful platform to launch into the helping profession,” she said. 

Julia explains that transpersonal psychology is an approach to understanding the way our minds operate through our relationships with others, resting in the belief that there is something bigger and deeper in the space between which operates upon us. 

During her practicum, Julia worked at a counseling center for children, adolescents and families. There she worked actively with families, helping them get the healing they needed. 

“I used therapeutic skills such as mindfulness, person-centered, tradition talk, mediation, creative expression, and family systems theory with clients,” she said.  “I resonate most with the therapeutic modalities from Carl Rogers, C.G. Jung, and Susan Johnson.”

She sought out Accion Texas Inc. to help fund supplies and furniture for her practice. 

“I believe each of us have the tools within ourselves to enhance our well-being,” Julia said. “I am just here to illuminate the unique path of my clients.”

loans.use: to pay for supplies and office furniture for her practice

loans.name: Soog

texts.en:
“When I get up in the morning, I want to feel like I am making a difference,” Soog said. 
 
A five-year-veteran in the field of finance, Soog decided she wanted to open her own business, Grace Invest and Loan. Operating out of Dallas, Texas, the company provides both commercial real-estate and financing. 

Soog understands that buying and selling a business is a serious life decision. She wants her clients to know that they are in good hands. Her team has several years of experience in Dallas. Knowing the market inside and out is what she believes will help her business thrive. 

“I’ve been in the same seat my clients have been in,” Soog said. “I understand both sides.”

In addition to providing financing for real estate, Grace Invest and Loan provides loans and financing for those who need it as well. Soog prides herself on being a one-stop-shop for businesses.  

“With my company, we create customer profiles for our clients,” she said. “They tell us their dream business and we give them the financing they need.”

Soog came to Accion Texas Inc. to help with advertising and marketing. She desires to reach more audiences. With the funds from her loan, she plans to revamp her webpage and sharpen her marketing techniques.

loans.use: to pay for marketing and advertising and to build a better webpage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Fuente De Amor Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras y laboriosas, es coordinado por la señora Francisca quien tiene la edad de 41 años y casada, su negocio es la comercialización de frutas, verduras y leña en su comunidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de repollo, chiltoma, cebolla, zanahoria, ayote, chayote todo al por mayor y flete leña, este es el segundo financiamiento que la institución le brinda a la socia y ha demostrado ser una mujer responsable, uno de sus logros es el aumento y variedad de los productos que ofrece. Las otras socias son las señoras Carmen de 46 años de edad quien comercializa repuestos de bicicletas y Ángela de 31 anos de edad dedicada a comercializar repuestos de bicicleta en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This united group made up of three enterprising and hardworking women is coordinated by Francisca, who is 41 years old and married. Her business is the sale of fruits, vegetables, and firewood in her community. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of cabbage, sweet peppers, onions, carrots, ayote squash, and chayote squash—all at wholesale—, as well as a load of firewood. 

This is the second loan that the institution has provided to this member, and she has demonstrated herself to be a responsible woman. One of her achievements is the increased quantity and variety of the products that she offers.

The other members are Carmen, who is 46 years old and sells bicycle parts, and Ángela, who is 31 years old and earns her living selling bicycle parts in her residence.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, sweet peppers, onions, carrots, ayote squash, and chayote squash at wholesale, and a load of firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sell at retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his sister's education.

loans.name: Mamilita

texts.en: Mamilita has signed up as a member with PMPC. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time borrower like her. Mamilita is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of this good fortune and is requesting capital to restock her sari-sari store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to produce more inventory, pay label-making costs and buy containers to meet the demand for her products

loans.name: Sukartini

texts.en:
Sukartini is an Indonesian artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and semi-precious gemstones for her designs.

Sukartini has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is her story:

"My mother instilled in me the value of a 'Balinese woman,' including how to prepare temple offerings. At the age of 16, I studied at SMIK (Sekolah Menengah Industri Kerajinan) in Gianyar. In this school, I learned batik, ceramics and other home industries for three years. Back from school, I took an apprenticeship with a silversmith in a village where they specialized in jewelry. Today I work together with local silversmiths to promote Bali's beauty in our own way. We make different kinds of jewelry, mostly with sterling silver, in both traditional and modern styles."

"I need some capital to buy silver to prepare my stock for the holiday season, and this microcredit is a wonderful opportunity. I am glad for this support; it means I can go on crafting jewelry. Thank you so much -- I know this microcredit will keep my business going, and will also help me keep my team of silversmiths working."

Use the link below to view Sukartini's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4978

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and semi-precious gemstones for her designs

loans.name: Kenari

texts.en:
Kenari is an Indonesian artisan who specializes in silver jewelry. She would like to invest in a purchase of silver and gemstones for her designs.

Kenari has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

"I come from Celuk, famous for its gold and silversmiths, so I learned to design and craft jewelry from a very young age. In 2003, I married an artist from Gianyar and went to live with his family, like Balinese tradition dictates. However, I obsessed with crafting jewelry and fortunately, my husband understood."


"Now is the time to prepare items for the busy holiday season. I need some capital to buy silver and gemstones. For all of you who support me through the loan, my great thanks to you! This helps me develop my business. I hope this program will be always there because this can help small businesses like mine, which also benefits the silver artisans that work with me."

Use the link below to view Kenari's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5467

loans.use: to purchase silver and gemstones for her designs

loans.name: José Roberto

texts.es:
José de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, quería seguir estudiando pero le tocaba trasladarse hasta la ciudad, y los ingresos de sus padres eran mínimos por lo que se dedicó a apoyarle en los trabajos a su papá. Está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar,  también es la que se encarga el cuidado de su hijo de 4 años de edad.

Él  se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, su padre por medio de las enseñanzas que le hacía fue como lo hizo que fuera una persona de bien para la sociedad, también trabaja como albañil en la zona, trabajo que solo sale esporádicamente, también es pescador, al no tener trabajo se va a pescar. 

El trabajo donde desempeña su actividad agrícola lo tiene cerca de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, su horario de trabajo es de 6 am a 10 am.

El préstamo será invertido en la preparación de la tierra para la siembra, ya que debido a la sequia que azoto el territorio,  los cultivos se le secaron, por lo que lo intentara nuevamente, ya que con el trabajo lleva los granos básicos al hogar y no le toca andarlos comprando, las lluvias han vuelto a la normalidad, por lo que el crédito lo invertirá de la siguiente manera, pagara personas quien le ayuden con los trabajos, comprara los insumo (abonos, herbicidas, semilla). La necesidad satisfecha será el poder tener otra oportunidad para sembrar y poder sacar la cosecha.
texts.en:
José, age 36, studied until the ninth grade. He wanted to continue studying, but he had to move to the city; and his parents’ income was minimal, so he devoted himself to helping his father work.  He lives with his partner, who devotes herself to housekeeping and is responsible for the care of their four-year-old child. 

He works in agriculture. He has been devoting himself to this productive occupation for more than 20 years now, and his father taught him the lessons by which he would become a person that is good for society.  

He also works as a brick layer in the zone, which is work that only comes sporadically. He is also a fisherman—when he doesn’t have work, he goes out to fish. He carries out his agricultural work near his house, making the trip on foot.  His work schedule is from 6 A.M. until 10 A.M. 

The loan will be invested in preparing the soil for planting. The drought that ravaged the territory caused the crops to dry up, so he will try again, as he provides his home with basic grains through this work; and he won't need to purchase them, as the rains have returned to normal.  

He will invest the loan in the following manner: He will pay people to help him with his work, and he will purchase supplies (compost, herbicide, and seed).  The need for another opportunity to plant and to reap a harvest will be met.

loans.use: to pay people to help him with his work, and to purchase supplies (compost, herbicide, and seed).

loans.name: Selene

texts.en:
Selene has owned El Folklor Mexicano for over nine years. She started selling and making alterations to traditional Mexican clothing and accessories that are mostly used in dance presentations. As her business grew, she decided to move to a retail location to attract walk-ins.  

However, two years ago Selene's lease ended, and she decided to move her business back to her home and minimize her overhead expenses. She did not let this seeming set-back deter her, and she continued to persevere, fine-tuning her business to make it work.

Selene is already a successful microfinance client, and has demonstrated an ability to utilize financing to strategically grow her business. She has already paid off two loans from Accion in the past, and is requesting a new Kiva loan to purchase more authentic materials from Oaxaca to build up her inventory.

Selene is passionate about her culture and hopes to use her business to continue sharing its beauty so that it can be preserved for years to come.

loans.use: to purchase more authentic materials from Oaxaca to build up her inventory

loans.name: Nyoman

texts.en:
Nyoman is a Balinese artisan who specializes in sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in a purchase of gemstones and sterling silver for his designs.

Nyoman has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I began learning to carve wood when I was in elementary school. My grandfather, an architect of traditional Balinese buildings and also a senior carver, was very supportive of me. Then my father introduced me to a leading silversmith in my village, and I began to learn from him."

"My great thanks for your attention and support with this microcredit. This will allow me to craft more items, which I hope will help to increase my sales. I hope it will draw more people to buy my jewelry collections, too. Thank you."

Use the link below to view Nyoman's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3703

loans.use: to purchase gemstones and sterling silver for his designs

loans.name: Glee

texts.en: Glee operates a motor transport business.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. For her to continue her business, she is requesting a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repair. She dreams of owning motor units and being able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts/repair

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka is a Balinese artisan who specializes in wood carvings. She would like to hire more carvers to work at her workshop and invest in a bulk purchase of wood.

Eka has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is her story:

"Unfortunately, my husband passed away in 2009 after a long illness, leaving me with a three-year-old daughter and a 10-day-old son. I decided to honor his memory by continuing carving as he did, something I learned from my father at a very young age. Dad would carve and my mother, brothers and I would finish the pieces. We worked this way until I married. My husband liked to carve coconut shells, and we enjoyed developing new styles and designs together, then I would make the samples. Now that I'm the sole provider for my children, I continue to carve coconut shells, and I also carve statuettes from wood. My children are my biggest motivation to work. I always keep my spirit up and go on strong for my children. Thanks to them. I do not falter, and thanks to all of you for always supporting me and for encouraging me to develop new ideas and designs for sculptures so they will always be liked."

"This microcredit will help me prepare new items in time for the holiday season. I need capital to help me produce the large quantity of items needed. I have received loans in the past, and it helped me a lot. Thanks much to you who support me with this loan."

Use the link below to view Eka's wood carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7351

loans.use: to hire more carvers and to purchase wood

loans.name: Tiessiri B Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Tiessiri B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’tiesso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec Korotoumou, arrêtée 3ème de gauche à  droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  1  hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 280 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the TIESSIRI B group are married women and they are, on average, 42 years old with three children each. They all live in traditional families in N'tiesso, a village located in Koutiala (third administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their first loan with the institution.

Korotoumou, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is in the standing row, third from the left.  She is planning to use her loan to buy some agricultural inputs, seeds, small farming equipment, and also to cover her plowing and hoeing cost to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, she will sell her crop to both men and women, in her village and in Koutiala.  She is expecting to make an average profit of 280,000 CFA francs at the end of the planting season. She will use her profit to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover her plowing and hoeing costs, and to buy seeds, agricultural inputs and farming tools.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en: Rebeca has signed up as a member with PMPC and is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time borrower like her. Rebeca is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of this good fortune. She is requesting a loan to restock her sari-sari store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her tore with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Zoila Sarita

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 31 años, es conviviente, conocida en el medio, por la labor de crianza y venta de chivos. Vive en casa propia con cónyuge e hijos de 10 y 03 años respectivamente, los cuales estudian en colegio nacional de la zona. Cónyuge se dedica a trabajar como jornalero agrícola por zona de residencia. Zoila con buenas referencias. Vive en una comunidad ubicada a 30 Km de Chiclayo, antes de Mocupe Nuevo con dirección a Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, habitada por gente respetuosa, que se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Zoila se dedica a la crianza y venta de chivos desde hace 10 años, adicionalmente se dedica a prestar servicio en hogares haciendo limpieza y lavando ropa, ella necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de animales comidas para estos y otra parte para arreglo de casa, lo que le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Zoila is 31 years old and lives with her partner. She is known in the area for her work raising and selling goats. She lives in her own house with her spouse and her children who are 10 and 3 years old. The children are studying in the district's national school. Her spouse works as an agricultural day labourer in the local area. Zoila has good references. She lives in a community located 30km from Chiclayo, (before Mocupe Nuevo if heading towards Chiclayo) in the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Peru. The people who live there are respectful and work in agriculture and livestock.

Zoila has been raising and selling goats for 10 years. Additionally, she also offers her services as a cleaner and laundry-woman. She needs this loan to invest in purchasing animals, animal feed and also to fix her house, which will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals, animal feed and house repairs.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María estudio hasta tercero grado, en su tiempo era escaso el que iba a la escuela, por lo que ella fue afortunada de poder asistir tener acceso a la educación, solo hasta tercer grado daban clases por eso ya no siguió. Se casó a los 24 años, su esposo falleció al tener muy poco tiempo de estar juntos, del matrimonio nacieron 3 hijos, quienes ya son mayores de edad, ellos trabajan, solo un hijo vive con ella.   


María es vendedora de tomates en el mercado, ya tiene varios años de realizar la actividad, la necesidad de tener ingresos la obligaron a dar inicio  al negocio, por hoy está pensando a dedicarse también a la venta de ropa, también es ama de casa, no tenía otro negocio antes de iniciar, de su casa al mercado recorre unos 5 km diarios, recorrido que hace en bus, las ventas las realiza de 6 am a 9 am.


El préstamo lo solicita para comprar ropa para la venta (el tipo de ropa es para señora, faldas, blusas, sostenes), ya que por la falta de lluvia las verduras se han escaseado por lo que necesita tener otra fuente de ingreso. La necesidad satisfecha, es el poder tener capital de trabajo para arrancar con la compra y venta de la mercadería.

Desea seguir en el negocio e ir  poco a poco creciendo en las ventas y la clientela, tener una estabilidad mejor, espera que el negocio le dé más  resultado, con lo que le ayudara a poder tener su propio capital de trabajo, las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y ampliación del negocio.
texts.en:
Maria studied until third grade. There was little time for her to go to school so she was fortunate to be able to attend and to have access to education. Classes were only provided until third grade thus she did not continue. She got married at 24 years old. Her husband passed away, leaving very little time to be together. The married couple had 3 children who are now grown up and working. Only one child lives with her. 

Maria is a tomato salesperson in the market and already has several years of experience in this discipline. The need for money has forced her to start a business. Currently she is thinking of also working in clothing sales. She is also a housewife. She didn't have another business before starting this one. She takes the bus 5 km from her house to the market daily. Sales are conducted from 6 am to 9 am. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy clothes to sell (the type of clothing is for women, skirts, blouses, bras). Due to the lack of rain, vegetables are scare and thus she needs another source of income. Satisfying this need will give her working capital to get started by purchasing and selling merchandise. 

She wants to stay in business and start little by little growing her sales and clientele. To have more stability, she hopes this business will give her better results. With the support she is receiving she will have her own working capital. The earnings will be invested in the loan payments and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell (the type of clothing is for women, skirts, blouses, bras). Due to the lack of rain, vegetables are scare and thus she needs another source of income

loans.name: Komang

texts.en:
Komang is a Balinese artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in a purchase of sterling silver and gemstones for his pieces.

Komang has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is his story:

"I was born to a farm family in 1973, in a small region in Bali that is famous for its traditional art market. Unfortunately my father passed away. As a son, our customs dictate I must replace my father's responsibilities with my family, as well as in social traditions and ceremonies in the community. Thus, my sisters came to live with me, my wife, daughter, and son, until they got married. Growing up in Bali, I saw people carving wood every day, as well as crafting silver jewelry. As a result, I had no difficulties when I started to work as a wood carver. With my talent and skills as a wood carver, and by observing people making jewelry, I started to work with silver, so I could earn a better income than as a wood carver. Bali is very rich in culture and arts, and I began to create my own designs with the help of four friends who are also silversmiths. My designs are inspired by Balinese culture, fashion, and nature.

"I am starting to prepare items for the holiday rush and need capital. Last year, the microcredit was a great help. I hope this time will be the same. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Komang's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3065

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of sterling silver and gemstones for his pieces

loans.name: Oka

texts.en:
Oka is a Balinese artisan who specializes in intricate wood carvings. Oka has taken over the family business after the passing of his father, Ketut. He would like to purchase wood in bulk, for his sculptures.

Oka and his late father, Ketut, have been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is Oka's story:

"I started learning wood carving when I was just an elementary student. I learned the basics of carving from my father and other senior artists, who taught me a lot about design, materials, and different techniques. Now that my father has passed away, I continue his carving legacy. Local Balinese art and culture are deeply related with the everyday practices and customs that have lived on from generation to generation since ancient times. The stories of Ramayana and Mahabharata, which are performed in shows and depicted in the architecture of temples and palaces, also inspire us a lot. Some of the works are in the form of frames, masks, wood panels, etc. The material is obtained from local wood and also from Java, or other islands in Indonesia. The different types I use are sono, acacia, lingua, ebony, teakwood, and coconut wood.

"Many thanks to those who help me with this microcredit. I am preparing for the holiday season and would like to have capital to buy the wood I need."

Use the link below to view Oka's intricate wood masks and carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1454

loans.use: to purchase wood in bulk, for his sculptures.

loans.name: Tiessiri C Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Tiessiri C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’tiesso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec Rokia, arrêtée 3ème de droite à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the TIESSIRI C group are married women and they are, on average, 41 years old with four children each. They all live in traditional families in N'tiesso, a village located in Koutiala (third administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their first loan with the institution.

Rokia, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is in the standing row, third from the right. She is planning to use her loan to buy some agricultural inputs, seeds, small farming equipment, and also to cover her plowing and hoeing costs to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, she will sell her crop to both men and women, in her village and in Koutiala. She is expecting to make an average profit of 100,000 CFA francs at the end of the planting season. She will use her profit to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover her plowing and hoeing costs, and to buy seeds, agricultural inputs and farming equipment.

loans.name: Dianca Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres microempresarios exitosos, quien lo coordina es la señora Olga de 51 años de edad y casada, ofrece el servicio de comida en su domicilio y solicita el crédito para la compra de productos como arroz, carne de res, carne de cerdo, aceite, repollo, lechuga, zanahoria, remolacha, cebolla, chiltoma, apio, etc., todo esto de mejorar la calidad de los productos ofrecidos. Los otros integrantes son jóvenes con espíritu de superación uno de ellos es Josué de 24 años de edad, quien comercializa zapatos y pan en su municipalidad y Jesenia quien tiene la edad de 24 años y se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos AVON.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three successful micro-entrepreneurs and is coordinated by Olga who is 51 years old and is married. She has a food service business that she runs out of her home and is asking for the loan so she can buy products such as rice, beef, pork, oil, cabbage, lettuce, carrots, beets, onions, sweet peppers, celery, etc.  This is so that she can improve the quality of the products she offers.

The other members are young people with the spirit to improve their lot in life. One of them is Josué who is 24 years old and sells shoes and bread in his neighborhood; the other is Jesenia who is 24 and sells Avon cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy food such as rice, beef, pork, oil, cabbage, lettuce, carrots, beets, onion, sweet peppers, celery, etc.

loans.name: Francisco Rogelio

texts.es: Francisco es un microempresario laborioso, quien cada día trabaja para obtener el pan de cada día para su familia, se dedica a la comercialización de gaseosas y golosinas en las afueras de la alcaldía de la municipalidad. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de gaseosas Coca Cola, Big Cola, jugos cítricos, y golosinas y reparar una parte del kisko donde ofrece sus productos.
texts.en: Francisco is a hardworking small business owner who works every day to bring home the daily bread to his family. He makes a living selling soft drinks and candy outside the town hall in his municipality. He is applying for a loan to buy soda such as Coca Cola and Big Cola, citrus juice, and candy. He will also repair part of the kiosk where he sells his products.

loans.use: to buy soda such as Coca Cola and Big Cola, citrus juice, and candy, as well as to repair his kiosk.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa tiene 32 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con sus tres menores hijos de edades 16, 10, 2 años de de edad de los cuales el primero cursa secundaria el segundo primaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pucara. Ella vive en la parte rural de este distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz., esta comunidad queda en la provincia de Jaen, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Tomasa es la venta de salchipollos, salchipapas su local esta ubicado frente a la comisaria de Pucara, cuenta con más de 2 años dedicandose a este rubro, además se dedica a la cria y venta de aves como gallinas ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el credito sin ningun problema; ya que el destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con nuevos productos como bebidas gaseosas, y hacer arreglos a su cocina con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Tomasa, 32, lives in her own house made of basic materials. She lives with her three children, ages 2, 10, and 16. Her oldest child is in high school and the middle child is in elementary school. They study at the national school of the district of Pucara. She lives in a rural area of this district and has running water and light. The community is located in the province of Jaen, which belongs to the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Tomasa's business activity is selling "salchipollos" (sausages, chicken and fried potatoes) and "salchipapas" (sausage and fried potatoes). Her stall is located in front of the Pucara police station. She has two years of experience in this field. She also raises and sells poultry, such as chickens, to earn extra money. This will allow her to pay back the loan without any problems. Tomasa's goal with this loan is to invest in her business by stocking her stall with new products, such as soft drinks, and fixing up her kitchen. She will then earn a higher income, improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to stock her business with new products such as soft drinks and to fix up her kitchen, thereby earning a higher income and improving her quality of life.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her in previous loans, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loans were also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loans assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Geronima hopes to gain more loyal customers and that she will be able to help more provide the needs of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing, footwear, cosmetics and other products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sweets, soap, toothpastes, etc. in bulk to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Villa Paraisp Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Villa Paraíso lo integran tres mujeres emprendedoras lo que las ha hecho propietarias de sus propios negocios, lo coordina la señora Maribel quien tiene la edad de 33 años, acompañada y su negocio gira entorno a la venta de bisuterías y ropa de segunda en su domicilio y comunidad, este negocio lo impulso hace dos años con ayuda de su compañero de vida. Solicita el financiamiento para la compra de productos como es pacas de calidad de camisetas, shorts, pantalones y vestidos, además de invertir en pulseras, aretes, cadenas, brazaletes, etc. Otra de las socias es la joven Gabriela de 22 años de edad, quien se dedica a la comercialización de ropa y cosméticos en su comunidad y Fátima quien tiene la edad de 19 años y comercializa ropa, accesorios además es estilista. El objetivo del grupo es pagar puntualmente sus cuotas para seguir gozando de los beneficios que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Villa Paraiso is made up of three enterprising women who own their own businesses.  It is coordinated by Maribel who is 33 years old and has a life partner.  Her business is selling costume jewelry and used clothing from her home and in her community.  The business was started two years ago with the help of her life partner. She is asking for the loan so she can buy products such as quality bales of undershirts, shorts, pants, and dresses as well as to invest in bracelets, earrings, chains, bangles, etc.

The other members are young Gabriela who is 22 years old and sells clothing and cosmetics in her community; and Fátima who is 19 and sells clothing and accessories and is also a stylist. The group's aim is to make their loan payments on time so they can continue to enjoy the benefits offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy bales of good quality clothing, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Thái

texts.en:
Thái is 44 years old and she is married with 2 children. She works in agriculture, farming food, and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thái's  first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Thái  faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thái  hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick for building a toilet

loans.name: Hạt

texts.en:
Hạt is 47 years old and she is married with 3 children. She works in agriculture, farming food, and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. 

In 2012, Hạt  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hạt has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hạt faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet. With her business profit, Hạt hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick for building a toilet

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia helps her husband in managing their own farm for a living. Her previous loan, used for farming, was successfully repaid with her generated income. She took a new loan recently to buy seeds and fertilizer for this cropping season. She hopes to live comfortably and gain a greater income for their future needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tiessiri D Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe Tiessiri D sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’tiesso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec Foune Madou, assise au milieu  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  1  hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 190 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the TIESSIRI D group are married women and they are, on average, 39 years old with three children each. They all live in traditional families in N'tiesso, a village located in Koutiala (third administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their first loan with the institution.

Foune Madou, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is the woman in the middle of the front row. She is planning to use her loan to buy some agricultural inputs, seeds, small farming equipment, and also to cover her plowing and hoeing costs to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, she will sell her crop to both men and women, in her village and in Koutiala. She is expecting to make an average profit of 190,000 CFA francs at the end of the farming season. She will use her profit to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover her plowing and hoeing costs, and to buy seeds, agricultural inputs and farming tools.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kolomosso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide et le Riz avec  Tata, assise 2ème de gauche à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte.
 Elle compte realiser un bénéfice moyen de 175 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women and they are, on average, 42 years old with three children each. They all live in traditional families in Kolomosso, a village located in Koutiala (third administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their third loan with the institution.  They have duly repaid their previous loans.

Tata, a member of the group, grows groundnut and rice. In the photo, she is in the front row, second from the left. She is planning to use her loan to buy some agricultural inputs, seeds, small farming equipment, and also to cover her plowing and hoeing costs to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, she will sell her crop to both men and women, in her village and in Koutiala. She is expecting to make an average profit of 175,000 CFA francs at the end of the farming season. She will use her profit to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover her plowing and hoeing costs, and to buy seeds, agricultural inputs and farming tools.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh is 36 years old and she is married with 2 children. She operates a food stall selling meat, and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Khanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Khanh has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Khanh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick, to build a toilet. With her business profit, Khanh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick for building a toilet

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: As her husband has retired from work, Evelyn manages a transportation service, using her own motorcycle. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for vehicle maintenance and repairs. To make her services safe, she took a new loan recently, to buy new tires. She wants to buy another vehicle in future, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has 2 children ages 4 and 12 years. In 2000, Mohamed established his cosmetics (hair, nail polish, etc.) business. He began his business because there was no one to pay for his school fees. Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Mohamed requires this loan in order to buy more hair products of different kinds and other cosmetics items for resale. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to build a house and give his children a quality education. He is very hard working and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more hair products of different kinds and other cosmetics items for resale.

loans.name: Khaldeya

texts.en: Because Khaldeya is a conservative lady, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Khaldeya is a 32-year-old lady living in Hashmiya, Jordan. She is a mother of two sons. Her husband Thaher, appearing in the picture, has been running a bakery that was their only source of income for one year. His two sons have been helping him with it. He is planning to open a sweets shop near his bakery in the future which will be a big opportunity to improve his profit. Now he needs to do some repairs to his baking machine which will need a part that he doesn't have enough money to buy. For that, Khaldeya needs to help him by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a part needed to repair her husband's baking machine.

loans.name: Ngoma Tukole Group

texts.en:
Theodoro is a hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a bar as his main source of income, though he also practices farming where he earns extra income. He started this business to sustain his family and have better standards of living. He faces challenges of competition, price fluctuations, and defaulters. He has a vision of owning a big known bar and having educated children.

He is requesting a loan to buy more crates of beer and sodas to sell. He is a member of Ngoma Tukole Group, where each member guarantees the other.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Doyer Luis

texts.es:
Doyer con 32 años de edad vive con su esposa y es padre de 2 hijos. 

Toda su vida fue criado en el campo, donde ha realizado actividades agropecuarias la mayor parte de su vida.  

Actualmente posee cultivos de yuca y plátanos, además complementa con la producción de leche, de varias vacas que son de su propiedad. Tanto la cosecha de plátano y yuca, como los litros de leche que ordeña a diarios, son vendidos en el mercado de la región donde reside, así logra obtener los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. 

Doyer es un hombre serio, responsable, comprometido con su familia y su trabajo, por ello siempre quiere seguir avanzando es busca de un futuro mejor, por esta razón solicita su primer ciclo de crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, semillas de plátano y yuca, entre otros, con el fin de continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y poder sacar una cosecha en óptimas condiciones para poderla vender a un mejor precio en el mercado y obtener más ganancias. 

Todo esto le ayudará a seguir adelante, mejorando poco a poco su nivel de vida y el de sus hijos, a los cuales les podrá ofrecer mejor educación para que tengan un futuro próspero y lleno de éxitos.
texts.en:
Doyer is 32 years old and lives with his wife. He is the father of two children.

Doyer was raised in the country, where he engaged in farming activities for most of his life. He currently has cassava and banana crops, but he also complements this activity with milk production since he has several cows on his property. The bananas and cassava that he harvests, as well as the liters of milk produced each day, are sold at market located in the area where he lives. This enables him to earn sufficient income to cover daily household needs.

Doyer is a serious and responsible man who is committed to his family and his work. For this reason, he wants to keep advancing toward a better future. He is requesting his first loan in order to buy farming supplies such as compost, fertilizers, pesticides, banana and cassava seeds, and other items. This will help him to continue the maintenance of his crops so that he can achieve a harvest under optimal conditions. As a result, he can sell at a better price at the market and generate more income.

All of these steps will help him to continue moving forward so that he can gradually improve his standard of living and that of his children. He will be able to provide them a better education so that they can have a prosperous future that is full of success.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, pesticides, banana and cassava seeds, and other items.

loans.name: Maria Elia Del Carmen

texts.es: María tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 14 años y 5 años de edad y su hijo de 15 años de edad. María se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora quien todos los días recorre las zonas cercanas a su localidad  para ofrecer sus productos de belleza. Cuenta con este negocio desde hace 4 años y cada vez son más los clientes que prefieren sus productos. María desea mejorar las condiciones del piso y de las paredes de un cuarto dormitorio para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, ladrillo de piso, etc. Para repellar las paredes y colocar ladrillo de piso en el cuarto dormitorio de la vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old and resides in her own home along with her husband, her two daughters (ages 14 and 5), and her son (age 15). She is known for being an enterprising woman who travels every day through the areas near her town in order to sell beauty products. María has been in this business for four years and each time she is gaining more customers who prefer to buy her products.

She wants to improve the condition of the floor and walls of a bedroom. For this reason, María is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will buy cement, sand, floor tiles, and other materials in order to whitewash the walls and install a tile floor in the bedroom of her home.

loans.use: to buy materials in order to whitewash the walls and install a tile floor in the bedroom of her home.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to purchase products for her business. The loan is also useful in the education of her children and assists with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy stock of merchandise like men's and women's ready-to-wear items that are necessary to expand her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nora hopes for her business to grow bigger and she wants to expand her store. With this, she could give her children a quality education and better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of merchandise like men's and women's ready-to-wear items

loans.name: Gharam

texts.en: Gharam is a 22-year-old, single lady, living in Mafraq, Jordan. She is a university student majoring in English Language and Literature, and she is in her third year. Gharam is planning to get her Bachelor's, so that she will find a good job in her study field. But she doesn’t have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel  es  originario de la comunidad el sardinal tiene 32 años de edad  gracias al apoyo de sus padres dice logro terminar la escuela primaria, después el ya no quiso continuar porque quería ayudar  a su padre a trabajar además quería ganar , así que trabajaba en el campo sembrando frijoles maíz, banano  patriota, así como siembra de café  así trabajo por mucho tiempo  y poco a poco se hizo de sus cosas ,  desde bien temprana edad se casó  y y ha procreado 4 hijos  ellos van  a la escuela de la comunidad  y si dice que él los apoyara lo más que puedan para que ellos salgan adelante  y puedan defenderse  cuando ya sean grandes , en la comunidad no hay energía eléctrica  y él  quiere mejorar la condición de vida de sus seres queridos  es por eso que desea aplicar a crédito para así poder comprar un sistema solar e instalarlo en su humilde vivienda .
texts.en:
Samuel, 32, is originally from the community of El Sardinal. Thanks to the support of his parents, he was able to finish elementary school. Afterwards, he did not want to continue studying because he wanted to help his father, so he worked in the fields planting beans, corn, and banana plants as well as coffee. He worked for a long time and married at a young age. He now has four children who go to the community school. He will support them as much as he can so that they move forward and are able to defend themselves when they are older. 

In their community, there is no electricity and he wants to improve the living conditions of his loved ones. Therefore, he would like to apply for a loan to buy a solar power system and install it in his humble home.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita has been earning from her general store for more than seven years, and it helps well to sustain their living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods. 

To increase sales, she took a new loan to purchase more varieties of grocery goods to resell. Rita wants to improve her business to have a better standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more thyme seedlings for the family farm.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is a 21-year-old university student, majoring in Political Science. She is in her fourth year. She is planning to continue her studies until she gets her Master's degree, so that she will find a good job that will help her support her family, financially.

Now, she needs a laptop for her study. It would enable her to do her homework and researches. But she doesn't have enough money to buy it, or to pay for her upcoming semester fees. Therefore, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a laptop and pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 22 year-old Zainab. She is married and has one child who is 3 months old. She has one additional dependent who lives with her for schooling. 

In 2011, Zainab established her cotton and lace business. She began her business because after she left from school there was no job. Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Zainab would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. She requires this loan in order to buy more cotton and lace of different kinds for resale. 

In the future, Zainab wants to generate more income to further her education into the university level. She is very hard working and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cotton and lace of different kinds for resale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 25-year-old, separated woman, living in Wehdat, Jordan. She has been supporting herself by selling cosmetic products, holding “MAC” brand to beauty salons, for three years. She recently earned a good discount from “MAC” that she can benefit from, if she can buy a large amount of their products. This discount would significantly raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to buy the required quantity. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of MAC brand cosmetic products, qualifying for a discount.

loans.name: Kimhorth

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Kirivong district of Takeo province, Kimhort is a 37-year-old married father of four dependent children, two of whom are in school while another two are too young for school. Rice faming has been the main source of his family’s income for 16 years, and to better support the family and help to earn more income he also works as a teacher. He earns about $13 USD per day to meet his family’s daily needs and manage to save about $4 USD each day for their future needs. 

Kimhort has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. Now he is asking for a loan to pay for his school fees. He hopes this loan will enable him to study until graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Cantares Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo conforman tres socias exitosas en su vida laboral, es coordinado por la señora Alma una mujer emprendedora de 33 años de edad, acompañada y madre de tres hijos, se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías en bambú, como es canastos, roperas y otros artículos, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de varas de bambú, clavo, barniz, polillo de 11 pulgada, etc. Las otras integrantes son Lillyam de 41 años de edad, comerciante de frutas y verduras en la municipalidad y el crédito lo invertirá en cosecha de mamón y la señora Cándida de 55 años de edad quien se dedica a comercializar frutas en la municipalidad.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three members who are successful in their working lives. The group is coordinated by Alma, an enterprising 33-year old woman. She is in a relationship and has three children. She makes artisanal products out of bamboo, such as baskets, wardrobes, and other items. She has applied for a loan to buy bamboo sticks, nails, varnish, 11-inch sticks, etc.

One of the other members of this group are Lillyam, 41, who sells fruit and vegetables in the municipality. She will invest this loan in papaya crops. Cándida, 55, makes a living selling fruit in the municipality.

loans.use: to buy bamboo sticks, nails, varnish, 11-inch sticks, etc.

loans.name: Harbiya

texts.en: Harbiya is a married lady in her forties. She is a mother of two, living in Baqaa, Jordan. Her husband is a retired man. For three years, Harbiya has been helping her husband in improving their living conditions, by selling homemade detergents at her house. Her business was the second-income provider for her family. Now she is seeking a loan that will help her expand her business, by getting more raw materials that she needs for making detergents.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making detergents, for her business.

loans.name: Samai

texts.en:
Samai is 36-years-old and married. He lives with his family in a rural area located in the Kiri Vong district of Takeo province. He has two dependent children to take care of, and now they are in school. Rice farming is the primary source of his family’s income to make a living and he has been in this business for 16 years. To supplement the income, he also works as a teacher in the local area. 

This is the first microloan for Samai with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He is now applying for a loan to pay for his school fee. He hopes to have a better job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es: Marivel es una microempresaria laboriosa y entusiasta, que ha luchado para darle lo mejor a su familia, tiene la edad de 53 años, soltera. Comercializa carne de pollo y embutidos en su domicilio, la socia con los crédito anteriores ha logrado mejorar su negocio, además de la compra de electrodoméstico y mantenimiento de un frízer, el cual ha sido uno de sus mayores logros, debido a que es donde mantiene los productos que comercializa, y se ha propuesto ampliar su negocio, por tal razón solicita el crédito para la compra de carne de pollo como es pierna, pechuga con ala, pechuga especial, muslos, chincaca, chorizo, mortadela, etc.
texts.en:
Marivel is an industrious and enthusiastic micro-entrepreneur who strives to provide the best for her family. She is 53 years old and single. Marivel sells chicken and cured meats from her home. With her previous loans, she was able to improve her business. She was also able to purchase a household appliance and pay for the maintenance of a freezer, which has been one of her greatest accomplishments since she uses it to preserve the products that she sells.

Marivel plans to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy chicken pieces such as legs, breasts with the wing, split breasts, thighs, and backbones, as well as chorizo, mortadela, and other products.

loans.use: to buy chicken pieces, chorizo, mortadela, and other products.

loans.name: Flor Del Oto Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Flor del Oto está integrado por tres microempresarios emprendedores y es coordinado por la señora Karla de 23 años de edad y soltera, quien se dedica a la comercialización de productos varios, desde hace ocho años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de sombrillas, blusas, camisolas, talladores, pinturas labiales, toallas, etc., con el fin de seguir creciendo en su negocio, pues con el crédito anterior obtuvo mayores ingresos por invertir en variedad de productos. Los otros socios son la señora Flor  de 23 años de edad quien comercializa productos varios como es chinelas, toallas, blusas, etc., y el señor Roger quien tiene 40 años de edad y comercializa frutas en la municipalidad.
texts.en:
The Flor del Oto group is made up of three enterprising small business owners, coordinated by Karla. She is 23 years old and single. She has made a living selling various products for eight years. She has applied for a loan to buy hats, blouses, shirts, tank tops, lipstick, towels, etc. Her goal is to continue growing her business. With her last loan, she earned a higher income to invest in a variety of products.

The other members of this group are Flor, 23, who sells various products such as slippers, towels, and blouses, and Roger, 40, who sells fruit in the municipality.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio tiene 20 años de edad, es estudiante del 3er año de la carrera de Contabilidad, vive con sus padres, uno de ellos es docente, tiene hermanos menores, ella es la primera en estudiar una carrera universitaria.
Ella piensa continuar estudiando y preparar su tesis, mientras tanto está buscando un trabajo para poder pagar ella misma sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder seguir estudiando y poder pagar las cuotas de sus estudios. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Rocio is 20 years old and is a 3rd year accounting student. She lives with her parents, one of whom is a teacher. She has younger siblings and she´s the first to go to university. She would like to continue studying and prepare her thesis, and she´s looking for a job to be able to pay for her studies herself. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to keep studying and so she can pay for her tuition. She´s grateful for this opportunity that she´s receiving, it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Darwin José

texts.es:
Autos tras autos, llenan el pequeño establecimiento de autolavado y vulcanización de Darwin, un joven de 33 años, quien siempre se ha visto apasionado por la mecánica y todo lo relacionado con carros. Todo inició cuando viajó a Costa Rica a trabajar como ayudante mecánico por tres años, hasta decidió regresa con un dinero ahorrado, para empaparse más en el tema. Estudió un técnico en Mecánica automotriz y decidió establecer su propio negocio, el cual ha funcionado por tres años. El ser padre de dos hijos de las edades de once y tres años, para él es una inspiración más para salir adelante, para proporcionarle un futuro próspero.  
Darwin recibe el apoyo de sus padres y de su pareja, quienes no dudan en ser parte de su avance profesional, pues además de ser familia, no tiene otros ingresos económicos. Él sueña con llegar ampliar el taller, proporcionar otros materiales de ventas y otros servicios como mecánica y venta de repuestos automotrices. Sin embargo, para ello necesita trabajar fuerte primero, por lo que necesita de un préstamo para comprar parches, pega y una máquina de presión de agua para lavar vehículos, lo que le permitirán mejorar sus servicios, equipara los materiales y aumentar el número de clientes. Ayuda a Darwin a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Car after car, they fill Darwin´s small self-washing and vulcanization business. A young man of 33 years old, he has always been fascinated by mechanics and everything related to cars. It all started when he traveled to Costa Rica to work as a mechanical assistant for 3 years until he decided to return home with the money he had saved to get more involved in this kind of work. He studied a technical degree in automotive mechanics and decided to start his own business which he´s been running for 3 years. He is the father of 2 children who are 11 and 3 years old. They are his inspiration to move forward and to create a better future. 

Darwin received support from his parents and his partner who were very much a part of his professional advancement because they´re not only his family but also the only economic support he has. He dreams of being able to make his workshop bigger, getting other materials to sell, as well as providing other mechanical services and supplies. Nevertheless, he needs to work hard first, which is why he needs a loan to buy patches, glue and a pressure washer to wash cars. This will allow him to improve his services, stock his supplies and increase his number of customers. Please help Darwin achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy patches, glue and a pressure washer to wash cars.

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en: Raghda was born in 1979. She is a married lady living in Madaba-Jordan with her 4 sons and daughters. Her husband is serving in the military. Raghda has been supporting her husband in improving their living conditions by selling clothing for the last four years. She started her business selling a small quantity of them. Later on, she started a new business making mosaics. Now she is seeking a loan to expand her business by buying a larger amount of raw material for making mosaics in addition to a new collection of clothes to raise her profit.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and raw materials for making mosaics

loans.name: Ricardo Eduardo

texts.es: Ricardo nació y creció en la comunidad el sardinal  creció en un hogar bien humilde y con bastantes limitaciones de dinero, logro estudiar solo segundo grado de primaria  en la escuela de la comunidad, aprendió a temprana edad  a trabajar en el  campo gracias a Dios eso   hoy en día le ayudado  para poder trabajar   y sacar adelante a su esposa y su hijo que son lo más importante en su vida,   su ilusión  es  poder tener energía en su hogar ya que  estar a oscuras es muy triste  y el proyecto de electrificación en la comunidad  nunca se aprobó es por eso que quiere un crédito para así el poder comprar un sistema solar para su hogar.
texts.en:
Ricardo was born and raised in the community of El Sardinal. He grew up in a very humble home, with very limited money, and he was able to study only through the second grade of primary school in the community school. He learned to work in the fields at an early age; and thanks to God, this has helped him to be able to work and provide for his wife and child, who are what is most important in his life. 

His dream is to be able to have electricity in his home, as being in the dark is very sad, and the electrification project in the community was never approved. That is why he wants a loan.  This way, he can purchase a solar system for his home.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system.

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
Evelin vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Su madre es comerciante y su padre es odontólogo. Sus metas futuras son la de trabajar en lo que va a ser su profesión de enfermera, independizarse seguir estudiando para obtener un buen ingreso y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de libros, estetoscopio y pago de cuotas que le será de mucha ayuda y le permitir seguir luchando.
texts.en:
Evelin lives with her parents and her siblings in the city of San Lorenzo.  Her mother is a businesswoman and her father is a dentist. Her future goals are: to work in what will be her profession—nursing, to become independent, to continue studying in order to earn a good income, and to help her family.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest it in the purchase of books, a stethoscope, and the payment of fees. This will be a great help, and will allow her to continue fighting.

loans.use: to pay fees, and to purchase books and a stethoscope.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein was born in 1969. He is a married retired man and a father of five daughters. After he was retired he started his own business running a garage doing car services and repair 8 years ago to gain an additional income since his pension wasn't enough to cover his children's needs. Now he is seeking to buy new tools for his garage and to repair it. He doesn't have enough money to do so because of the financial crisis he recently faced. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his garage and to repair it

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en: Rawan is a 20-year-old single lady living in Hashmiya-Jordan with her parents and 10 siblings. She is a diploma student majoring in accounting and she is in her second year. Rawan is seeking to finish her studies so that she will find a good job in her field to start helping her family financially. She doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Sriyani

texts.en: Sriyani and her husband run a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and electronic bill payment service for customers. They live in Bekasi, a satellite city located at the east of Jakarta. Sriyani joined Ruma 3 months ago, but her mobile airtime sales can take up to 150 transactions per day. She feels excited to continue running the business with support and assistance from Ruma. As the business continues to grow she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable her to process more airtime sales on weekends. This loan will help her running the mobile airtime business and support her plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. In the photo, Sriyani is standing on the left with the Ruma agent.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está estudiando la carrera de Enfermería, comenta que su meta es poder ser una licenciada y poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su trabajo.
Ella sueña con ser una profesional útil a las demás personas y a sí misma. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Daisy is from the city of Paraguarí. She is studying nursing. Her goal is to graduate from her degree and to be able to help others through her work.

She dreams of being a professional who is useful to other people and to herself. She is applying for this loan to pay her university tuition fees so that she can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Leydy

texts.es:
Leydy, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, estudia, y está cursando el primer año   de la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial.
Ella es una persona que quiere salir adelante por medio de su esfuerzo y sacrificio y por medio de sus estudios es por eso que se esta esforzando por sobresalir.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de una notebook para así poder culminar sus estudios y llegar a la meta de ser un Profesional y poder servir a su familia
texts.en:
Leydy is from the city of Curuguaty and is a student in her first year of a Commercial Engineering degree. She is a person who wants to get ahead through her effort and sacrifice and with her studies.  This is why she is striving to excel.  

She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of a Notebook so that she can complete her studies and achieve her goal of becoming a professional and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy a Notebook.

loans.name: Casmuah

texts.en: Casmuah is a housewife who manages a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and electronic bill payment service for customers. Casmuah’s husband works as a full time security officer. They live in Bekasi, a satellite city located at the east of Jakarta. Casmuah joined Ruma 2 years ago. Her mobile airtime sales are ranging from 75 - 150 transactions per day. She feels excited to continue running the business with the support and assistance from Ruma. As the business continues to grow, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable her processing more airtime sales on weekends. This loan would help her running the mobile airtime business and support her plan to seek for more business opportunities in the future. Casmuah is the one in the photo.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase medicine, and pay for medical exams and ultrasounds

loans.name: Sahroni

texts.en: Meet Sahroni. Sahroni lives in West Bandung, a regency area in West Java. Sahroni is married and he has a one-year-old daughter. Sahroni runs a small grocery shop that sells consumer goods, mobile phone airtime credits, and he also has an auto repair shop. He began working with Ruma a month ago because he wanted to increase his income. Nowadays, Sahroni can process up to 75 transactions per day. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends. In the photo, Sahroni is standing beside the drinking water refill depot in his small shop.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Euis

texts.en: Euis and her son live in Tasikmalaya, a city located about three hours from Bandung, West Java. To support her family she runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, consumer goods and mobile phone airtime credits. She joined Ruma because she was interested to try selling mobile airtime and she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. Nowadays, Euis’ mobile airtime sales can range from 40-79 transactions per day. As the business runs, Euis hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. In the photo, Euis is standing in front of her small shop.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Saefulloh

texts.en: Saefulloh is a married man who lives with his wife and his one-year-old son in Yogyakarta. Saefulloh’s wife is a fulltime housewife. Saefulloh works in a garment factory. To support his family, Saefulloh needs to find another source of income. Saefulloh joined Ruma a month ago and he decided to start out selling mobile airtime. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him run his mobile airtime business and consequently support his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es de la ciudad de Pilar, vive en casa de sus padres, tiene una hermana, está trabajando y a la vez está estudiando la carrera de Derecho y Ciencias Políticas, último año.
Comenta que su meta es llegar a culminar sus estudios para escalar en la vida, tanto económica como personalmente ya que su trabajo va enfocado a ello.
Pide este trabajo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de transporte y en la compra de los insumos para su universidad, ya que así podrá seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
