Pedro is from the city of Pilar.  He lives at home with his parents and has one sister. He works and goes to school where he is in his last year as a Law and Political Science student.

He states that his goal is to complete his studies and to get ahead in life both economically and personally, as this is what his work is focused on. He is asking for this loan so he can invest it in his transportation expenses and in buying the supplies he needs for university. This will allow him to continue studying as he has been doing. He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving to be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to buy supplies for university and to cover transportation costs.

loans.name: Noong Luong 12 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thom, 27, is a Thai lady who has worked at farming with lots of experience. She currently lives in a small Thai traditional house with other seven members in her family, including her parents-in-law, her two brothers-in-law and her husband along with her two children. Her son is at grade 2 and attends school fully while her daughter is 2 years old and looked after by her parents-in-law when she works on the rice field. 

Thom and her husband take the main responsibility in providing for the family. They mostly work at agriculture production such as raising chickens, pigs, fish and growing rice, and fruit. Besides, her husband works extra for local construction employer to better cover living expenses for the family. 

This is the third loan that Thom has had in Anh Chi Em Program. She said that she was really interested in the loan and training services of the Program. In the previous loan from Anh Chi Em, she bought fish food and thanks to the training techniques in raising fish she received, she produced a high yield and received a good profit. This time she will continue using the loan to buy fish food and expand her fish farming. 

She hopes this business plan will improve significantly her family income so that she can afford to buy her children new toys and books, as well as purchase some new furniture for her house. 

In the picture, Thom stands first from the right on the first line, with a very pretty smile on her face.

loans.use: to buy fish food for her fish business

loans.name: Cecep

texts.en: Cecep is a married man who lives with his wife and his three children in Sumedang, a small city located about two hours from Bandung, West Java. Cecep is a civil servant and in order to support his family, Cecep needs to find another source of income. He joined Ruma a month ago and he decided to start out selling mobile airtime. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him run the mobile airtime business and consequently supporting his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. Cecep thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Grupo No Me Olvides Group

texts.es:
El “Grupo No Me Olvides” eligió identificarse bajo el antiguo nombre de la comunidad donde viven los integrantes. La comunidad está ubicada en una zona cañera y cerca se encuentran tres ingenios donde la caña es sometida a una serie de procesos para posteriormente obtener azúcar la cual se vende en la misma zona y a empresas mundialmente reconocidas. En la comunidad se respira aire puro, fresco, el cantar de los pájaros alegra el camino entre los cañales que se deben cruzar para llegar hasta donde esta el grupo de prestatarios. Duarante las mañanas despejadas, desde la carretera se puede observar el llamado Pico de Orizaba, volcán más elevado de México.

Gregorio, el único hombre del grupo, se ha dedicado desde hace ya 4 años a la elaboración y venta de pizza, la cual prepara en casa con ayuda de su esposa. Comenta que lo que lo inspiró a iniciar con esta actividad fue precisamente su gusto por esta especialidad italiana así como el sueño de algún día lograr lo que ve en televisión (aventar  la masa de la pizza hacia arriba y que no se rompa). Explica que al principio vendía la pizza por rebanada y solo preparaba dos o tres pizzas cada tercer día, mientras se "aclientaba" (darse a conocer y ganar clientes). Hoy en día, Gregorio prepara de 5 a 6 pizzas; 4 o 5 las vende completas y lo demás por rebanadas. De la misma manera, cuando hay convivios en la primaria, en la telesecundaria y en el telebachillerato de la región casi siempre acuden a él para hacer pedidos. Con las ganancias que obtiene, sustenta los gastos de su hogar y reinvierte en el negocio. Gregorio necesita comprar mercancía en mayor cantidad (charolas, harina, queso, piña, jamón y peperoni) pues su plan es abrir una pizzería, vender todos los días y hacer entregas a domicilio.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Lucia-Venta De Refrescos, Aguas Y Frituras, Aurelia -Venta De Refrescos, Lorena - Venta De Antojitos, Maura - Venta De Abarrotes, Sara - Venta De Dulces, Julia - Venta De Pollo.

*En la foto: Gregorio viste una playera a rayas.
texts.en:
The No Me Olvides group chose to be identified under the old name of the community where the members live. The community is located in a sugar cane area and nearby there are three sugar factories where the sugar cane is taken through a series of processes to extract the sugar that's sold in the same area, and to companies known worldwide. On clear mornings, the tallest volcano in Mexico, Pico de Orizaba, can be seen from the highway.

Gregorio, the only man in the group, has worked for four years making and selling pizza, which he makes at home with his wife's help. He says that he was inspired to start this work by his love of Italian food and so he can one day do what he sees on TV (throw up the pizza dough without breaking it). He says that, at first, he sold pizza by the slice and only made two or three pizzas every three days while he gained customers. Today, Gregorio makes 5 or 6 pizzas, 4 or 5 are sold whole and the rest by the slice. Also, when there are gatherings at the elementary school, secondary school, and college in the region, they almost always contact him with orders. With the money he earns, he pays household expenses and reinvests in his business.

Gregorio needs to buy top quality merchandise (charcoal, flour, cheese, pineapple, ham, and pepperoni). His plan is to open a pizzeria, sell them every day, and make home deliveries.

The other members of the group are:

Lucia (sells drinks, water, and fried food), Aurelia (sells drinks), Lorena (sells snacks), Maura (sells groceries), Sara (sells sweets), Julia (sells chicken).

In the photo, Gregorio is wearing a striped shirt.

loans.use: to buy trays, flour, cheese, pineapple, ham, and pepperoni.

loans.name: Maryori Graciela

texts.es:
Maryori Graciela tiene 22 años años de edad, es madre soltera con muchas aspiraciones para su pequeña hija y su familia. Se considera una persona muy responsable en su vida personal y en su vida estudiantil, es puntual, disciplinada y sobre todo solidaria.
Maryori considera que la motivación diaria para continuar estudiando y seguir afrontando la vida es su familia y su hija, ya que desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y brindar una buena educación a su pequeña, reconoce y admira el esfuerzo que su madre ha echo por ella al apoyarla en sus estudios y ayudarle en el cuidado de su hija se siente comprometida a ser una persona de éxitos.
La joven desea contribuir a su país mediante su superación, ya que hoy en día los jóvenes se enfrentan a una situación difícil.
texts.en:
Maryori Graciela is 22 years old. She is a single mother with great aspirations for her small daughter and her family. She is considered a very responsible person in her personal life and in her student life: she is punctual, disciplined and above all has solidarity with others. 

Maryori believes that her daily motivation to keep studying and facing life's challenges is her family and her daughter, since she wants to improve their standard of living and provide a good education to her little one. She recognizes and admires the efforts her mother has made for her by supporting her in her studies and helping her care for her daughter. She feels committed to being a successful person. 

This young woman wants to contribute to her country by improving herself, since young people today are facing a difficult environment.

loans.use: to complete her university degree.

loans.name: El Bulevar Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo El Bulevar eligieron el nombre porque siempre se reúnen justamente frente al bulevar en su comunidad. 

Cada uno de los integrantes tiene una actividad económica con la cual obtienen ingresos que utilizan para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. Algunos de ellos tienen trabajo estable o por periodo durante la zafra (corte de caña) pues la comunidad es 100% cañera. Las actividades en la localidad se dividen en dos periodos importantes: 6 meses son de molienda de caña en el ingenio, mismo que vende el azúcar a una empresa global de refresco de cola. El azúcar también se comercializa en la localidad y durante la zafra a los obreros se les regala 6 bultos de azúcar. El otro periodo, es decir, los otros 6 meses son de reparación que consiste en darle mantenimiento a la maquinaria del ingenio para proceder con la molienda de caña.

Don Fernando es uno de los integrantes del grupo, está casado con la señora Elvira con quien tiene 4 hijos. Desde hace ya 6 años, él estableció su propio taller; al principio trabajaba con su tío del cual aprendió el oficio de mecánico, pero decidió independizarse y ahora obtiene sus propias ganancias. Don Fernando trabaja todos los días de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm y cuando los clientes le llaman por cualquier urgencia. Don Fernando comenta que se siente muy a gusto en su tercer ciclo de crédito en VisionFund México, quien le ha brindado la oportunidad de hacer crecer tu taller. Él quisiera invertir en tornillos, soldadura, aceite, grasa, cable, pinzas y otras herramientas para poder continuar con su actividad. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Inés: Venta De Cosméticos
Gabino: Venta De Perfumes
Genaro: Venta De Papelería
Rafael: Venta De Carne
María Agripina: Venta De Cosméticos
Benedicta: Venta De Cosméticos
Raúl: Venta De Soldaduras
Laurencio: Venta De Calzado Por Catálogo

*En la foto: Don Fernando viste playera blanca y se encuentra en la extrema derecha.
texts.en:
The members of the El Bulevar group selected the name because they always meet exactly in front of the boulevard in their community.  Each one of the members has a business activity with which they get income that they use to meet their families’ needs.  Some of them have stable work or for a period of time during the season for cutting sugarcane.  The community is 100% involved with sugarcane.  

The business activities in the area are divided into two important periods.  There are six months of grinding the sugarcane in the refinery.  The sugar is sold to a global soft drink cola company, and it is also sold in the area.  During the harvest the workers are given six bales of sugar.  The other period, that is to say, the other six months are for repairing, which consists of providing maintenance to the machinery in the refinery.  This is done in order to proceed with grinding the sugar.

Fernando is one of the members of the group.  He is married to Elvira, and they have four children.  Six years ago he established his own workshop.  At first he worked with his uncle from whom he learned the mechanics trade.  However, he decided to become independent.  He now has his own earnings.  Fernando works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. and whenever the customers call him for any emergency.  Fernando says that he is very pleased in his third loan cycle with VisionFund México, which has given him the opportunity to make his shop grow.  He would like to invest in screws, soldering materials, oil, lubricant, cables, pliers, and other tools in order to be able to continue with his business activity.  

The other members of the group are:
Inés: Sells cosmetics
Gabino: Sells perfume
Genaro: Sells stationery
Rafael: Sells meat
María Agripina: Sells cosmetics 
Benedicta: Sells cosmetics
Raúl: Sells soldering
Laurencio: Sells shoes by catalog.
*In the photo:  Fernando is wearing a white t-shirt and is on the far right.

loans.use: to buy tools for his mechanic's shop.

loans.name: Dania Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dania está integrado por 15 mujeres y 1 hombre, todos los miembros del grupo viven en una comunidad donde la tranquilidad y la hospitalidad de las personas es lo que hace que uno encuentre la paz. La mayoría de los habitantes se dedican al trabajo en campo: algunos son grandes productores de caña y otros siembran maíz, nanche, hule e incluso duraznos.

Los integrantes del grupo son los siguientes:
Gabriela -Venta De Maiz Y Tortillas, Araceli -Venta De Manualidades, Georgina -Venta De Calzado Por Catalogo, Maria Griselda- Venta De Bisuteria, Anastacia -Venta De Abarrotes, Maria De Jesus -Venta De Antojitos, Maria V- Venta De Alimento Y Cerdos, Evangelina -Venta De Ropa, Marco -Venta De Antojitos, Maria L - Venta De Pan Y Ropa, Blanca Estela -Venta De Pan, Susana -Venta De Lenceria Para Dama, Irene -Servicio De Molino, Karla -Venta De Ropa, Nayrobi -Venta De Chacharas y Nieves - Venta de Comida.

La  señora Nieves  ha dedicado 10 años de su vida a vender tamales, hielitos, paletas y chicharrones de manera ambulante. Todos los días acomoda la mercancía en su carretilla y comienza la acción: la venta en las calles de su comunidad. Los habitantes ya conocen su carretilla y le llaman "la carretilla de todo un poco". A Nievesle agrada salir en su localidad y dos veces por semana acude a Tezonapa a vender tamales con los trabajadores del municipio quienes ya son sus clientes. 

Asimismo, en casa de Nieves otra actividad se desarrolla día a día: el servicio de carpintería, donde trabaja toda la familia (hijo, esposo, hija y ella). Nieves ha sido integrante del grupo Dania desde que se le otorgó el primer préstamo y es por eso que da las gracias a VisionFund pues para ella fue una gran oportunidad para seguir disfrutando lo que hace.

Nieves quiere invertir su préstamo en la compra de vasos, fruta, chiles, maíz, gas, bolsas para los hielitos, palos de paleta, manteca, carne de pollo, pasta para los chicharrones y de esta forma continuar con la venta  y satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes.

*En la foto: Doña Nieves viste de blusa negra.
texts.en:
The “Dania” communal bank is composed of 15 woman and one man. All the members of the group live in a community where the peacefulness and hospitality of the people allow you to feel peaceful. The majority of it's inhabitants work in the fields. Some grow sugar cane, others grow corn, nanche (a flowering plant in the acerola family), rubber and even peaches.

The members of the group are the following: Gabriela who sells corn and tortillas, Araceli sells handicrafts, Georgina sells footwear from catalogues, Maria Griselda sells jewellery, Anastacia sells groceries, Maria De Jesus sells snacks, Maria V sells meals and pigs, Evangelina sells clothing, Marco sells snacks, Maria L sells bread and clothing, Blanca Estela sells bread, Susana sells lingerie for women, Irene has a mill, Karla sells clothing and Nayrobi sells bric-a-brac, ice-cream and meals.

Nieves has spent 10 years of her life selling tamales, ice, Popsicles and pork cracklings in the streets. Every day she arranges her merchandise in her cart and begins her work, selling in the streets of her community. The locals know her and call it “the cart with a bit of everything”

Nieves enjoys getting out of her community and twice a week she goes to Tezonapa to sell tamales to the municipal workers who are now her clients. Also in Nieve's house another activity takes place each day, carpentry. All the members of the family, her husband, son, daughter and herself participate in this work. Nieves has been a member of this communal bank since it's first loan. So she thanks VisionFund as it has been a great opportunity for her to enjoy what they do.

Nieve wants to invest the loan in buying cups, fruit, chilies, corn, gas, bags for the ice, Popsicle sticks, lard, chicken and pasta for the pork cracklings. By doing this she can continue with her sales and satisfy the tastes of her customers. In the photo Nieves is wearing the black blouse.

loans.use: to buy cups, fruit, chilies, corn, gas, bags, Popsicle sticks, lard, chicken and pasta.

loans.name: Jeferson Neil

texts.es:
Jeferson es un joven muy responsable, soltero de 21 años de edad y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres pudo estudiar la carrera de Mecánica y actualmente trabaja en una empresa de Aceros muy prestigiosa. Gracias a la excelente educación recibida de sus padres hoy es una persona de bien y con un buen desempeño en su centro laboral.
Jeferson quiere obtener ingresos adicionales para poder apoyar a su familia, es por ello que él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque gracias al apoyo brindado él podrá comprar materiales de soldadura para poder dedicarse a este negocio y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres. Con esto seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder terminar de construir su casa y brindar un futuro mejor a sus padres.
texts.en:
Jeferson is a very responsible young man.  He is 21 years old and single.  He lives in Ica with his family.  Thanks to his parents’ support, he was able to study for a career in mechanics.  He currently works in a very prestigious steel company.  Thanks to the excellent upbringing that he received from his parents, he is now a good person with a good performance in his work center.

Jeferson wants to get additional income in order to be able to support his family.  That is why he is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the provided support, he will be able to buy soldering materials in order to be able to devote himself to this business.  This way he will be able to improve his parents’ quality of life.  With this he will continue putting forth great effort so that, later on, he will be able to finish building his house and provide his parents with a better future.

loans.use: to buy soldering materials to start a business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Juanita works hard to support her family. She has a personal products retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Juanita is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more personal items to sell to customers.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal items to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 68 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from clothing sales. Letecia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mahibanu

texts.en:
Mahibanu hails from a small village of Dhupguri. She is a 31-year-old woman married to a farmer, Jaherul. They live in Madhya Boragari village in West Bengal, India. The couple has two children (one son and one daughter) who are in school. Mahibanu lives with her children and husband. They together take care of all the household expenses. 

Her husband has been involved in farming. He grows paddy and vegetables and sells the harvest to the vendors and green grocers. He also supplies paddies and rice to the rice dealers in the nearby market. Mahibanu also assists her husband in this business.

The major part of their locality is covered with agricultural land, and paddy is cultivated widely in the region, so they have to face competitors in the market.
 
In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Mahibanu is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and seeds and to cover their operational costs of cultivating paddy. Their goal is to increase their business.

She hopes the loan will enable her to earn additional income to provide a better lifestyle to her family and purchase more agricultural land for them.

She conveys her thanks to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start building his home from local materials.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un empeñoso profesional del Distrito de Calleria, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres. Gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres estudió la carrera de Contabilidad y hoy se desempeña como Notificador Coactivo, labor que lleva a cabo en la Municipalidad de la región. Realiza una excelente labor de campo y oficina, se desempeña con mucho esmero, ahínco y pasión, pues le encanta mucho su trabajo, lo cual se ve reflejado en los buenos resultados que obtiene.
Manuel quiere realizar los trámites de regularización del título de Propiedad de la moto que maneja, así como compra de SOAT y Licencia de Conducir, él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá iniciar con estos trámites y así poder seguir laborando con mucho empeño. Con esto seguirá luchando para poder sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Manuel is an enterprising professional from the district of Calleria. He is single and lives with his parents. Thanks to his parents efforts, he studied Accounting and today works as a Combined Notification Agent, which he does in the region's municipality. He is a great worker both outdoors and in the office, doing his work with care, effort, and passion. He loves his job, which is reflected in the good results he achieves.

Manuel wants to complete the regulatory paperwork for the title of the moto he owns, and also buy SOAT (insurance) and a driver's license. He is very grateful for Kiva lenders because the help they provide will allow him to start the paperwork and keep working at his job. With this, he will keep fighting to move his family forward and provide them with a better future.

loans.use: to complete regulatory documents for owning his moto.

loans.name: Manija

texts.en:
Manija is a young, 26-year-old woman who did not even get an opportunity to admit to school because of her parent’s poor financial condition. She hails from Dhupguri, is married, and is a mother of two school-going children (one son and one daughter). They live in Kothapara in Jalpaiguri district.

Her husband works in the fields with the help of Manija, and their two children are still too young to help with the business. Planting and harvesting paddy rice has been a source of income for them for many years, so they are very knowledgeable. They inherited the land on which they work from their parents. Their customers are the villagers who are centrally located and easily accessible. Their greatest worries include competitors in the business, and most importantly, working capital to improve their agribusiness.

So Manija requests a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides so that she will be able to cultivate paddy on a large scale and prevent her crops from pests. Her and her husband's goals include their children continuing to attend school to earn a university degree so that they can support themselves in the future. They would also like to maintain their farm and purchase more land on which to grow paddy in bulk quantities to strengthen the family economy.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Nanibala

texts.en:
Nanibala is a 29-year-old housewife from a small village, Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district. She lives with her husband, Ganga, and two school-going kids (one son and one daughter) who are attending school (grade 6 and grade 3). Nanibala is illiterate, and her husband attended up to grade 7. They were deprived of further education due to the poor financial resources of their parents.

Nanibala's husband is a farmer by profession who has a plot of cultivable land. He works hard to come out ahead in vegetable cultivation. He has several years of experience working on his farm. His products are in much demand in the markets. Nanibala is an energetic and hardworking woman. She greatly supports her husband in his work after finishing her household jobs. The income of the family depends entirely on this agricultural activity, so she and her partner want to develop it by growing paddy. Being the main food for the people of her locality, rice is in great demand in the market. They hope it will be a lucrative business for them to strengthen their family's economy.

So Nanibala is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, etc., to be able to have a better quality of harvest, which will earn good revenue. Through the loan, they can improve their business; thus, they will have a better quality of life without limitations.

Nanibala aspires to get ahead with this business for a steady income for the family. She thanks both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies to grow paddy.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.pt:
A senhora Teresa  é tecnica, casada e mae de 6 filhos 4 a estudar os restantes 2  ja maiores de idade vive na casa propria e nao sustenta mais ninguem alem dos filhos.
Com valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, areia, pedra, varrões para a construção de uma dependencia na sua casa para arrendar
Tem como projectos e sonhos terminar  a sua obra, mobilar, fazer aviarios na sua casa como forma de reforcar a renda familiar.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros para a conclusao de sua casa, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Teresa is a technician. She's married and has six children, four of whom study and the other two are already adults. She lives in a house that she owns and she doesn't support anyone else other than her children.
With the amount of the loan she will purchase cement, sand, rocks, and rods in order to build another room in her house for renting out.
Her projects and dreams are to finish the construction work, furnish the room, and build bird coops in her house as a way of improving her family's income.
She states that the main challenges she's been facing are financial, related to finishing her house. She also states that she'll request more loans so that she can accomplish her plan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, rocks, and rods.

loans.name: Jose Bombino

texts.en:
Jose Bombino is a married man and the father of a nine year old child from Leyte, Philippines.

Jose Bombino earns a living through his sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in his place. Jose Bombino's business was greatly affected when typhoon Haiyan hit the country several months ago.

As of now, Jose Bombino is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. Through this, he will be able to augment his stock and attract more buyers into his store. In the future, Jose Bombino hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to provide maintenance to his cacao crop.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en:
Anacleta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Anacleta successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Anacleta's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is widowed mother and works hard to support her family.

She has a personal products retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing and pig raising businesses. Amy is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more personal products to sell to customers.

Amy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell

loans.name: Menakabala

texts.en:
Menakabala is a rural woman residing at Altagram in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is 56 years old and a mother of 3 children (two sons and one daughter).  Her daughter is continuing her bachelor degree and two sons are unemployed. She is an illiterate woman who can sign her name only. Her husband, 60-year-old Hemendranath, has a secondary education.

For many years Menakabala and her husband have been farming livestock. They generate income selling milk to their locality.  Menakabala rears cows, and her husband supplies milk to their neighbors, who are their main customers.

Over the years, Menakabala has found that the most enjoyable thing about her work is milking. This business is the main source of income for meeting the basic needs of her family, including the educational expenses of her daughter. The income is insufficient, and they somehow manage to cover the expenses. However, lack of sufficient capital is a challenge that bars her from expanding her business.  With the aim of further improvement of their business, Menakabala thought to buy one more cow, which will help her to expand the business.

Menakabala is seeking a loan from BJS to purchase a dairy cow. This amount of milk will greatly boost her sales volume. The money from the sales of the additional milk will enable her to meet her household costs, and she wants to save money for the future with an aim to construct a concrete made house.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El sr. Oscar vive con su abuela, es de la ciudad de Lambaré, se encuentra cursando el segundo año de la carrera Ciencias y Tecnología de Alimentos, desea trabajar en la Dirección Técnica de Industrias y Alimentos de alguna empresa grande o abrir su propia empresa relacionada al mismo tema.
Su mayor inspiración para salir adelante es su familia y en especial su abuela con quien vive desde el fallecimiento de su abuelo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Oscar lives with his grandmother. He is from the city of Lambaré, and he is studying in the second year of the Food Sciences and Technology Degree Program. He wants to work in Food Industry and Technology Management for some large company, or open his own company related to the same field.

His biggest inspiration for moving forward is his family, especially his grandmother, with whom he has lived since his grandfather’s passing. 

He is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the costs of his degree program, as in this way he will be able to cover his expenditure.  He is thankful that he is receiving the opportunity to complete his studies.

loans.use: to pay the costs of his degree program.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 46 years old and a married woman with six children. Five of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Alice has a laundry shop business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more soap and detergent for her laundry.

Alice has been in this business for two years. In the future, Alice would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more soap and detergent for her laundry

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Imelda is 54 years old and has two children who are in school.

Imelda has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, sugar and other groceries.

Imelda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, sugar and other groceries

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jasmin is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Jasmin has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Jasmin requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Jasmin has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Jasmin would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is married and works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. Rosalie is borrowing 13,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a gear box, four tires and a battery in order to repair one of her vehicles.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is married and she works hard to support her family.

Merlinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy  fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Ritchele

texts.en:
Ritchele is 39 years old and has three children. Ritchele is married and all of her children are in school.

Ritchele is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ritchele requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ritchele has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ritchele would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Stefano

texts.pt:
Stefano de 34 anos nascido em Magude vivendo maritalmente em casa própria com seus 3 filhos e que todos  vão a escola, não sustenta outras pessoas fora dos seus filhos. 
É Docente há mais de 8 anos.
Este e’ seu 2 financiamento na Hluvuku e antes levantou 10.000,00 para pagamento de propinas escolares e actualmente 25.000,00 para mesma actividade.
 Tem como sonhos concluir a faculdade e desenvolver sua capacidade mental na prestação de serviços profissionais, a falta de tempo para associar o trabalho e a faculdade tem sido seu maior obstáculo.
texts.en:
Stefano is 34 years old and comes from Magude. He's married and lives in a house that he owns. All of his three children are in school. He doesn't support anyone else other than his children.
He has been a teacher for over eight years.
This is his second loan with Hluvuku. He has previously gotten 10,000 to pay for school fees and he currently seeks 25,000 for the same purpose.
His dreams are to finish college and develop his mental skills towards his professional career. His biggest hindrance has been not having enough time to juggle work and school.

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Geraldine Irene

texts.es:
Geraldine es una próspera trabajadora, tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella quiere brindar lo mejor a su familia como una manera de retribuir la gran educación y buenos valores que le inculcaron de niña, ya que gracias a ello hoy Geraldine es una persona de bien. Desde hace varios años trabaja brindando servicio de transporte con una mototaxi que tiene y le va muy bien porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace y respeta mucho a sus clientes y brinda una atención preferencial.
Geraldine está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá realizar el debido mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabajo, con esto no tendrá inconvenientes al momento de trasladar a los pasajeros y así sus ingresos mejorarán y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Geraldine is a prosperous, hard-working woman, 26 years old, who is single and lives in Ica with her family. She is a young woman with a strong desire to get ahead. She wants to offer the best to her family as a way for paying them back for the great education and good values that they instilled in her as a child since, thanks to them, today she always works hard in everything she does and highly respects her customers offering them preferential treatment.

Geraldine is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support they have offered her, she will be able to do the required maintenance on her work equipment, and with this she won't have any problems while transporting her passengers and, in turn, her income will increase and she will be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: maintain her motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 38 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school.

Mary Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Grace has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from tricycle transportation.

Mary Grace aspires to save enough money to expand her business and to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nickly

texts.en:
Nickly is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Nickly is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Nickly has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty-two loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

Delia has been in this business for 20 years now.

Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his cacao crop.

loans.name: Katherin Elizabeth

texts.es:
katherin es una joven soltera, de 23 años de edad, muy emprendedora, vive en Santa junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja con mucho ahínco y motivación por el bienestar de su familia, porque quiere brindarles mayores comodidades. Su éxito en su trabajo como Mesera es el resultado de todo el esfuerzo y las ganas que siempre le pone a todo. Es una persona muy trabajadora, honesta, responsable y amable.
Katherin, en estos momentos quiere comprar un televisor y un Blu Ray para regalarle a su papá, para que puedan disfrutar de sus momentos libres en familia ya a la vez pueda mejorar su calidad de vida. Con esto ella seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder cumplir el sueño de toda su familia: Terminar de construir su casa de material noble".
texts.en:
Katherin is a young, single woman. She is 23 years old and very entrepreneurial. She lives in Santa with her family. She is a person with a great desire to move forward. She puts great effort into her work and is motivated by her family's well-being. She wants to give them greater amenities. Her success as a waitress is a result of the effort and dedication that she always puts forth in everything she does. She is a hard-working, honest, responsible, and kind person. 

Currently, Katherin wants to buy a television and a Blu-ray player to give to her father so that they can enjoy their free time as a family and simultaneously improve their quality of life. She will continue to work hard so that in the future she can fulfill the dream of her entire family: "To finish building their house using strong materials."

loans.use: to buy a television and a Blu-ray player.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hides in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase locks, wheelbarrows, wire, metal rods, and pipes in order to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 52 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Rosemarie has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the grocery store for 10 years, and also earns an income from raising pigs and farming rice.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Helen is 40 years old, and has one child who is currently in school.

Helen has a book selling business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more books to sell to her customers.

Helen has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more books

loans.name: Teofista

texts.en:
Teofista is 38 years old and married woman with one kid who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Teofista has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Teofista has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Andi

texts.en:
Meet Andi. Andi lives with his wife and his two children in Tasikmalaya, a small city located about three hours from Bandung, West Java. Andi runs a small shop that sells snacks, drinks, and consumer goods. He began working with Ruma two years ago because he wanted to increase his income. 

He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. 

In the photo, Andi is standing in his small shop.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Shirlet

texts.en:
Shirlet is 47 years old; she is a married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Shirlet has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Shirlet has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: João

texts.pt:
Tem 56 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos todos ainda na sua responsabilidade e a estudarem, vive na casa propria, tem nivel medio e trabalha como tecnico electricista e ganha um salario 2 vezes mais que o salario minimo de mocambique. Esta a repetir o credito pela 3ª vez.
Pretende comprar material de construcao como: cimento, ferro, arrame, barrotes,pranchas, areia, pedra, etc, para investir na contrução de sua casa.
Ele tem esperança de terminar a casa, comprar mobilia de modo a sentir se bem confortavel dentro do seu lar.
Diz não ter nenhuma dificuldade de momento:
texts.en:
João is 56 years old and married. He has five children, all of whom are in school and still under his responsibility. He lives in a house that he owns. He's a high school graduate and works as an electrical technician. He earns a salary that's twice the amount of the minimal wage in Mozambique. This is his third loan.
He intends to purchase construction supplies such as cement, iron, wire, beams, planks, sand, rocks, etc., in order to build his home.
His hope is to finish the house and buy furniture so that he can feel comfortable in his home.
He states that he doesn't face any hardships at the moment.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement, iron, wire, beams, planks, sand, rocks, etc.

loans.name: Florida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORIDA” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juliana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: carnicería, venta de comida, estampados de poleras, tienda de barrio, venta de sogas, tejido de mantas, tejido de prendas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juliana es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tejido y trenzado de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace 18 años, al concluir el estudio en un instituto técnico donde aprendió el manejo de la lana. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias tradicionales de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Florida" communal bank will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani, and is made up of nine members, led by officers of whom Juliana is the president. The businesses that the group members carry out are varied and among them are a butcher shop, food sales, printing T-shirts, a general store, knitting blankets, and knitting clothing.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small microenterprises, of which Juliana is part. She says that two years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business knitting and weaving blankets. She says that she began this business 18 years ago, upon finishing her courses at the technical institute where she learned how to handle wool.

The loan that they are now taking out is to increase capital (to purchase wool in bulk) that she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and after making them she will sell them in the traditional festivals of the city of El Alto. This type of work permits her to generate resources to support her family, since she lives with her partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wool in bulk.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a married woman and a mother of five children from Leyte, Philippines. Julita is a farmer and has been in the farming business for more than 30 years now. This is the source of her income.

Julita's farm was damaged when a typhoon hit the country several months ago.  As of now, Julita is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve her rice field thus, augmenting her harvest and income. In the future, Julita hopes of making her farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
Tem 36 anos, vive maritalmente, tem nivel primario e é mãe de 2 filhos menores com acesso à escola, faz negocio de venda de alguns produtos alimentares numa banca em sua casa e trabalha como cozinheira numa barraca e conta com ajuda do esposo que trabalha como seguranca, esta a repetir o credito pela 2ª vez.
pretende comprar: cebola, batata, yougurts, etc, para ampliar o seu negocio.
gostaria de poder construir uma barraca grande em sua casa e ampliar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Marta is 36 years old and married. She finished elementary school and has two underage children who attend school. She sells some types of foodstuffs from a booth in her house. She also works as a cook at a food stall and gets help from her husband who works as a security guard. This is her second loan.
She intends to purchase onions, potatoes, yogurt, etc., so that she can expand her business.
She would like to be able to build a large booth in her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase onions, potatoes, yogurt, etc., in order to expand her business.

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN LUIS” iniciará el trigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche y queso, venta de comida, venta de flores, taller de aluminio, costura de poleras y chompas, taller de vidrios, venta de ropa, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que hace doce años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  taller de vidriería; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace 18 años, ya que conocía el manejo de vidrios hace varios años, pues su padre tenía un taller similar. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vidrio por mayor) que adquirirá de las importadoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará de acuerdo al pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "San Luis" communal bank will begin its thirty-first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers, of whom Alicia is the President. The businesses that the communal bank members carry out are varied and among them are milk and cheese sales, flower sales, an aluminum workshop, sewing T-shirts and sweaters, a glass workshop, clothing sales and fruit sales. 

The loan that they will be taking out will benefit the small microenterprises of which Alicia is part. She says that twelve years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a staff member who went to visit her at home. Currently, she has a business which is a glass workshop. She says that she began this business 18 years ago, since she had known how to handle glass for several years, since her father had a similar workshop.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (purchase glass in bulk) that she will acquire from the importers in the city of El Alto and later will sell according to her customers' orders. This type of work permits her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health center that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase glass in bulk.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 59-years-old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Paz has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Paz requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Paz has been in this business for six years. In the future, Paz would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer works hard to support her family. She is married with five children and has a general store business in the Philippines. Jenefer has been in this business for three years now.

Jenefer requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business. 

In the future, Jenefer would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 41-years-old and has one child. Juditha is married and has one child who is in school.

Juditha is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Juditha requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs and piglets.

Juditha has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Juditha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs and piglets

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a 51-year-old widow with two children. Annabelle works very hard to provide for them.

Annabelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Annabelle has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, diapers and other groceries. 

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lydia has been in this business for 8 years now.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Shankari

texts.en:
Shankari hails from Dhupguri. She is a young housewife of 21 years who lives with her husband Sushil and a toddler. She studied until seventh grade and then married Sushil, who is a 34-year-old farmer.  They live in a rural village in Jalpaiguri district.

Shankari’s husband is a farmer by profession. He is engaged in cultivating vegetables to meet the everyday needs of the family. Shankari helps her husband a lot in selling the agricultural products in the market. As life gets more expensive, the family's everyday costs are also increasing. They now need to improve their business to be able to meet their family's needs more effectively. Financial help will be a great support to Shankari and her family, helping them to pay for purchasing ladies finger (okra) seeds and fertilizer for cultivation. This will give them more opportunities to develop their agribusiness.

So, Shankari has sought a loan from BJS, and it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and BJS. She will purchase seeds and fertilizers with the loan to grow ladies fingers, which they consider will be a lucrative business as it has good potential in the present market. Shankari dreams of purchasing more land with the profit.

The family is very grateful to the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of ladies fingers.

loans.name: Dadiri

texts.en:
Meet Dadiri. He is single and lives with his family in Bekasi, a satellite city located at the east of Jakarta. Dadiri works as an employee in a private company, but  he realized he needed to increase his income in order to support his family's living. 

He decided to sell mobile phone airtime credits. He began working with Ruma a year ago and he feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends. 

Dadiri is the one in the photo.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Shyamla

texts.en:
Shyamla is 27 years old, living in a community in the village of Khalaigram in Jalpaiguri district in West Bengal. She is married and is blessed with four children (one son and three daughters). Three of them are studying in eighth, sixth and second grade; the fourth one is too young for school. She didn't have access to higher education, but that didn't stop her from learning to read and write; she studied up to grade four.

Shyamla and her husband, Kshiren, do paddy (rice) cultivation and earn very little. They have always faced a lot of challenges to increase their yield. Their current income is too scanty to cover all the necessary needs of their family along with the educational expenses of their children.

So, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to improve the quantity and quality of her paddy cultivation. She will use the loan to buy good-quality seeds and fertilizers.

Shyamla's charming and enthusiastic personality is something that really characterizes this entrepreneur, and it is reflected in the work that she does on her small farm. Her dream is that her farm would be considered a model of paddy cultivation with a good, high-quality yield, for which she works day in and day out, as she is sure that this line of work has great economic potential.

She wants to save money to construct a concrete-made house for them in the future.

She is grateful to her lenders: BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Lider Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LIDER” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de transporte, tejido a máquina de chalecos, venta de masetas, venta de comida y jugos, venta de perfumes, servicio de internet, venta de material escolar, venta de cortes de mantas y tejido, venta de salchipapa, venta de material de limpieza .

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  elaboración y venta de salchipapas (comida boliviana); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, al observar que este producto no existía en su zona, pero era requerido por sus vecinos. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen una de las señoras no esta presente en la imagen, la misma se encuentra en el consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The "Lider" communal bank with begin its fifth loan cycles with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It is made up of ten members and is led by officers of whom Margarita is the president. The businesses that the communal bank members carry out are varied and include a transportation service, machine knitting of vests, flowerpot sales, food and juice sales, perfume sales, internet services, school supply sales, blanket and knitting sales, salchipapas (hot dog and fries) sales, and cleaning supply sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small microenterprises of which Margarita is part. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business making and selling salchipapas (Bolivian food). She says that she undertook this business at her own initiative, upon seeing that the product didn't exist in her area but was desired by her neighbors.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (purchase potatoes in bulk) that she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and, after preparing them, will sell them in her retail space. This type of work permits her to generate resources to economically support her family, since she lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings program that the institution offers. In the picture, one of the women is not present. She was in the medical clinic.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is a 55-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She works with her husband on their farm. Marcela also raises pigs as additional income.  Her husband works as a carpenter at the same time.

Marcela's farm was affected after a typhoon hit their place several months ago. Marcela is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and animal feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to grow more crops on her farm. 

In the future, Marcela hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Sarodini

texts.en:
Sarodini, 25 years, is married and lives with her family in a small village, Baroghoria, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a mother of three lovely daughters at this tender age. Two of them are students and read in grade five and grade three; the third one is too young for school. Sarodini has studied until tenth grade. She has a desire to get ahead in life. She has been working in the fields and supports her husband Sunil in his agricultural activities in order to provide financial support for her family.

Sarodini's husband works as a farmer, mainly growing vegetables such as potatoes, beans and gourds, and fruits such as cucumbers. He is doing very well through the performance and the experience he has gained through the years. Now Sarodini and her husband have decided to cultivate paddy to earn more profits to strengthen the family economy.

So, Sarodini is asking for financial help from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She is grateful to her lenders because with their support, she will buy supplies such as natural fertilizers and seeds for her crops. In this way, she will get a better harvest and her income will improve, thus improving her quality of life. Her goal is to expand her crops and to become a successful entrepreneur.

She aspires to save money to purchase more land in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Josephine is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Josephine has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle.

Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is 46-years-old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Cresilda works very hard to provide for them.

Cresilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cresilda has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Cresilda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vicuñitas De Mariscal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑITAS DE MARISCAL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de trasporte, venta de focos, venta de masetas, trenzado de mantas, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que deseaba formar una Banca Comunal en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de focos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace quince años, ya que sus familiares tenían el mismo negocio y ella decidió continuarlo. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de focos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el servicio de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Vicuñitas de Mariscal" communal bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada and is made up of eight members, led by officers, of which Juana is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry on are varied and among them are a transportation service, light bulb sales,flowerpots sales, weaving blankets, and blanket sales. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small microenterprises of which Juana is a part. She says that this is the first time that she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a neighbor who wanted to create a communal bank in the institution. Currently, she has a business selling light bulbs, she says that she undertook this business fifteen years ago, since some of her family members had the same business and she decided to continue it.

The loan she is now taking out is to increase her capital (purchase light bulbs in bulk) that she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later will sell in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family since she lives with her partner and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health service that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase light bulbs in bulk

loans.name: Poderoso Imperial Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PODEROSO IMPERIAL” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne de res, tejido de mantas, ayudante de construcción, tejido de gorros, venta de plásticos, taller de cerrajería, venta de pasancalla.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de pasancalla (cereal dulces boliviano); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia con el primer crédito obtenido en Pro Mujer. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de Pasancalla por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Poderoso Imperial" communal bank will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II, and is made up of nine members, led by officers of whom Verónica is the president. The businesses that the communal bank members carry out are varied and include beef sales, weaving blankets, construction assistant, knitting hats, plastic goods sales, locksmith shop, and pasancalla sales.  

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small microenterprises of which Verónica is part. She said that three years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling pasancalla (Bolivian sweet cereal). She says that she began this business at her own initiative with her first loan that she got from Pro Mujer. 

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (purchase pasancalla in bulk) that she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later will sell it in her retail space. This type of work permits her to generate resources to economically support her family, since she lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings program that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase pasancalla (a sweet Bolivian food made of puffed corn) in bulk.

loans.name: Emmabel

texts.en:
Emmabel is a married woman and the mother of three children, from Leyte, Philippines. Emmabel has been engaged in the poultry business for more than two years now. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Emmabel is asking for a loan to buy animal feed and supplements for the chickens. With this, she will be able to raise more chickens in her place, which she can sell to the market. In the future, Emmabel hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and supplements for the chickens.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Ma. Luisa has a sewing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, thread, buttons, etc. for her business.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, thread, buttons, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 57 years old and married with five children.

Eden works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Eden has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Eden aspires to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. Marivic is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marivic has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Marivic has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Merlinda has a rug making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Merlinda has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a rural woman who hails from Dhupguri. She is 44 and married with one school-going son who is in grade ten. She is illiterate, but knows how to budget and save money to reach future goals. She lives with her husband and son in Madhya Baroghoria, a remote village in Jalpaiguri district. They have a mud, bamboo and straw-made house, which is deprived of basic facilities like water and electricity.

Saraswati's husband Haridas has been working in agriculture as the primary source of income for his family. They have a small plot of agricultural land where he grows beans, potatoes and other seasonal vegetables. Saraswati also helps her husband in his activities in her spare time, especially at the time of harvesting and selling the produce in the market. His monthly income from the sale of vegetables is not sufficient to bear the costs of the family.

With the goal of further developing her business, Saraswati and her husband have decided to cultivate paddy (rice) on their farmland.  Being the staple food of the local people, the crop has a great demand in the market.

So, Saraswati has turned to BJS (Kiva’s partner) for a loan to purchase fertilizers and good-quality paddy seeds and to cultivate paddy on their land. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further expanding her business and wants to save toward securing their future.

She thanks her generous lenders BJS and Kiva for their financial help.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and cultivate the land to grow paddy.

loans.name: Septa

texts.en: Septa lives with his wife and his six-month-old son in Tangerang, a satellite city located south of Jakarta. To support his family's living, Septa works as a civil servant. Nevertheless, Septa realized that he needed to find another source of income. Septa met one of Ruma's staff through his friend and he decided to join Ruma about five months ago. Nowadays, he can serve up to 150 mobile airtime transactions per day. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him to run the business and consequently support his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Taufik

texts.en: Meet Taufik. Taufik lives with his wife and his two children in Bekasi, a satellite city to the east of Jakarta. Taufik runs a small shop that sells snacks, drinks, and consumer goods. He began working with Ruma two years ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to be expanding his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits. He hopes to get a Kiva loan to use as working capital that will enable him to process more transactions on weekends. In the photo, Taufik is standing in his small shop.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Fuente De Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FUENTE DE VIDA” iniciará el vigésimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de condimentos, venta de repuesto de autos, venta de abarrotes, tejido de mantas, costura de chamarras

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace quince años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermano, ya que ella le ayudo por varios años en su negocio, con un poco capital ahorrado emprende su negocio independiente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera Bolivia – Perú y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio médico y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución porque son más accesibles.
texts.en:
