The “Fuente de Vida” Communal Bank will begin its twenty-eighth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana Regional Office.  It is composed of eight members and directed by a board of directors, of which Señora Juana is president. The members of the association have various businesses, including condiment sales, auto parts sales, selling groceries, weaving blankets, and sewing jackets.

The loan that they will receive will benefit the small businesswomen of whom Señora Juana is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer fifteen years ago, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  Currently, she has a grocery store. She says that she learned this business from her brother, as she helped him for several years in his business; and with a small amount of saved capital she is starting her independent business.  

The loan that she is receiving now is for increasing capital, (the purchase of wholesale groceries) that she will acquire from the wholesale vendors from the border of Bolivia and Perú. Later she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources in order to support her family, as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the doctor’s office, and the training that the institution offers, because they are more accessible.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale groceries.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EMPRENDEDORAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarith es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de medicamentos caseros, producción de carteras y mochilas, tejido de polainas, taller de carpintería, venta de celulares, venta de medias, venta de queso, costura de poleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarith es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su cuñada hace ocho años atrás, con un poco capital y con la técnica ya aprendida decide implementar un negocio independientemente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. "EMPRENDEDORAS" will be starting their second loan-cycle on Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Focal de Panamericana.  This group consists of eight members and is directed by a committee of which Señora Margarith is the President.  The businesses that the communal bank members conduct are varied and among them are: sale of homemade medicines, manufacture of purses and backpacks, knitting of leggings, a carpentry workshop, cell phone sales, sock sales, cheese sales, and sewing of T-shirts.

The loan that they will take out benefits small micro-enterprises, where Señora Margarith is a member.  She indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for one year, joining by way of a friend's invitation who is a client of the institution.  Currently she has a business knitting blankets; she shares that she learned this trade from her sister-in-law eight years back.  With a little money and the technique she already learned, she is deciding to open a business independently. 
 
The loan that she will now take out is for the growth of capital (purchase of wholesale wool) that she will purchase from the wholesalers in the markets of the Ciudad de El Alto and later sell in her sale space.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is single and has four children.

When consulted about what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she liked the savings and training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale wool

loans.name: Luciernagas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUCIERNAGAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nancy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de deportivos, venta de awayos, costura de deportivos, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nancy es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de deportivos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su pareja hace varios años y desde entonces ambos comercializan los mismos productos. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Luciernagas" communal bank will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes and is made up of nine members led by officers, of whom Nancy is the president. The businesses that the communal bank members carry out are varied and include clothing sales, sports clothing sales, awayo (traditional Bolivian shawl) sales, sewing sports clothing, and food sales.

The loan that they will be taking out will benefit the small microentrepreneurs of whom Nancy is part. She says that five years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business sewing and selling sports clothing. She says that she learned this business from her partner several years ago and, since then, they both sell the same products. 

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (purchase fabric in bulk) that she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and, after making the clothing, will sell it to order. This type of work permits her to generate resources to support her family since she lives in a common-law marriage and has four children. 
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health center that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase fabric in bulk.

loans.name: Huaycheñas De Villa Ingenio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HUAYCHEÑAS DE VILLA INGENIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Basilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras, venta de asientos, venta de dulces, librería, costura de balones, tejido de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Basilia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de bancas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de al observar la necesidad de las vendedoras y elaboró un banca para mayor comodidad en sus negocio, este producto resulto un buen negocio y para ampliarlo requiere mayor capital. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fierros por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferreterías  de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Huaycheñas de Villa Ingenio" will begin its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part the regional center of Los Andes. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Basilia is the president. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied. Among them are selling jackets, selling seats, selling sweets, stationery store, sewing balls, and knitting sweaters.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of which Señora Basilia is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, entering at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She now has a business of making benches. She lets it be known that she learned this business on observing the need of the vendors, and she made a bench for greater comfort in their businesses. This product resulted in a good business, and she needs greater capital to expand it.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying iron wholesale.  She will acquire it in the hardware stores in the city of El Alto and after fabrication she will sell the benches on order to customers. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy iron wholesale

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is married and has a selling dry goods business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Rizalina requested a 14000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods like towels, blankets, blouses, etc. to sell. Rizalina has been in this business for 5 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rizalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods like towels, blankets, blouses, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is 66 years old and a widow with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jessa has a personal products retail business in the Philippines. Jessa has requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy more items like perfume, body lotion, and other personal items.

Jessa has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Jessa would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like perfume, body lotion, and other personal items.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is 42 years old and widowed with three children, one of whom is in school.

Lucille works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more stock such as canned goods, noodles, spices and other groceries.

Lucille has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lucille aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as canned goods, noodles, spices and other groceries.

loans.name: Derly

texts.en:
Derly is 39 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Derly has a fishing business in the Philippines. Derly has requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Derly has been in this business for three years. In the future, Derly would like to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Nayanashwari

texts.en:
Nayanashwari hails from Dhupguri. She is 50 years old and a hardworking lady. She is a housewife and a mother of two sons. One of them lives outside of the country.  She lives with her husband and other son in a village, Baroghoria, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is an illiterate woman, who can sign her name only. Her younger son is engaged in agricultural activities.

Nayanashwari’s husband is a highly skilled farmer with experience in various areas of agriculture. He has an innate talent for teamwork and a great entrepreneurial mind. Nayanashwari also assists her husband in his farming. They have a small harvest of paddy rice that he tends to every day from the early hours of the morning. They have been able to survive in his family with a great effort, but he is unable to provide financial sustenance to them. He wants to kick-start his harvest and get a better income.

Thus, Nayanashwari is asking for financial assistance from BJS (Kiva's partner) to invest in farming supplies such as fertilizers, good-quality paddy seeds, and pesticides. The loan will give her the opportunity to have a better-quality product. Her biggest dream is to have more land. This loan will support her in her project and her desires to succeed.

She thanks her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 44 years old, married, and has three children. 

Amalia is in the agricultural business, farming sugar cane in the Philippines. Amalia has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Amalia has been farming sugar cane for six years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Amalia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Chuquiago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHUQUIAGO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dalila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de polleras, elaboración de muebles, elaboración de mascaras flokloricas, venta de accesorios para peluquería, elaboración de matracas, venta de golosinas, venta de chuño.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dalila es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de matracas (accesorios de baila de la morenada); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su pareja hace varios años y desde entonces ambos comercializan los mismos productos. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se identifica a una señora que esta hablando por telefono, ella deseo ser parte del grupo sin embargo la llamada no pudo esperar y se alejo.
texts.en:
The "Chuquiago" communal bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers of whom Dalila is the president. The businesses that the communal bank members carry out are varied and among them are sewing polleras (traditional Andean skirts), making furniture, making folkloric masks, selling hairdressing accessories, making matracas (percussion rattle-like instruments), selling snacks, and selling freeze-dried potato. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small microentrepreneurs of whom Dalila is a part. She says that two years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business which is a matracas store (matracas are accessories for the dance known as La Morenada). She says that she learned this business from her partner some years ago, and since then they both sell the same products. 

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (purchase wood in bulk) which she will get from the wholesalers in El Alto and, after production, will sell them to customers' orders. This type of work permits her to generate resources to support her family since she lives in a common-law marriage and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health center that the institution offers. 

The photo shows a woman who is talking on the telephone. She wanted to be part of the group, however the call couldn't wait and she moved aside.

loans.use: to purchase wood in bulk.

loans.name: Vet

texts.en:
Vet is 34 years old, a married woman with three children, and a peanut seller. She has been in this business since 2006. Her husband is a worker making concrete sewers. They live in the Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia and earn approximately $14 USD per day. 

Now, Vet would like to request a loan to buy cement, wood, and floor tiles to build a house. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, she wants to build fences around her house and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy cement, wood, and floor tiles to build a house.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a married man and a father of three children from Leyte, Philippines. Joel is a fish vendor. He has also been engaged in his hog-raising business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income. Joel is asking for a loan to buy animal feed and more piglets to raise. With this, he will be able to improve his hog-raising business, thus augmenting his income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and more piglets to raise

loans.name: Totora Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TOTORA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: agricultura y ganadería, elaboración de queso, producción de quinua, papa y crianza de ganado.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre y cuando se casó decidió emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado vacuno) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente a la crianza utilizará la leche para la preparación de sus productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Totora" will begin its second loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya regional center. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Martha is the president. The businesses that the members of the bank run are varied. Among them are agriculture and livestock raising, making cheese, producing quinoa and potatoes, and raising livestock.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Señora Martha is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, entering at the invitation of a counselor from the institution who came to visit her in her home. She now has a business of making and selling cheese. She lets it be known that she learned this business from her mother, and when she married, she decided to set up an independent business.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy cattle, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in her community, and after raising them, she will use the milk to prepare her products. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has six children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 60 years old and married with seven children. With one child still in school, Rosita works very hard to provide for her family.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Rosita has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, beer, soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, etc. 

Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transportation. Josephine is borrowing 18,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 61 years old, married, and has one child. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. 

Amparo requested a 9000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for twenty years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Amparo would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Trebol Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TREBOL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silvia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, servicio de llamadas, venta de salteñas y empanadas, venta de juguetes por mayor, venta de artículos limpieza, venta de pollos, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silvia es integrante, ella indica que hace doce años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermana que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  elaboración y venta de salteñas y empanadas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, al observar que son altamente comerciales en el mercado. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de Harina por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el servicio de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen una de la señoras no esta presente, ya que la misma se encontraba realizando consulta médica.
texts.en:
The "Trebol" communal bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers, of whom Silvia is the president. The businesses that the communal bank members carry out are varied and include a general store, a prepaid call service, meat pie and empanada sales, bulk toy sales, cleaning supply sales, chicken sales, and cosmetic sales. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit the small microentrepreneurs of whom Silvia is part. She says that twelve years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of her sister who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business making and selling meat pies and empanadas. She says that she began this business at her own initiative, upon seeing that they are highly sold in the market.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (purchase flour in bulk) which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and, after making them, will sell them in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to economically support her family since she is single and has a child. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health service that the institution offers.

In the picture, one of the ladies is not present, since she was in a medical appointment.

loans.use: to purchase flour in bulk.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 55 years old, married, and has seven children. Two of her children are in school.

Virginia is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested an 11000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Virginia has been raising pigs for eight years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 64 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Norma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 19 years. Norma requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 65 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 19 years. Erlinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Sambath is 56 years old, a farmer, and a widowed woman with an only child. She has been a farmer since 1989. Her child is a garment worker. They live in the Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia and earn approximately $6 USD per day. 

Now, Sambath would like to request a loan to buy a motor vehicle for her child to ride to work. This loan will help reduce her child’s traveling expenses. 

In the future, she wants to run a grocer’s stall and renovate her house with fences around it.

loans.use: to buy a motor vehicle for her child to ride to work.

loans.name: Phulmala

texts.en:
Phulmala, 43 years old, is married and the mother of one son. She is from Dhupguri. She lives there with her husband, Binay, age 54 years, and her three children (one son and two daughters), who are in grade 5, grade 7 and grade 9. In her childhood, she did not get the opportunity to advance her education level due to the poor financial resources of her parents. So, she is earnestly trying to provide education for her children.

Phulmala and her husband do farm labor, such as weeding, caring for the crop, and other tasks, before harvesting the crops. They cultivate different vegetables in different seasons. With several years of experience in farm work, they have been able to get ahead despite the difficulties that have arisen along the way, including the rising cost of inputs and the instability of prices for buying and selling vegetables. Now that their children are growing up and the family expenses are increasing day by day, they feel the need to further improve their agricultural activities. They have decided to cultivate paddy, which is an all-season crop and, being the staple food of the regional people, is in much demand throughout the year. So, they think it will be a profitable business that will earn more income.

Currently, Phulmala is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to buy agricultural supplies, such as paddy seeds, fertilizers, etc., to start cultivation. She has a lot of faith and hope in getting ahead because her household expenses depend on this work. Her dream as a mother is to raise her children so they will be generous and noble citizens. With her profits, she plans to purchase more land.

Phulmala conveys her thanks to her lenders for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a sari-sari (variety) store operator from Leyte, Philippines. She is 40 years old and has four children. Nelia has been in the business for more than 7 years now, and this is the source of her income. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Nelia is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of items to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods, soda and other beverages, soap, and toiletries. With this loan she will be able to improve her inventory, which will attract more buyers into her store. 

In the future, Nelia hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of items to selll like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods, soda and other beverages, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Dovihes

texts.en:
Dovihes is a 54-year-old mother who was gifted with only one child. She is engaged in a hog-raising business to support her husband in gaining income. She wants to further improve her business and increase her income to meet their daily needs, as well as save some money for future emergencies.

Having insufficient capital, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to 50,000 PHP to buy the needed feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. She is hoping that she will receive her loan in order for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn, age 31, is married and blessed with one child. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of 300 PHP daily. Her net income on this business goes into her savings. 

Due to insufficient funds she would like to request a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase rice grains, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, and sugar to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase rice grains, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 60 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Raquel is borrowing 11000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 39 years old and has five children. She is a widow and four of her children are in school.

Ma. Fe is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Fe has been raising pigs for 16 years now and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Manzanitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANZANITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elizabeth es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de calzados, salón de peinados, producción de ladrillos, costura de polleras, costura de sábanas, venta de chiflería (productos para sahumerio), venta de zapatillas deportivas, venta de ladrillos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elizabeth es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra a Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  costura de enaguas (faldas); da a conocer que la técnica de costura la aprendió cuando trabajaba con su hermano, es por esta razón que con un pequeño capital decide emprender un negocio independiente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará de forma ambulante en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Manzanitas" will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación regional center. It consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Elizabeth is the secretary. The businesses that the members of the bank run are varied. Among them are selling shoes, hair salon, producing bricks, sewing skirts, sewing sheets, selling natural remedies (aromatic products), selling sports shoes, and selling bricks.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Señora Elizabeth is one. She indicates that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer. She entered at the invitation of a representative of the institution who came to visit her in her home. She now has a business of sewing skirts. She lets it be known that she learned sewing techniques when she was working with her brother. It is for this reason that she decided with a little capital to set up an independent business.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy fabric wholesale, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto, and after making her products, she will sell them as a street vendor in the fairs in the city of El Alto. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she lives with her partner and has a son.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale

loans.name: Nemboi Inn Group

texts.en:
The featured borrower of the group, Mrs. Nemboi, lives in a remote area of Manipur. She is 37 years old and a daily wage earner. She works in a quarry near her village, where they mine for stones and pebbles. Stone mining is very popular in the area, and most of the people from her village are engaged in this occupation. The stones are being used for building purposes and construction of houses. 

She supports her children from the income she gets from this occupation and manages to send them to school, too. Her husband is a farmer engaged in shifting cultivation. They have been working very hard to be self-reliant. The area that they live in has an insufficient power supply, which disturbs their day-to-day life, especially after sunset. Sometimes the current goes off for two to three consecutive days, which becomes the main problem of the people. The study hours after sunset for the children are affected by the present power situation, which leads to low academic performance. 

After availing the mini solar loan for house lighting, the children are now able to study well with no more disturbances from power cuts. Nemboi hopes that her children will study well and get decent jobs in the future to support their parents. She is very grateful to Kiva for lending such a loan. 

The other members of the group also face the same problem of insufficient power. In order to overcome this, they want to avail the loan so that they can buy mini solar home lighting systems that will provide them light after sunset for their homes.

loans.use: to buy a mini solar home lighting system so that the children can study well after sunset.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 50 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Pacita has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items, such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries. In the future, Pacita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en: Diosa is a mother of three.  Due to financial hardship, she operates their motorcycle transport while her husband cultivates their small farm. She aims to continue improving their business to help finance their children's education. To continuously use her motorcycle, she wants a PHP 10,000 loan to buy interior, sprocket, oil, and other spare parts needed for maintenance. Being a patient and industrious mother, she hopes that she will improve the business and generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy items for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Leidy Viviana

texts.es:
Leidy es una joven muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 5 años se viene dedicando a la venta de ropa como blusas, jeans y accesorios, sus productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos.

Desde siempre ha sentido gran afinidad con las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de ropa para dama para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de su hogar.

Con esta actividad es que intenta pagar sus estudios universitarios.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Leidy is an enterprising young woman who has the drive to move forward and make progress. For the past five years, she has been selling clothes such as blouses, jeans, and accessories. Her products are sold primarily to friends and neighbors. Leidy has always had a great affinity for making sales. Today she has demonstrated great skill in this field thanks to her likeability and excellent quality of service.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a stock of women’s clothing in order to increase her inventory. This will improve her sales and help her to generate good income, which will allow her to contribute to the household expenses. Through this business, she intends to pay for her university studies.

Leidy is hopeful of getting ahead thanks to good-hearted people who support these types of projects.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nongtaaba Grand Groupe

texts.fr:
Mme Germaine est la responsable du groupe NONGTAABA GRAND GROUPE. Mariée, elle est mère de six (06) enfants. Le plus âgé a 35 ans et le moins âgé a14 ans. Deux vont à l’école et elle a sept (07) personnes en charge.
Mme prépare et vend le dolo (bière de mil) depuis plus de 25 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les zones rurales.
Elle veut s’acheter (04) quatre sacs de sorgho rouge pour la préparation de la bière de mil.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour la consommation et la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité car elle vient d’avoir du gaz pour renforcer son activité et mieux s’occuper de sa famille
texts.en:
Mrs. Germaien is the leader of the Nongtaaba Grand group. She is married and  the mother of six. Her eldest child is 35 years old, and the youngest is 14 years old. Two of her children are in school; she has seven dependents. 

Mrs. Germaine has been  brewing "dolo" (millet beer) for sale for over 25 years. She stocks up in rural areas. She would like to buy four bags of red sorghum in order to prepare millet beer. She would like to use her revenue for her children's nutrition and education. Her goal is to expand her activity. She just had a gas installed in order to improve her business and better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy four bags of red sorghum for the preparation of millet beer.

loans.name: Kyauk Pon

texts.en:
This community is located in central Myanmar’s Magway township. It currently has 29 village customers, including 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area.

This village usually grows sesame, groundnuts and green gram, but suffers from drought and labor shortages. Most of the young people (>200) have migrated to other cities in search of economic opportunity. They do this instead of working on the villages' farms. Especially during the busy seasons, farmers have to pay laborers $10 per day to weed. To generate additional income, villagers will sell handmade hats and work on construction sites.

The new loan will help those villagers to purchase fertilizer and topsoil to improve soil conditions for their crops. In the future, they want to set up a small grocery store where they can sell farming inputs to avoid traveling to other cities. As it is a larger investment, the additional income from farming is really important for them.

Pictured above are the committee members from the Kyauk Pone village CBO: U Aung, U Myo, U Min, U Htay, and U San. Included in the photo is U Myo (second from the left), who is 25 years old. U Myo is the father of one small child. His main business is farming, but he generates extra income by leasing his diesel engine to others. He used his previous loan to buy topsoil and to hire laborers to weed. He will use his new loan to buy fertilizer to nourish his crops.

loans.use: to help 40 villagers purchase fertilizer and topsoil.

loans.name: Faye Yobanna

texts.es:
Faye es una mujer de 33 años de edad soltera, madre de un hijo y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, fuerte, luchadora y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ de su ciudad, un lugar que reúne a productores de todas las áreas y caracterizado por  el clima cálido y húmedo del ambiente casi todo el año.
Faye es de tez morena, cabello castaño largo peinado a la moda, se viste de forma moderna. Cada día muy temprano por la mañana, acomoda su carrito lleno de prendas de vestir para trasladarlo 10 calles hasta llegar al mercado, donde tiene su puesto de venta; abre su puesto y acomoda toda la mercadería para que esté en correcta exposición, continua en el lugar durante toda la jornada de lunes a domingo. A medio día la acompaña su pequeño hijo que llega después de la escuela y juntos almuerzan, es el momento del recreo familiar donde se dan  a conocer todo lo sucedido hasta el momento, seguidamente retornan a sus labores.
Ella desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y piensa que ampliando su negocio puede llegar a conseguir mejores beneficios económicos, la necesidad que tiene por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia la lleva a invertir en el crecimiento de su negocio.
Es por esos motivos que Faye solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor y con los beneficios mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo.
texts.en:
Faye is the 33 year-old single mother of a son. She is independent, enterprising, strong, very hardworking, and a fighter. 

Her line of work is selling clothes.  She carries out her business in the area of her city known as 'Plan 3000,' a place that brings together producers from all areas, and is characterized by a year-around warm and humid climate.

Faye is of dark complexion with long brown hair fashionably styled. She dresses with a modern style. Every day, early in the morning, she adjusts her cart full of clothing and transports it 10 blocks to get it to the market, where it has its designated place of sale; she opens her post and she arranges all the merchandise so that it is in properly displayed. She stays at her post continuously during the workday from Monday through Sunday. 

At midday she is accompanied by her young son who arrives after school, and they eat lunch together. It's the family’s recreational time where they discuss all that has happened thus far, then they return to work. 

She wants to give her son a better quality of life, and she thinks that by expanding her business she can achieve better economic gains. The need to improve her family’s quality of life is driving her to invest in the growth of the business.

It is for these reasons that Faye requests a loan for the purchase of wholesale clothing, and with the gains she will improve the quality of life of her son.

loans.use: buy wholesale apparel and with the profits improve the quality of life of her son.

loans.name: Asadullo

texts.ru: Асадулло студент второго курса Национального Университета Таджикистана. Он умный и начитанный молодой человек. Асадулло хорошо учить почти все предметы, которые он учит в университете. Его учителя говорят о нём, что он очень талантливый студент и в будущем он может достичь высот. Асадулло живет с родителями. Его родители простые рабочие и не в состоянии оплатить за его учебный договор. Асадулло запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Asadullo is in his second year of studies at the National University of Tajikistan. He is an intelligent and well-read young man. He is doing very well in almost all disciplines. His professors say that he is gifted and can go far in the future. Asadullo lives with his parents. His working-class parents are unable to pay his university tuition. Asadullo is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 USD to pay for his tuition. He is counting on your kindness and hopes for your compassion.

loans.use: to pay his tuition.

loans.name: Maa Samaleswari Group

texts.en:
Khamatarai is a small rural village in Nuapada district of Odisha, India. This village is located in one of the backward regions of India. The Samaleswari Self-Help Group was formed here by eleven poor women from a scheduled caste and scheduled tribe community who are seeking to create better lives for themselves, their families and their community. This group was formed in June 2014 to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for expansion of their small enterprises. 

Sangita is a hardworking member of the group. She is 31 years old and married with three sons. The lady standing third from the left in the group photo is Sangita. Her children are studying in the local formal school. 

Sangita has a tailoring business, along with a vegetable cultivation business. Both she and her husband manage these enterprises. She earns a monthly income of 4,000 INR, with which it is very hard to manage the domestic expenses of a five-member family along with a business venture. So, Sangita wants to increase her income by expanding her existing trades. 

With the present loan, she is planning to purchase a new tailoring machine, needles, thread, lace and other necessary cloth for her tailoring unit, and fertilizer, pesticide and seeds for her vegetable cultivation farm. She hopes this investment will help her in the long run to give higher education to her children and construct a good house for her family.

The other ten members of her group are also running small enterprises such as a general store, vegetable cultivation and vending, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine, needles, thread, lace and other necessary cloth for her tailoring unit, and fertilizer, pesticide and seeds for her vegetable cultivation farm.

loans.name: Onicio

texts.es:
Onicio de 39 años de edad,  no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a que su padre necesitaba ayuda en su trabajo y decidió quedarse a ayudar a su padre, también por la situación económica que en esos tiempos.

Esta acompañado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen cinco hijos de las edades de 18,  16, 13,9 y siete años los cuales estudian, en su casa habitan siete personas incluyéndose y todos dependen de él. 

Onicio se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de granos básicos como el frijol, maíz y maicillo; aprendió este trabajo gracias a su padre debido a que él se dedicaba a la siembra de granos y fue así como aprendió y cundo tuvo su propia familia él sabia como defenderse y poder mantenerla, sus siembras las tiene cerca de su casa no tiene que caminar mucho tiempo, él no tiene horario de trabajo debido a que sus siembras necesitan de mucho cuido de las plagas, fumigarlos agregarle abono y en casos de sequía regarlos, es así  como Onicio cuida de sus siembras para mantenerlas libres de plagas y poder obtener buenas semillas y así venderlas y recibir ganancias para poder mantener a su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar granos básicos, como maíz, frijoles, arroz,  debido a la sequía que enfrentó el país,  sus cosechas no fueron muy favorables y necesita granos para poder mantener a su familia y también lo necesita para la compra de semilla, abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas para hacer nuevas siembras y poder obtener granos debido a que él hace sus siembras y vende los granos.
Onicio planea para un futuro poder comprar un terreno para poder hacer sus siembras y así poder obtener más granos y obtener mejores ingresos económicos, también desea poder comprarse una ternera y crecerla y así comenzar a tener su propio ganado.
texts.en:
Onicio, age 39, did not have the opportunity to study because he needed to help his father with his work. Another reason why he stayed to help his father is because of their financial situation at the time. Onicio is in a relationship and his wife takes care of the household duties. They have five children (ages 18, 16, 13, 9, and 7) who are in school. There are seven people living in his home and all of his family members are dependent on him.

Onicio is a farmer who cultivates staple crops such as beans, corn, and sorghum. He learned this trade thanks to his father who also planted these crops. Using what he learned, Onicio is able to support his own family and look after them. His crops are located near his house, so he does not have to walk very far. Even though Onicio does not work on a set schedule, his crops need a great deal of care. They must be protected against pests, so the crops must be fumigated and have fertilizer applied. The crops must also be watered during times of drought. Onicio goes about maintaining his crops to keep them free of pests, which will help to generate good seeds that he can sell for a profit in order to support his family.

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to buy staple products such as corn, beans, and rice because of the drought that the country is experiencing. His harvests were not favorable, so he needs these staple goods to feed his family. He will also buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, and pesticides for his new round of planted crops. By obtaining the seeds, he can plant them and sell the output.

In the future, Onicio plans to buy a plot of land for planting his crops. This will allow him to produce more grain and generate more income. He also wants to buy a calf that he can raise so that he can begin owning cattle.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, and pesticides for his new crops, as well as staple goods for feeding his family.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Group

texts.en:
Maa Laxmi Self Help Group (SHG) was formed in May 2014. The group consists of ten rural poor women members who belong to the Below Poverty Line category. This group is located in a rural village named Gadramunda in Nuapada district of Odisha, India. Sobhagini is one of the members of this group. The lady standing with a raised hand is Sobhagini. She is a very active and young lady of 19 years of age. She lives with her husband and one child.

Sobhagini has a vegetable cultivation farm of two hectares. She and her husband cultivate vegetables and other produce on one hectare. Her husband is an active and cheerful farmer. They produce vegetables such as brinjal, cauliflower, carrot, cabbage, chilies, cucumber, papaya, ladies finger, onion and also maize on her farm. She sells her products to the traders of the nearest town who come to take vegetables from her farm. 

Sobhagini says that she earns a minimum amount of 5,500 INR per month from this business, which is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family, as well as the farm expenses. Sobhagini wants to expand her cultivation by farming the remaining hectare of land by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 
She will utilize the present loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs, such as seeds and pesticides, for her farm. She is also planning to purchase a diesel water pump for a smooth water supply and for expansion of her farming for more income for a secure livelihood for her family. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. 

Sobhagini dreams to construct a farmhouse. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work. 

The other nine members of this group are also doing vegetable cultivation and milk businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, farm inputs such as seeds and pesticides, and a diesel water pump.

loans.name: Ayleen

texts.en:
Ayleen is 45 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Ayleen works very hard to provide for them.

Ayleen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Ayleen has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ayleen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: G.s Linaje De Abrahan Group

texts.es:
La señora  Flora es madre soltera tiene casa propia y 3 hijas que  depende de ella y vive en una comunidad de Trojes al oriente de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10 años a hornear pan, rosquillas y hojaldras.
Doña Flora esta solicitando el préstamo  para la compra de soda, harina, huevos, queso, leña, etc., materia prima que necesita para seguir elaborando su producto, espera que esta inversión le permita obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante en su negocio y seguir apoyando a su familia en el hogar. 
Doña Digna se dedica al comercio de granos básicos.
Doña Rosa se dedica al comercio de Lácteos.



Trojes, Honduras -  Agosto del 2014.
texts.en:
Sra. Flora is a single mother who has her own home. Her three dependent daughters live with her in a community of Trojes, which is in eastern Honduras. For the past 10 years, she has been producing bread, donuts, and fry bread.

Doña Flora is requesting a loan in order to buy baking soda, flour, eggs, cheese, firewood, and other supplies that are needed to continue making her products. She hopes that this investment will allow her to generate the necessary income to move her business forward and to continue supporting her family at home.

Doña Digna is a merchant who sells basic grains.

Doña Rosa is a merchant who sells dairy products.

Trojes, Honduras - August 2014

loans.use: to buy baking soda, flour, eggs, cheese, firewood, and other supplies.

loans.name: Noel Enrique

texts.es: Noel es un microempresario emprendedor, quien tiene la edad de 40 años y soltero, es propietario de una pulpería en su domicilio este negocio lo impulso hace ocho años por medio de unos ahorros que tenía. Es primer ciclo que el socio trabaja con los financiamientos de la institución y solicita el crédito para la compra de productos como es arroz, frijol, aceite, papel higiénico, servilletas, toallas sanitarias, gel para el cabello, shampoo, etc. Una de sus metas es ampliar su negocio y diversificar los productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Noel is an enterprising small business owner. He is 40 years old and single. Noel is the owner of a store in his home that he started eight years ago with some of his savings. This is his first loan as a working member of ADIM.

He is requesting this loan in order to buy products such as rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, napkins, sanitary pads, hair gel, shampoo, and other items. One of his goals is to expand his business by diversifying the products that he offers.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, napkins, sanitary pads, hair gel, shampoo, and other products.

loans.name: Rosita Jazmin

texts.es:
Rosita es una joven muy entusiasta, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Chincha junto a su familia. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial en la Universidad, es muy aplicada en los estudios por lo cual siempre obtiene los primeros lugares. También para ayudar a sus padres trabaja como Analista Industrial en una prestigiosa empresa y le va muy bien porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace.
Rosita está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una lavadora para su casa, ya que por temporada de invierno es muy difícil lavar la ropa a mano, gracias a esto estará mejorando su calidad de vida y Rosita seguirá esforzándose para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder cumplir una de sus más grandes metas: Estudiar una Maestría.
texts.en:
Rosita is a very enthusiastic young woman. She is 21 years old, is single, and lives with her family in Chincha. Thanks to her parents' support, she is studying for a degree in Industrial Engineering at university. She is very diligent in her studies, which is why she always at the top of her class. Also, in order to help her parents, she works as an Industrial Analyst in a prestigious company. Her job is going well for her since she always works hard at whatever she does.

Rosa is very grateful to the Kiva loaners, because with the help they have given her, she will be able to buy a washing machine for her house. It's helpful since during the winter months it's very difficult to hand wash clothing. Thanks to that help, her quality of life will improve. Rosita will continue to strive to better her family's quality of life and to be able to accomplish one of her biggest goals: to study for a Masters Degree.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Olvin Noe

texts.es: Olvin  tiene 34 años de edad es habitante de la comunidad el sardinal  nos comenta que él se crio en una familia grande él fue el noveno integrante de la familia ya que sus padres tuvieron en total 12 hijos a pesar de las dificultades económicas su padres siempre lucharon por darles un techo y alimentación a él y sus hermanos así como estudios  el estudio hasta cuarto año de secundaria   ya después no continuo porque  en los tiempos de cosecha debía de ayudar a su padre a trabajar en los labores de la agricultura . Además que trabaja  medio tiempo en un taller, esto él lo hacía para obtener ingresos y ayudarse un poco con sus gastos. Hace 4 años él se casó y tiene una hija   su fuente de ingreso actualmente para mantener a su familia es de la siembra de granos básicos y café, además siempre le ayuda a su padre a cultivar las tierras que tiene ,  en la comunidad no tienen energía eléctrica  y les hace mucha falta  principalmente por las noches y madrugada que salen a trabajar , es por eso que desea aplicar a crédito para comprar un sistema solar
texts.en:
Olvin is 34 years old and a resident of the community of El Sardinal. He says that he was raised in a large family and is the ninth child. His parents had a total of 12 children. Despite their financial difficulties, his parents always provided a roof and food for him and his siblings. In addition, they were able to pay for an education since he was able to study through the fourth year of high school. Afterwards, he was not able to continue because he had to help his father with the farm work during harvest time. Olvin also worked part-time at a repair shop in order to generate income that helped a bit with the expenses.

He has been married for four years and has a daughter. His current source of income for supporting his family comes from cultivating basic grains and coffee. In addition, he still helps his father with his crops. His community does not receive electricity, which is a great need at night and at dawn when he has to leave for work. For this reason, Olvin is applying for a loan in order to buy a solar energy system.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Abashizehamwe Group

texts.fr:
Evariste   fait partie du groupe  Abashizehamwe   et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 36 ans et est marie à Francine, une femme de ménage.

Il fait  de bière dans son bistrot  depuis 10 ans. 

Il  est s à son cinquième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de caisse de bière (10 caisses)  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait     voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Evariste is part of the Abashizehamwe group, and lives in Bujumbura. He is 36 years old and is married to Francine, a cleaning lady. 

For the past ten years he has been selling beer in his bar.

This is his fifth credit loan with Turame. He will use the Kiva loan to increase his working capital and buy many cases of beer (10 cases) for resale, to earn more.

In coming years he would like to ensure his children's education.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy many cases of beer (10 cases) for resale, to earn more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit to supply his business.

loans.name: Umushitsi Group

texts.fr:
Evariste  fait partie du groupe  Umushitsi  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 52 ans et est marié à Spès, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de 9 à 22 ans, tous étudient.

Il a sous sa charge 1 enfant membre de sa famille élargie.

Il fait le commerce de la bière dans son bistrot  depuis 7 ans. 

Il  est s à son  deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de caisses de bière   à revendre pour gagner plus. 
	
Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait    voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Evariste is part of the Umushitsi group, and lives in Bujumbura. He is 52 years old and is married to Spès, a farmer. Together they have five children whose ages range from 9 to 22 years, and all of whom attend school. He also has under his care one child who is part of his extended family.

For the past seven years he has been selling beer in his bar. 

This is his second credit loan with Turame. He will use the Kiva loan to increase his working capital and buy many cases of beer for resale, to earn more. 

In coming years he would like to ensure his children's education.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy many cases of beer for resale, to earn more

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus dos hijos, vive en el municipio de El Carmen De Viboral desde donde se gana la vida con la producción y venta de arequipe, panelitas, brownies, panes, entre otros.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Paola y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Paola desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima como leche, chocolate, azúcar, entre otros, y de esta forma mejorar sus productos.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia.

Con este préstamo estarás apoyando a una mujer emprendedora y humilde de Colombia!
texts.en:
Paola is a humble and hardworking woman who has devoted a large part of her life to caring for her two children. She lives in the town of El Carmen de Viboral. Paola earns her living by producing and selling caramel sauce, milk caramel fudge, brownies, bread, and other items.

Her foods are sold primarily to neighbors in her area. They are aware of the flavor of her products, so they are always looking to buy delicious treats that are well-prepared.

Paola wants to increase her food sales and work more comfortably. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as milk, chocolate, sugar, and other items, so that she can improve her products. This loan will enable her to get ahead in her business so that she can generate the necessary income for sustaining her family.

With this loan, you can support an enterprising and humble woman from Colombia!

loans.use: to buy milk, chocolate, sugar, and other supplies.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kolomosso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec  Djeneba Madou, assise 2ème de droite à  gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 170 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women who on average are 44 years old with three children, all living in traditional families in Kolomosso, one of the villages of Koutiala, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Djeneba Madou, the second person kneeling from right to left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, small agricultural equipment, and pay for plowing and weeding to maintain one hectare (about 2.4 acres).

After harvest the production will be sold at village level and in Koutiala, to a mixed clientele. She expects to make average profits of 170,000 CFA francs by the end of the growing season.

This profit will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy seeds, agricultural inputs, farming equipment, and pay for weeding

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 29-year-old vigorous lady, separated from her husband and living at her brother's home. 
She has been sewing clothes at home for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the generated income for supporting her entire family. She has been using a manual machine, now she wants to buy a profession sewing machine, which works automatically through electricity. So she can sew clothing on time.
However, due to lack of funds, she is unable to buy new sewing machine. For this reason, Rubina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner brac Pakistan. She intends to use this loan amount to buy a new sewing machine to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income for her children. 
She thanks Kiva and field partner, brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machine to set up a tailoring business at home.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:

Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide et le Riz avec  Koumba, assise au bout et à  gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  ½ hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.name: Maa Bastrani Group

texts.en:
In June 2014, 11 women from Thakpali village of Khariar block of Nuapada district in Odisha, India, formed a Self Help Group named Maa Bastrani to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their existing business. Priyabati is one of them, the lady standing third from right in the photo raising her hand. 

Priyabati is 27 and is from a very poor background; she lives with her husband, one son and one daughter. Her family belongs to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category. People from the BPL category live on less than one dollar a day. Her children are continuing schooling in the village school. 

Priyabati has been running a spice selling business with items like onion, garlic, chili, cumin seeds, coriander, etc., for the last eight years. Her husband goes to five weekly markets of her locality in a week with the bulk of the items on a bike and sells in the market. Apart from this, she also cultivates vegetables and has a vegetable vending business. Her monthly income from the existing business is 5,000 rupees. Out of this income she has been able to manage her household expenses and spent some income for the education of her children in a very cut short manner. 

She wants to increase stock in her business to earn more income for the better livelihood of her family. So the loan will be utilized to purchase more of the items like onion, garlic, chili, cumin seeds, coriander, etc., she sells in bulk to keep the stock up for a month. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs, as she will replenish her stock frequently, and she can add a substantial income to her present income. Priyabati hopes to provide a better education to her children and construct a good house.

The other ten members of the group are doing milk businesses, footwear selling, a general store, vegetable cultivation, etc.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing onion, garlic, chili, cumin seeds, coriander, etc., to earn more income for the better livelihood of her family.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 5  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kolomosso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 7 group are married women who on average are 42 years old with three children, all living in traditional families in Kolomosso, one of the villages of Koutiala, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

The selected crops are groundnuts and rice featuring Zie, sitting on the far right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, small agricultural equipment, and pay for plowing and weeding to maintain one hectare (about 2.47 acres).

After harvest the production will be sold at village level and in Koutiala, to a mixed clientele. She expects an average profit of 180,000 CFA francs by the end of the growing season.

This profit will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy seeds, agricultural inputs, farming equipment, and pay for plowing and weeding.

loans.name: Om Sai Group

texts.en:
In June 2014, 12 women from Khariar town of Nuapada district in Odisha, India, formed a Self Help Group named Om Sai to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and increase their business. Chandrakala, the straightforward and positive lady, is one of them. She hails from a middle class family. The lady standing fourth from left in the photo raising her hand is Chandrakala. She is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, aged 10 and 5 years. 

Chandrakala has been running a press paper plate making unit in her house for last five years with the help of her husband. She has a couple of leaf plates pressing machines. She supplies her products to the retailers of the same town and other villages within a 20 miles radius. She also takes orders for making plates for different social ceremonies like marriage, festivals, etc.

She purchases raw materials like paper and polythene from the nearest wholesale market 200 kilometers away on a monthly basis. She gets a monthly income of 6,000 rupees from the above business. Out of this income, she is hardly able to manage her household and business expenses. Due to the better quality of her product and timely delivery, the demand for her units is on the rise. But to meet the orders of the purchasers, funding was a problem for her. So she desires to spread out her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. From the present loan, Chandrakala has intended to purchase a volume of raw materials like paper, polythene, plates, bowls and glass frames, and to buy a press machine for making plastic glass. This will help her to decrease her purchasing and transport expenditures as well as catch the attention of more clients. Chandrakala hopes to accumulate a sufficient amount for construction of a good house and provide a better education to her sons. 

The other 11 members of the group are running general stores, vending vegetables, vending groundnuts, etc.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of a volume of paper, polythene, plate and bowl frames, glass frames, etc., and buy a press machine for making plastic glass.

loans.name: Asri Lestari Group

texts.en:
The result from the pig sales of the Asri Lestari group is very good. In the six months of the loan term, they managed to keep the pigs well, avoid decrease, and the pigs grew fat and healthy. The ideal weight was reached. The group made their payment on time, and the meeting was attended by all members. 

Ni Luh, as the head, is very happy for her own result and also for the success of her group. Two of the members got enough profit and continued the pig business with their own money. They are very happy and said thank you to all lenders, Kiva and MUK for the support. With full support from her family, Ni Luh decided to continue her loan to increase her business.

With six members left, the Asri Lestari group receives their new loan of 9,900,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah). This loan is focused to purchase superior piglets and feed.

With her loan, Ni Luh purchases three superior piglets for fattening and will use the rest for feed. To reduce the cost, Ni Luh combined a mixture feed. She hopes in the next five months, the progress for pig growth will be fast, and she can sell with a high price. Her husband helps her business by finding a traditional feed, such as banana leaf, every day from his garden. With this business, she hopes she can save and renovate her kitchen.

The group hopes for assistance and monitoring by the vet.

loans.use: to purchase three superior piglets for fattening and to use the rest for feed
