loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more snack foods, soft drinks, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, noodles, canned goods and eggs to resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Mary, 56 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Mwitha, a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married and is blessed with seven adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 15 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Kitale area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” 

Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mae is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Mae has a food vending business in the Philippines. Mae requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Mae has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Mae would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Fatima is 33 years old and four of her children are in school.

Fatima has a computer gaming business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy an additional unit for her computer gaming station.

Fatima has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit for her computer gaming station.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than four years now.
 
Susan is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. With this, she will be able to raise healthy pigs that she can then sell in the market. In the future, Susan dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Hannie

texts.en:
Hannie is 55 years old, married and has five children. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Hannie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 20 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Hannie would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 49 years old, married and has five children. To make a living, she raises hogs for future sale and sells vegetables for additional income. She uses her profits for their daily expenses for meals and reinvests in the business. She wants to increase her sales so she needs additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy tomatoes, squash and eggplant. She hopes to continue selling fruits and vegetables so she can save funds for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, squash and eggplant

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is the age of 25, living with her two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been providing services for polishing newly constructed floors. He polishes the concrete and marble floors. For this purpose, he uses a floor-polishing machine. He has been providing these services for many years. A few days ago, his floor-polishing machine stopped working due to fluctuations in electricity. For this reason, he wants to buy a new machine but he does not have enough cash in hand to do so. Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy a new floor-polishing machine and continue his services smoothly.

loans.use: To buy a new floor-polishing machine

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella, 48, is married to a farmer and blessed with seven children. She has been selling ducks for a living for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 1,000 weekly. Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase duck feed for her ducks. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase duck feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 39 years old and married with four children.

Marites works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marites has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns an income from farming rice.

Marites aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sri

texts.en: Meet Sri. He lives with five people in the family home in Tangerang, a satellite city located at the south of Jakarta. Sri is single yet he is planning to marry in the near future. Sri runs a small shop that sells mobile phones, mobile phone airtime credits and some drinks. He began working with Ruma three months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends. In the photo, Sri is sitting in his small shop.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao is 21 years old and a mother of two little children. She lives in a small village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer and her husband is a farmer too. This couple manages a rice farming business, which is the sole source of their income. They grow rice and sell the crop to the local dealers with an average daily income of USD 10.00.

Sreymao wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cherryl is 37 years old and four of her children are in school.

Cherryl has a food vending business in the Philippines.She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Cherryl has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Cherryl would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic matter to grow bananas and cacao

They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their second loan, and their previous loan has been repaid correctly.

Konotan, who is second from the left in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs, seeds, and farming materials, and to pay the cost of plowing and weeding one hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops will be sold in the village and around Koutiala to a mixed group of customers.

Konotan hopes to earn an average profit of 175,000 francs CFA after the harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, farm inputs, and farming materials, and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es: Gumercindo, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos, actualmente vive solo, en el municipio de San Marcos, Santa Barbara.Se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como ser maíz y frijoles, Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años, el maíz y frijol lo vende en quintal o en libras en la comunidad o mercado local. El préstamo que solicita es de 5,000 lempiras el cual lo invertirá en la compra de abonos y pesticidas para fertilizar y mejorar sus cultivos. Su meta es  mejorar su vivienda y comprar un terreno más grande para cultivar.
texts.en: Gumercindo, 24, is single and does not have any children and currently lives on his own in the municipality of San Marcos, Santa Barbara. He makes his living growing bulk grains such as corn and beans. He has been carrying out this job for the last four years and he sells the corn and beans in quintals [approximately 46 kg) or pounds in the community or the local market. The loan that Gumercindo is seeking is 5,000 Honduran Lempiras will be invested in the purchase of manure and pesticides to fertilize and improve his crops. Gumercindo's aim is to improve his home and to buy a larger plot of land to grow crops.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad is aged 39 and lives with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband is a milkman by profession and sells milk to retailers and common people of his locality.  A few days ago, one of the buffaloes died due to disease and this loss affected the milk production.

Shamshad's husband wants to buy a buffalo so that he can compensate for the loss and maintain the production of milk. But he does not have enough cash in hand to buy a buffalo.

Therefore, Shamshad has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy a buffalo. Thus Shamshad's husband can easily maintain his monthly income and look after his family. 

Shamshad is very happy about receiving this loan and thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for milk production.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun is 53 years old and a mother of five children, four of whom are dependant and a one who is married. She lives in a community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She manages a rice farming business in a small farmland located near her house. She grows rice and sells the crop to the local dealers with an average daily income of USD 5.00.

Oun wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine (toilet) to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine (toilet),

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal is 45 years old and a single mother of one dependant child and another child who is married. She lives in a community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She manages a rice farming business in a small farmland located near her house. She grows rice and sells the crop to the local dealers with an average daily income of USD 5.00.

Phal wants to improve the general living conditions of her entire family by having a latrine (toilet) to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine (toilet).

loans.name: Iris Marlen

texts.es: Doña Iris, tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 3 hijos, vive con ellos, en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  Se dedica a la  venta de mercadería como ropa, cosméticos zapatos y otros. Este negocio lo tiene hace 10 años, vende  en su casa y  ambulante.Ofrece ropa como  camisas, blusas, pantalones, zapatos, cosméticos etc. Siempre se ha dedicado al mismo negocio, Ha solicitado el cuarto ciclo de préstamo que es por 10,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de más producto como ropa,calzado y cosmeticos para incrementar su inventario y así poder extenderse a otras comunidades. Su meta es seguir creciendo con su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Iris is 40 years old, she is single and has three children with whom she lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. She makes her living selling merchandise such as clothes, cosmetics, shoes and so on. She has been running this business for ten years from her home and in the streets. She sells clothes such as shirts, blouses, trousers, shoes, cosmetics and so on. She has always worked in this same business. She is seeking this fourth loan cycle for 10,000 Honduran Lempiras to invest in the purchase of more products such as clothes, shoes and cosmetics to increase her inventory and therein expand the business to other communities. 

Iris aims to continue expanding the business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Ebtsamat Al- Hayat Group

texts.en:
This group, Ebtsamat Al- Hayat, consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 190,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Iman is a 32-year-old married woman with one-year-old son and lives with her family in her own house in the capital city of Sana'a. She is the leader of the group. She has a University education, and now she is an employee as a teacher in a private school. The money that she receives from her job is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Iman lost her own phone last month and now, she is without a phone and her house has very old furniture. The phone is very important to connect her with other people, particularly in her business, and most of the furniture inside her house is very old and needs to be replaced. For this reason, Iman decided to apply for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase new phone and new furniture for her house. 

Iman looks forward to starting and managing her own private school business.

loans.use: to purchase new phone and many of the new furniture for her house.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: Jose, tiene 31 años de edad,  está soltero, no tiene hijos, vive solo, en una comunidad del municipio de  San Marcos, Santa Barbara. Se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como ser maíz y frijoles. La producción la vende en el mercado local, en grano o en elote. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años, anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como jornalero a  otras personas y ahora es propio. El préstamo es de 6,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y semilla mejorada para la siembra y poder tener mejores cosechas. Su meta es mejorar su vivienda y comprar un terreno para cultivarlo.
texts.en:
Jose is 31 years old, he is single, he doesn't have any children and he lives alone in a community of the municipality of San Marcos, Santa Barbara. He makes his living growing bulk grains such as corn and beans. He sells what he grows in the local market in grains or on the cob. Jose has been performing this activity for the last eight years, he previously worked as a laborer for other people and now he is his own boss. 

The loan is for 6,000 Honduran Lempiras is to buy manure and improved seeds to sow and be able to have better crops. Jose aims to improve his home and buy a plot of land to grow them.

loans.use: to buy manure and improved corn and bean seeds to sow.

loans.name: Ridwan

texts.en:
Ridwan lives with his wife and four other family members in West Bandung, a regency located in West Java province. Ridwan's wife works as a hairdresser staff in a local hair salon. 

To support his family, Ridwan realized that he needs to find another source of income. Ridwan met a staff member of Kiva field partner, Ruma, through his friend and decided to try selling mobile airtime. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekend. This loan will help him run the mobile airtime business and support his plans for more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Aydee Oneyda

texts.es: Aydee, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia, en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y pollos, este negocio lo tiene hace 2 años y 3 meses en su casa, esta es su fuente de ingresos. El monto de su préstamo es de 10,000 lempiras, este préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de gallinas y pollos y revender y ofrecer una mejor ave. Su meta es poner un local grande para ampliar la cría de aves y poder educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aydee is 42 years old, she is married, has three children and lives with her family in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. She makes her living rearing hens and chicken, a business which she has been running for the last two years and three months from her home, which is her source of income. Aydee is seeking a loan of 10,000 Honduran Lempiras, which she will invest in the purchase of hens and chicken for resale and in order to offer her customers a better quality of poultry. 

Aydee aims to have a large area to rear more poultry and be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy hens and chicken to rear, fatten and sell.

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr: DEGGO est un groupement de femmes qui est composé de 05 personnes. Elles habitent toutes dans le même quartier et font pratiquement la même activité génératrice de revenu dans des endroits différents.  La présidente s’appelle Mame Khary, on le reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Elle est mariée  et mère de famille qui es t âgée de 47 ans. Etant à leur 3ème prêt, elle demande ce montant pour acheter et vendre de la viande de bœuf. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses journalières et les frais de scolarités de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité. Elle démarre sa journée à 7h 30mm pour la terminer à 16h. A l’avenir, elle souhaite obtenir son propre magasin et être autonome sur le plan financier et gagner les autres marchés pour la vente de viande de bœuf.
texts.en: Deggo is a group of five women, who all live in the same district and have virtually the same income-generating activity in different places. The president of the group is called Mame Khary and is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is a 47-year old married mother. The group is on its third loan and she is requesting this sum to buy and sell beef. She helps her husband with the daily outgoings and her children's school fees. She has more than ten years experience in her business, and starts her day at 7.30 am, finishing at 4 pm. In the future she would like to get her own shop, be financially autonomous and spread to other markets to sell her beef.

loans.use: to buy meat to resell on a retail basis.

loans.name: Becoro  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BECORO III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DIANICORO, un des villages de N’KOURABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le gombo avec  MAMOU, 1ère personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Becoro III group are married women, who average 32 years of age with four children each; they all live in polygamous families in Dianicoro, one of the villages in N'Kouraba in Mali's second administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can run their farming activities smoothly during the winter season. They are on their second seasonal loan with the institution.

Mamou, who is standing on the far left of the photo, grows groundnut and gombo. With her loan, she is planning to buy inputs and seeds, as well as to pay for labor to farm a hectare of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in the village to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers. She is expecting to make an average profit of 95,000FCFA per season, which will allow her to repay her loan and also help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to pay for labor as well as to buy inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Becoro  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BECORO II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DIANICORO, un des villages de N’KOURABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mil avec  MAMOU, 1ère personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  145.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Becoro II group are married women, who average 32 years of age with five children each; they all live in polygamous families in Dianicoro, one of the villages in N'Kouraba in Mali's second administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can run their farming activities smoothly during the winter season. They are on their second seasonal loan with the institution.

Mamou, who is standing on the far left of the photo, grows groundnut and millet. With her loan, she is planning to buy inputs and seeds, as well as to pay for labor to farm 1,5 hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in the village to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers. She is expecting to make an average profit of 145,000FCFA per season, which will allow her to repay her loan and also help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Deisy Marilyn

texts.es: Deysi, tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive con su madre, en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Ella tiene su propio negocio donde vende  productos de la canasta básica como arroz,azucar, manteca, huevos, pan, productos de limpieza etc  y mercadería como ropa, cosméticos y otros. Este negocio lo tiene hace 8 años en su casa.Anteriormente tenía un trabajo asalariado y mejor decidio por tener lo propio.  El  préstamo es el segundo ciclo y es por 21,000 lempiras para surtir el negocio de granos basicos, manteca, azucar,pan, huevos, golosinas, etc.y tener más clientes y mayor ganancia. Su meta es crecer como microempresaria y generar ganancias.
texts.en:
Deysi, 33, is single, she doesn't have any children and lives with her mother in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. She has her own business where she sells staple goods such as rice, sugar, butter, eggs, bread, cleaning products, etc. as well as merchandise such as clothes, cosmetics and so on. She has been running this business for eight years from her home. Beforehand she had a paid job and she then decided to have her own. This loan is in the second loan cycle for a value of 21,000 Honduran Lempiras to stock her business with bulk grains, butter, sugar, bread, eggs and sweets and so on, as well as to have more customers and improve her sales. 

Deysi aims to grow as a micro entrepreneur and generate more sales.

loans.use: to stock bulk grains, butter, sugar, eggs, sweets, bread and so on for sale.

loans.name: Becoro  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BECORO IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DIANICORO, un des villages de N’KOURABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le mil et le gombo avec  FANTA, 2ème personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Becoro IV group are married women, who average 34 years of age with four children each; they all live in polygamous families in Dianicoro, one of the villages in N'Kouraba in Mali's second administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can run their farming activities smoothly during the winter season. They are on their second seasonal loan with the institution.

Fanta, who is standing second from the left in the photo, grows groundnut, millet and gombo. With her loan, she is planning to buy inputs and seeds, as well as to pay for labor to farm two hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in the village to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers. She is expecting to make an average profit of 95,000FCFA per season, which will allow her to repay her loan and also help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Manko Group

texts.fr: MANKO  est un groupement de promotion d’intérêt économique  qui évolue dans le commerce de l’habillement. Il est composé de 5 personnes et vivent toutes dans le  même quartier et se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin. Ils font aussi la même activité. MAKHOUREDIA est la présidente, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans et demande ce crédit  de ce montant pour acheter et vendre des habillements, bijoux, et autres produits de beauté pour femmes. Mariée et mère de famille, elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de santé de ses enfants. Elle quitte sa maison à 9h pour y revenir vers les couts de 18h. Elle souhaite avoir une expérience de crédit et gagner le monopole du marché. Elle voudrait aussi augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Manko is an economic interest group, which is making progress in the clothing trade. It is made up of five people who all live in the same district and meet whenever they need to. They also have the same businesses. Makhourédia is the president, and she is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She has more than five years' experience and is requesting this loan to be able to buy and sell clothes, jewelry and beauty products for women. She is a married mother and helps her husband with the daily outgoings and her children's health costs. She leaves her house at 9 o'clock in the morning and returns at around 6 o'clock in the evening. She would like to build up her borrowing experience and gain a monopoly of the market. She would also like to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
“Las Estrellas” es el nombre que decidieron ponerle al grupo las 6 integrantes; ellas comentan que al observar el cielo y ver las estrellas se sienten tranquilas y muy a gusto, es por ello que han elegido ese nombre para el grupo, de tal manera que al momento en que el oficial de crédito diga en nombre tengan la misma sensación de tranquilidad.

La localidad donde se encuentra el grupo es 90% zona cañera, el otro 10% representa la siembra y cosecha de naranjas. Al recorrer la carretera que conduce al lugar donde viven las integrantes, se puede apreciar la belleza del paisaje: montañas cubiertas de verdes árboles.

Los integrantes del grupo son:

Antolina - Venta de Abarrotes
Maricela - Venta de Pollo
Ana - Venta de Productos naturistas
Humberta - Venta de Abarrotes
Maria - Venta de Antojitos
Dora - Venta de Antojitos

Desde hace un año, Ana se dedica a la venta de medicamento naturista por catálogo, ella ofrece sus productos de casa en casa tres días a la semana en los cuales se dedica a recorrer  las calles de la comunidad. Comenta que algunas personas llegan a buscarla a su domicilio pues los clientes recomiendan el producto. Con las ganancias obtenidas ha invertido poco a poco en el negocio, ha cubierto gastos personales y aporta para los gastos de la casa, para que su negocio siga avanzando y alcanzar uno de sus ideales: poner una tienda de medicina naturista. Ana necesita comprar catálogos y medicamento que sus clientes le han solicitado, es por eso que necesita el apoyo económico de VisionFund México y de Kiva.

*En la foto: Ana viste de azul y lleva una bolsa blanca.
texts.en:
"Las Estrellas" [The Stars] is the name the 6 members decided to give their group; they say that when looking at the sky and seeing the stars, they feel calm and very comfortable, which is why they have chosen that name for the group, so at that time the loan officer says the name has the same feeling of tranquility.

The town where the group is, is 90% sugarcane and the other 10% is the planting and harvesting of oranges. As you take the road that leads up to the area to where the members live, you can appreciate the beauty of the landscape: mountains covered in green trees.

The members of the group are: 

Antolina - grocery sales
Maricela - chicken sales
Ana - health food products sales
Humberta - grocery sales
Maria - traditional food Sales
Dora - traditional food Sales

For a year, Ana has been working selling natural remedies from catalogues, she goes from house to house three days a week on which she walks the streets of the community. She says that some people come looking for her at her home, as her customers have recommended her products. With the earnings she has made, she has invested bit by bit in her business, covered personal costs and supported with the costs of the home, so that her business continues to move forward, she needs the support of VisionFund México and Kiva.


* In the photo: Ana is wearing blue and has a white bag.

loans.use: to buy catalogues and remedies.

location.town: COL. PALMA SOLA MUNICIPIO OMEALCA VERACRUZ

loans.name: San Bernardo Group

texts.es:
San Bernardo es el nombre del grupo consolidado por 6 personas, todas ellas originarias de la misma comunidad, trabajadores, honrados, humildes y  más que conocidos, se consideran una familia. La comunidad se encuentra en la parte alta del cerro donde la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la siembra de plátano, caña, nanche y árboles de cedro cuya madera también se comercializa.

Saúl - Venta de block para construcción
Jacinto - Venta de hoja de pltano, además es jornalero y transporta madera y animales
José Matías - Venta de madera y de hojas de plátano
Rosaura - Venta de antojitos
Maura - Venta de refrescos
Roberto - Venta de madera

José  se dedica a la venta de madera y de hojas de plátano las cuales se utilizan para envolver los típicos tamales mexicanos (pequeño pastel de harina de maíz relleno de carne, queso, chile, etc).

A José le gusta andar en moto, es una persona amable, y trabajadora, con las ganancias de su actividad sustenta los gastos de su hogar y brinda mantenimiento a su equipo de trabajo.

Comenta que al trabajar en el campo se siente muy contento, que al vender madera para la construcción de alguna casa le satisface puesto que sabe que una familia tendrá un lugar donde protegerse del sol, la lluvia, el viento, un lugar donde verán crecer a sus hijos. Con el préstamo otorgado comprará 1 machete, 1 lima, 1 cadena para la motosierra, aceite, gasolina y la batería para el carro donde transporta la madera y las hojas de platáno. José agradece la oportunidad de renovar su negocio con el nuevo material.

*En la imagen: José viste una playera a rayas blancas y azules.
texts.en:
San Bernardo is the name of the group made up of 6 people, all of them are from the same community, hardworking, honorable, humble and more than just acquaintances, they consider themselves family. The community is on the higher part of the hill where the majority of the residents work planting bananas, sugarcane, nanche [a small, sweet, yellow fruit] and cedar trees, the wood of which is also sold.

Saúl - building blocks sales
Jacinto - banana leaf sales, also a day laborer and transport of wood and animals 
José Matías - wood and banana leaf sales
Rosaura - grocery sales
Maura - drink sales
Roberto - wood sales

Jose works selling wood and banana leaves, which are used to wrap the typical Mexican tamales (small flour cakes stuffed with meat, cheese, chillies, etc.)

Jose likes getting about on his motorcycle, he is a friendly and hardworking person, the earnings he makes from his work support his household costs and help maintain his work equipment.

He says that he feels very happy working in the countryside, that selling wood for the construction of homes satisfies him because he knows that a family will have a place to shelter from the sun, rain and the wind, a places where they will bring up children. With the approved loan, he will buy a machete, a file, a chainsaw chain, oil, gas and a battery for the car which will transport the wood and banana leaves. Jose is grateful for the opportunity to renew his business with the new equipment.

* In the photo: Jose is wearing a white and blue striped shirt.

loans.use: to buy a machete, a file, a chainsaw chain, oil, gas and a battery.

loans.name: Principiantes - 32 Group

texts.es:
Lizet es una mujer de 24 años de edad, casada madre de dos hijos y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
Ella es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora, fuerte, soñadora y muy trabajadora; su negocio lo realiza en la feria de ‘”La Cancha” en Cochabamba una ciudad caracterizada por ser Vibrante, bulliciosa; es una de las ciudades de auge de Bolivia. Ella tiene muchos sueños y deseos de superación, por tales motivos formó una banca de personas con negocios y necesidades similares para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar su forma de vida (ella esta sentada a la derecha de la fila, suéter azul).
Lizet es de tez morena, estatura media, cabello largo negruzco y su lengua natal es el quechua que combina con el español para el comercio bilingüe de la zona. Su negocio es la venta de ropa, cada madrugada diariamente ella se prepara para llevar sus prendas de vestir a su puesto de ‘’la cancha’’, al llegar inmediatamente ordena las prendas en maniquíes y colgadores para que sus clientes la vean y se aproximen para la venta. Ella sueña con el crecimiento de su negocio y para lograrlo necesita realizar la compra por mayor de ropa.
Es por esos motivos que Lizet solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor y ayudar con la educación de sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Lizet is a 24 year old woman, married and mother of two children and her business is clothing sales. She is a very enterprising woman, feisty, strong, dreamy and very hardworking: her business is in the market of La Cancha in Cochabamba, a city know for being vibrant, bustling; it is one of the boom towns of Bolivia. She has many dreams and hopes to get ahead, so she formed a communal bank with small businesspeople with similar needs to request a loan and improve her way of life (she is seated at the front of the row, blue sweater).

Lizet is of a dark complexion, medium height, long blackish hair and her mother tongue is Quechua, which she combines with Spanish to do business in this bilingual area. Her business is clothing sales, every day, every morning she gets ready to take her garments to her stall in "la chancha", when she arrives she immediately arranges the garments on mannequins and hangers so her customers see them and can get close for the sale. She dreams of growing her business and to achieve this she needs to buy clothes wholesale. This is the reason Lizet is requesting a loan to buy clothing wholesale and help to send her two children to school.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale and help with the education of a member's two children.

loans.name: Ernesto De Jesus

texts.es: Ernesto de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado de su esposa y sus dos hijos, él se dedica a la venta de sorbete artesanal,  el fabrica el sorbete en su  mismo lugar de residencia y vende  en distintas zonas de donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias ayuda a solventar algunos de los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Ernesto solicita un crédito para compra de materia prima como frutas, hielo, leche, conos, etc. y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 36 years old, he lives in his own home with his family, his wife and two children. He works selling handmade sorbet, he makes the sorbet in the same place where he lives, and sells it in different areas where he resides. With the income he makes, he will pay some of the costs of running his home.

Ernesto is requesting a loan to buy raw ingredients such as fruit, ice, milk, cones, etc. and be able to give his family a better quality of life, without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fruit, ice, milk, cones, etc.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado de su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene mucha experiencia en las ventas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda a solventar algunos de los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar,  Ana solicita un crédito para comprar ropa de damas y caballeros todo por mayor y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her family, her husband and two children. She works selling clothing, she has a lot of sales experience, her business is located in her place of residence, the income she makes from her sales helps cover some of the costs of running her home. Ana is requesting a loan to buy wholesale men's and women's clothing and be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben is 42 years old, married and has three children in school. He owns and manages a small photo shop within the town proper. Due to the high cost of school fees, he wants to further improve his business to increase his income. Having not enough capital, he would like to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders through ASKI - an amount of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), to buy needed tarpaulin supplies, inks, school supplies, frames, digital camera and some snack foods to sell. He believes that his loan will enable him to improve his business and he hopes that someday he will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy needed tarpaulin supplies, inks, school supplies, frames, digital camera and groceries to sell.

location.town: Brgy. San Geronimo, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la confección de ropa y a la serigrafía, su taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo ayuda a solventar algunos de los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Leticia solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima como:  telas, pinturas, hilos, etc.  para seguir con su trabajo, y asi tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Leticia is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children. She decided many years ago to work in dressmaking and screen printing, her workshop is located in her place of residence.

The earnings from her work will help cover some of the costs of running her home, Leticia is requesting a loan to buy raw materials such as: fabric, paint, thread, etc. to continue with her work, and thus have a better quality of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, paint, thread, etc.

loans.name: Flor Elizabeth

texts.es: Flor de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su  mamá y sus dos hijos, desde hace años que se dedica  al oficio de corte y confección, su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar las necesidades y los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Flor solicita un crédito para la compra de mas tela, botones, agujas, etc. y asi tener inventario a la mano para seguir con su trabajo, y  poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Flor is 45 years old, she lives in her own home with her mother and her two children. She has been working in alterations and dressmaking for many years, her business is located near her place of residence. With her earnings from her work she is able to cover the necessities and costs which she has for her household. 

Flor is requesting a loan to buy more fabric, buttons, needles, etc. and thus have more inventory at hand to continue her work, and be able to give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more fabric, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is 30 years old and lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by profession. He has been constructing buildings and houses for many years. He is very expert in his art; he has been constructing a lot of beautiful buildings in his carrer. He uses tools such as a brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, jointer, and level, which have been wearing off. He wants to buy new tools and a floor polishing machine to continue his construction work but he does not have enough cash in hand.
 
Therefore, Fouzia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can be empowered to buy tools and a floor polishing machine for construction.

Fouzia thanks Kiva and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, jointer, level and floor polishing machine.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 32 years old and married with one child who is in school; she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Nida has been in this business for two years. 

In the future Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for the house

loans.name: Jenabelle

texts.en:
Jenabelle works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc.

Jenabelle has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase many home appliances for the house.

loans.name: Adah

texts.en:
Adah, her husband, and her three children live in Cianjur, a city situated at the foot of Mount Gede-Pangrango, West Java. Adah's husband works as a construction worker. 

To support her family living, Adah runs a small shop that has snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. She joined Ruma because she wanted to try out a mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. 

In the photo, Adah is sitting in front of her small shop.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cheese, cream and ham.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 23 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus hijos y sus esposo quien trabaja en una empresa privada, ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logra solventar algunas necesidades que tiene su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor, para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The member is 23 years old and lives in her own house with her children and husband, who works at a private company. She is a very responsible and hardworking person; she makes a living selling clothing for men, women, and children. 

With what she earns from her sales, paired with the help from her husband, she is able to pay for most necessities at home. She is asking for the loan to buy wholesale clothing, in order to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing

loans.name: Alba Mara

texts.es: Doña Alba es una madre soltera que aún tiene a su cargo a sus dos hijos. Ella posee su propio negocio, una pulpería con la cual ha logrado salir adelante junto con hijos. Nos demuestra que a pesar de estar solo ha logrado crecer su negocio, ha diversificado sus  productos, ha obtenido más ventas y ganancias. Sin embargo ella seguirá trabajando fuertemente para que su negocio crezca cada vez mas es por tal razón que solicita un préstamo para comprar mas productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabones, detergentes, dulces para los niños entre otros productos. Estimando que el préstamo a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda por que lograra mejorar su vivienda y de igual forma la vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dona Alba is a single mother that is fully responsible for her two children. She has her own business, a grocery store, with which she has succeeded in getting ahead together with her children. Despite being alone, she has managed to grow her business, diversify her products, and obtain many sales and profits.

However, she must still continue working hard in order for her business to grow. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan in order to buy products like rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, and children's sweets, among other products. She believes that the loan application will be a lot of help, allowing her to better her living situation and the lives of her children.

loans.use: to buy more products, such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, and children's sweets, among other products.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora que gracias a su esfuerzo pudo sacar adelante a su familia. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso para poder surtir su despensa, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder comprar azúcar. Harina, arroz y bebidas y con eso poder surtir su negocio, agradece por la oportunidad que ha recibido.
texts.en:
Gregoria has a store in which she works every day, beginning very early in the morning. She is a fighter, and has sacrificed a lot; thanks to her efforts, she has been able to raise a family. 

She used her previous loan to stock her store, which was really helpful. Now, she is asking for a new loan with which to buy sugar, flour, rice, and drinks. With this, she will again stock her store. She is very grateful for the opportunity that she has received.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, rice, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy threads, needles, various types of frames, pins and barbed wire.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new and used tires to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizers, herbicides and plastic crates.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à SANZANA un village dans la commune de DOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame BINTOU débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI I. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The 10 members of Benkadi 1 Group are married women with an average age of 35. They have an average of four children and mostly live in traditional families in Sanzana, one of the villages in the commune of Dogoni, in the area of Sikasso, the third largest administrative region in Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan; the previous loans were fully repaid. Bintou, standing second from left to right in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kg bags of fertilizer, two canisters of herbicide and to pay for the labor costs of maintaining of 0.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the output is sold at the village level, in Sikasso, to a clientele of men and women for cash and credit. She expects to earn an average profit of 74,000 FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and interest, as well as help her husband with their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicide, and labor costs.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery es una mujer de 31 años de edad, soltera, madre de un hijo y su negocio es la peluquería.
Ella es fuerte, luchadora, emprendedora, perseverante, y muy trabajadora su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de su ciudad un área caracterizada por el enorme mercado popular donde conviven alimentos, ropa y electrodomésticos, y se sostiene por la solidaridad entre las miles de vendedoras organizadas en sus gremiales. Sobre un piso de tierra enlodada por aguas hediondas, encima de taburetes de madera y bajo techos de chapa y lona, se aglomeran puestos de verduras y frutas, pollos y carnes rojas, las infinitas variedades de cereales y papas andinas y un sinfín de alimentos Se intercalan con puestos de ropa, equipos de audio, DVD, cuadernos y bolígrafos, adornos y jabones, y las músicas nacidas de los más increíbles mestizajes.
Mery es de tez morena, cabello castaño largo, estatura mediana. Su negocio atiende de lunes a domingo, desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, donde cada día se ocupa de realizar trenzas, cortes, peinados, tintes, pintado de uñas, etc. Ella sueña tener una casa propia y para comenzar a cumplir sus metas piensa que debe realizar una inversión en muebles  y productos para peluquería, de esa manera incrementará sus ingresos económicos y podrá darun paso en la realización de sus sueños.
Es por esos motivos que Mery solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles y materiales de peluquería y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de su hijo.
texts.en:
Mery is a 31-year-old woman, she is single and mother to one son, her business is a beauty salon. She is strong, a fighter, enterprising, persevering, and hardworking. She works in the southern part of her city, an area which is characterized by the enormous people's market where you can find food, clothing and white goods. The market keeps going thanks to the solidarity of the thousands of vendors that are organized in trade unions. On a floor that is covered with foul-smelling water, above wooden stools and under corrugated tin roofs, are stalls selling fruit and vegetables, poultry and red meat, the infinite varieties of Andean potatoes and cereals and a never-ending amount of food; between these stalls are other that sell clothes, audiovisual equipment, DVDs, books and pens, jewelry and soap, and music of the most incredible mixtures.

Mery is of a dark complexion, she has long chestnut hair and is of average height. She tends her business from Monday to Sunday from 10 am to 10 pm, where she braids, cuts and dyes hair as well as paints nails and so on. Mery dreams of having her own home to start to achieve her goals, she thinks that she needs to invest in beauty salon furniture and products, in this way, she will increase her financial income and will be able to take a step forward in achieving her dreams. It is for these reasons that Mery is seeking a loan to buy beauty salon furniture and products, and with the profits, she will pay her son's school fees.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon furniture and products, and using the profits, pay her son's school fees.

loans.name: San Jorge Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Jorge está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty una zona rural y alejada de la capital del país, que tiene muchas limitaciones y poca comunicación.
La Sra. Andresa es la tesorera del grupo, ella tiene una pequeña despensa donde con sacrificio tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de ese modesto negocio, desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de aceite, Azúcar, Arroz, Harina, para su despensa y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y así dar a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The San Jorge communal bank is starting its first loan cycle through the women's committee in the city of Curuguaty.  This is a rural area far from the capital city, so it has many limitations and is lacking in communication services.

Andresa is the treasurer of the group.  She has a small store which allows her to earn a living to help her family.  She hopes that, over time and with the help of everyone in the community, they can improve their surroundings and give their family's increased security.

The loan she is requesting is to buy oil, sugar, rice and flour for her store so she can continue to expand and give her family all they need for a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy oil, sugar, rice, and flour for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 24 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar junto con su tía, él se dedica al cultivo de plátanos y hortalizas desde hace tres años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, el cliente solicita un crédito para la compra de herbicidas, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder tener junto con su tía una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client is 24 years old and lives with his aunt at a relative's house.  For three years he has been growing bananas and vegetables, selling his products at different markets near his home.  He uses the profit from sales to cover household expenses.  The loan the client is requesting is to buy herbicides, fertilizers and insecticides, etc. so he and his aunt can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy herbicides, fertilizers, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Becoro  V Group

texts.fr:
Les  05 membres du groupe  BECORO V  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 23 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DIANICORO, un des villages de N’KOURABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mil avec  DIATOU, 1ère personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The five members of Becoro V Group are married women with an average age of 23. They have an average of three children and all live in polygamous families in Dianicoro, one of the villages in N'Kouraba, the second largest administrative region in Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their second loan. Diatou, standing at the  far left in the photo, grows groundnuts and millet. With her loan, she plans to buy inputs, seeds, and to pay for the labor costs of maintaining of one hectare of land. After the harvest, the output is sold at the village level to a clientele of resellers and consumers. She expects to earn an average profit of 95,000 FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan, as well as help her husband with their daily expenses

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, inputs, and seeds.

loans.name: Padre Mauricio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Padre Mauricio está en el ciclo número 2 del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza en donde dos señoras se encuentran dentro de la línea de la pobreza, pero ya se ha trabajado con ellas para que vayan aumentando sus ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Del Rosaria quien se dedica al comercio, es decir a la venta de comestibles desde hace tiempo. Gracias a esta actividad ella puede mantener su hogar e ir aumentando sus ingresos. Según su encuesta se encuentra ella ha ido mejorando bastante y siempre busca poder seguir creciendo.
La Sra. Del Rosaria solicita este crédito para la compra de mas insumos para elaborar comidas, como ser carnes, condimentos, verduras, hortalizas, etc.
texts.en:
The communal bank Padre Mauricio is in its second loan cycle through the Women Entrepreneurs' Committee.  All the members work and help each other to get ahead.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey which shows they are at the poverty line but they have received training so they can start increasing their incomes.

One of the group members is Mrs. Del Rosaria who has been selling food for some time.  Throughher work she is able to support her household and increase her earnings.  According to the survey she has improved considerably and always looks for ways to grow.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more ingredients to make food such as meats, condiments, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: To buy meat, condiments, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
Santa Rosa se formó en la ciudad de Encarnación, está ya en su tercer ciclo del programa de comités, también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra.Lourdes.
Ella se dedica al comercio, es decir tiene una Despensa, Bazar y gracias a esta actividad ella puede mantener su hogar e ir aumentando sus ingresos. Según su encuesta se encuentra mejorando sus ingresos y su estilo de vida, comenta que su marido siempre la apoya en todo. Pide este préstamo ya que necesita surtir su despensa y quiere comprar bebidas, comestibles, lácteos, panificados y demás, y con ello poder seguir luchando por mejorar sus ingresos y sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa was formed in the city of Encarnación and is in its third loan cycle in the program of committees. They are also completing the poverty elimination tool, and one of the members is Lourdes.

She works in trade, that is to say she has a grocery store that also sells a variety of good and thanks to this business she can maintain her household and continue increasing her income.  According to the tool, she is improving her income and her lifestyle. She says that her husband always helps her with everything. She asks for this loan since she needs to stock her grocery store and wants to purchase drinks, food products, dairy products, bread products and others. With this, she will be able to continue fighting to increase her income and her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, food, dairy products, bread products and others.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
Las Rosas es un grupo ubicado en una zona 100% cañera, integrado por 4 mujeres muy trabajadoras, simpáticas, amables  y lo mejor de todo, con actividades en común. Dos de ellas son madres solteras y dos, casadas. El tiempo de conocerse las llevo a tomar la decisión de conformar un grupo y solicitar un préstamo a VisionFund México el cual utilizarán para invertir en su negocio. 

Las 4 mujeres emprendedoras son: 
Tomasa y Paola - Venta De Cosmeticos
Eva - Venta De Comida y Zapatos
Beatriz - Venta De Tacos

Recientemente Eva abrió una pequeña fonda, la idea de del negocio surgió por el gusto de cocinar y ofrecerle a los clientes un lugar agradable para comer en familia sin preocuparse de lo que se cocinará en casa. Comenta que el préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de insumos: masa, queso, carne, aceite, crema, verduras, chiles, vasos, platos, refrescos, servilletas para ofrecer un mejor servicio. Eva también se dedica a vender zapatos por catálogo, comenta que continuará con dicha actividad a pesar de haber abierto el restaurante pues sus clientes la siguen buscando para pedirle mercancía.

Eva planea reinevertir sus ganancias en la elaboración de la comida e ir incorporando nuevos guisados para tener más variedad, más satisfacción al cliente y crecimiento. "Mi sueño es tener un gran restaurante” comenta ilusionada.

*En la imagen: doña Eva viste una blusa blanca.
texts.en:
Las Rosas is a group located in an area that is fully dedicated to sugar crops, the group is made up of four very hard working, kind and friendly women who, above all, have activities in common with one another. Two of the members are single mothers and two are married. By the time they got to know each other, they took the decision to set up a group and seek a loan from VisionFund México which they will use to invest in their businesses.

The four women are: 
Tomasa and Paola - Sell cosmetics
Eva - Sells food and shoes
Beatriz - Sells tacos

Eva recently opened up a small restaurant, the idea of the business arose as she likes cooking and offering her customers a nice place to eat in family without having to worry about who was cooking at home. She tells us that she will use the loan to buy supplies such as dough, cheese, meat, oil, cream, vegetables, chili peppers, glasses, dishes, drinks and serviettes to provide a better quality of service. Eva also makes her living selling catalog shoes, she states that she will continue with this activity even though she has opened the restaurants as her customers continue to go to her to ask for goods.

Eva plans to reinvest her profits in the production of food and start including new soups for greater variety, great customer satisfaction and growth. "My dream is to run a large restaurant," she tells us.

* Eva is wearing a white blouse in the picture.

loans.use: to buy dough, cheese, meat, oil, cream, vegetables, chili peppers, glasses, dishes, drinks and serviettes.

loans.name: Zoila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Zoila de 40 años de edad, no estudio debido a que sus padres no tenían los ingresos suficientes para darle los estudios que ella se merecía

Ella está casada el esposo se dedica a cultivar granos básicos, con él ha tenido 4 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, el primero de ellos estudio hasta bachillerato y actualmente está en la 3° brigada de infantería es soldado, la segunda estudio bachillerato a distancia ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar de sus dos hijos, el tercero estudio hasta bachillerato y trabaja en panamá en una empresa constructora y la última estudia bachillerato a distancia en la ciudad, de Zolia solo dependen dos de sus hijos.

Ella se dedica a trabajar como doméstica en la ciudad desde hace 4 años, trabaja con el mismo patrono, antes de esto ella se dedicaba a trabajar la tierra junto a su esposo cultivando maíz y frijol, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, decidió irse de su casa a trabajar para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que tienen que darle el estudio a su ultimo hijo y también tienen que apoyarle a su hija con los gastos de sus nietos, ya que su hija es madre soltera.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para cancelar una deuda que adquirió para el cultivo de granos básicos y debido a la sequía que azoto el país no pudo obtener el suficiente ingreso para cancelar a tiempo,  ya que perdió la cosecha, aparte de esto ella comprara abonos y fertilizantes, ya que volverá a cultivar la tierra hoy que el clima ya cambio.

El sueño más grande de ella, es poder comprar un lote de tierra ya que actualmente donde ella vive no es de ella y desea tener algo propio y construir una casa de un material muy resistente para asegurar la tranquilidad y seguridad de su familia, desea también poder tener la fuerza para seguir trabajando muy duro y sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Zoila is 40 years old. She didn't go to school because her parents lacked the means to give her the education she deserved.

She is married. Her husband makes a living growing basic grains. With him she has four children of legal age. The first one has a high school diploma and is currently a soldier of the 3rd Infantry Brigade. The second one got her high school diploma via distance learning; she is a homemaker and takes care of her two children. The third one has a high school diploma and works at a construction company in Panama. The last one is studying for her high school diploma via distance learning in the city. Only two of Zoila’s children depend on her.

She has been making a living working as a housemaid in the city for four years. She has been working for the same employer. Before doing this, she used to work on the land, growing corn and beans, alongside her husband. She is a very responsible and hard-working person. She decided to start working outside her home to help her husband with the home expenses because they have to provide their last child with education, and they also have to help their daughter with their grandchildren’s expenses since their daughter is a single mother. 

She is requesting a loan to CREDICAMPO to pay off a debt that she incurred when growing basic grains. Because of the severe drought that had affected the country, the harvest failed, and she was unable to generate sufficient income to pay what she owed on time. In addition, she will buy inorganic and organic fertilizers because she will work on the land again now that the weather has changed.

Her biggest dream is to be able to buy a plot of land because she doesn’t own the place where she currently lives, and she wishes to have something of her own. She wants to build a house with very sturdy materials to ensure the safety and peace of mind of her family, and she also wishes to have the strength to keep on working hard and get her family ahead.

loans.use: to pay off a debt that she incurred when growing basic grains. Because of the severe drought that had affected the country, the harvest failed, and she was unable to generate sufficient income to pay what she owed on time. In addition, she will buy inorganic and organic fertilizers because she will work on the land again now that the weather has changed.

loans.name: Jose Sixto

texts.es: José de 45 años de edad vive con su hermano en casa propia, él se dedica a la  vende de CD y DVD, ya tiene cuatro años de trabajar con negocios, que lo tiene ubicado en una zona muy transitada por las personas, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que tiene su hogar, José solicita un crédito para la compra de más CD y DVD por mayor,  y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su hermano.
texts.en: José, 45 years old, lives with his brother in his own house. He works selling CDs and DVDs, and has been in this business for four years. It is located in a high-traffic area. With what he earns from his sales he manages to pay for his household necessities. José asks for a loan to purchase more CDs and DVDs in bulk, and in this way be able to have a better quality of life with his brother.

loans.use: to purchase more CDs and DVDs in bulk.

loans.name: Noris Elizabeth

texts.es: Noris de 30 años de edad vive en casa alquilada junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de lácteos desde hace varios años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, tiene año y medio de dedicarse a su negocio de lo cual ya tiene la experiencia necesaria, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos de los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Noris solicita un crédito para la compra de más productos como: lociones, cremas, shampoo, maquillajes, etc. y así seguir con sus ventas y tener junto con su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Noris is 30 years old, she lives in a rented home with her husband who has been making his living selling dairy products for the last few years. Noris works in the sale of beauty products, she has been working in her business for a year and a half and has already acquired the necessary experience. With what she earns from her sales, and with the help of her husband, they are able to cover some of the household costs. Noris is seeking a loan to buy more products such as lotions, creams, shampoo, make-up and so on, and continue making sales and having a better quality of life for her and her husband.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, shampoo, make-up and so on.

loans.name: Jose Heriberto

texts.es: José de 35 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su compañera de vida y sus dos niños, él se dedica a la  venta de fruta, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee mucha clientela, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, José solicita un crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras por mayor, para darle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: José is 35 years old. He lives in a relative's house with his life's companion and their two children. He sells fruit. His business is located in a very busy area and that is why he has a lot of customers. With what he earns from his sales he is able to cover his household expenses. José is asking for a loan to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale to give his family a better quality of life with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Corina Elizabeth

texts.es: Corina de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su mama y sus dos hijos, quienes estudian actualmente, ella posee una panadería donde se dedica a la elaboración de pan y adicional a eso  también trabaja en la agricultura, con lo que gana de su trabajo logra solventar algunas necesidades de su hogar, Corina solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales e insumos para la elaboración de pan como: harina, levadura, etc. y también para darle mantenimiento al horno que muestra en la fotografía, y así poderle dar  su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 32 year old Corina lives in her own house with her mother and 2 children, who are currently in school. She has a bakery where she makes bread and, in addition, she also works in agriculture. This is how she earns a living and covers the household expenses. Corina is requesting a loan to buy materials and supplies to make bread such as: flour, yeast, etc, and also to maintain her oven (which is shown in the photograph). In this way, she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, etc, and also to maintain her oven.

loans.name: Muhammadsho

texts.ru: Мухаммадшо добропорядочный молодой человек. Он родился в 1995 году. Мухаммадшо не женат и живет с родителями на южной части страны. Он учится в колледже. Мухаммадшо студент 2 курса Информационного и технологического колледжа. Он учится по специальности бухгалтера в очное отделение. Мухаммадшо учится успешно и мечтает в будущем стать высококвалифицированным специалистом. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Muhammadsho is a respectable young man. He was born in 1995, is not married, and lives with his parents in southern Tajikistan. He is in his second year at the Information and Technology College studying accounting full-time. He is a successful student and dreams of becoming a highly qualified professional. He is asking for a loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Benedate

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Benedate, 50 years of age, a very hardworking, progressive and honest farmer from a very remote village in Ndalu in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area is very fertile with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities. She is happily married and a proud mother of 3 children, and together they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures.

Her primary source of income has been eggs, milk and a variety of food crops that she plants on her farm. She also engages in transportation and some small business so as to make ends meet. Although this humble and industrious mother makes profits, she faces the challenge of not producing enough to meet the ready market that is already there.

She is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to put up a greenhouse. Greenhouse farming is a very profitable agricultural venture in Kenya. Greenhouse farming is the production of crops within sheltered structures, and Benedate plans to grow crops within controlled conditions, thereby protecting the crops against the vagaries of weather and against pests and diseases.

Through the loan, she will increase her yields and will have continuous harvest of crops. A greenhouse will enable Benedate to grow and harvest crops within a short time, and this will improve her income because, after a short time, she will be able to gain more income. Through the loan, she is going to permanently change her life, and challenges such as pest and disease will never be a problem because of the sheltered nature of the greenhouse. This loan will make Benedate realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plumbing and electrical goods

loans.name: La Lagunita Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo son personas muy alegres y responsables, ellos viven en una comunidad muy tranquila en el Estado de México. 
Francisca  quien es la representante del grupo tiene 38 años de edad y está casada con el señor Víctor desde hace 23 años, juntos han formado una familia con tres niños los cuales asisten a la escuela. Doña Francisca abrió una tienda de abarrotes hace 10 años. Entonces solo vendía refrescos, dulces y botanas, la cantidad y variedad de mercancía no era sobresaliente ni el número de clientes. Después escuchó hablar de VisionFund México y fue como decidió solicitar un préstamo para hacer una inversión más fuerte en el negocio y comprar otros productos. Fue así que sus ganancias comenzaron a incrementar.
