Doña Francisca comentó “Quise iniciar este negocio porque es más cómodo para mí, no necesito salir de casa para obtener ingresos para la familia, aunque también los animales son una muy buena opción pero también me gusta tener contacto con la gente”. El reto que enfrenta es la falta de una buena fuente de energía eléctrica para poder vender carnes frías. Comenta que en su comunidad falla mucho el servicio de electricidad y su refrigerador no aguantaría para conservar dichos productos en buen estado. Francisca quiere invertir su préstamo en la compra de más mercancía como leche, productos enlatados, refrescos, sal, azúcar, etc.
Así como Doña Francisca, los demás miembros están muy contentos porque su préstamo ayudará a su respectivo negocio: Reyna invertirá en rebosos; Maria Guadalupe R, Ma Guadalupe C y Tomasa, en borregos; Gloria y Miguel, en reces; Benita y Diana, en su tienda de abarrotes; Patricia, en pollos y Ma Cristina en su cibercafé. Además de las actividades antes mencionadas, todas ellas elaboran servilletas, artesanías que venden para obtener dinero extra.
texts.en:
The members of this group are very cheerful and responsible people. They live in a very tranquil community in Mexico State. 
Francisca, who is the group representative, is 38 years old and has been married to Victor for 23 years. Together, they have raised a family of three children who are in school. Francisca opened a grocery store 10 year ago. Back then, she only sold sodas, candy, and snacks. The quantity and variety of her merchandise wasn't outstanding, and neither was the number of customers she had. Later, she heard a talk by VisionFund México and decided to request a loan to invest more strongly in her business and to buy other products. This is how she started to grown her profits. Francisca commented "I wanted  to start this business because it is more convenient for me, I don't need to leave the house to earn a living for my family. Raising animals is also a very good option but I like to have contact with people." The challenge that she faces is the lack of a good electricity source for selling cold meats. She says that, in her community, the electricity service goes out often and her refrigerator can't keep these products in a good state. Francisca wants to use her loan to buy more merchandise such as milk, dairy products, sodas, salt, sugar, etc.
Like Francisca, the other members are very happy because the loan will help their respective businesses: Reyna will invest in scarves, Maria Guadalupe R. and Maria Guadalupe C and Tomasa will invest in sheep, Gloria and Miguel in cows, Benita and Diana in their grocery store, Patricia in chickens, and Maria Cristina in her cybercafe. In addition to the activities already mentioned, they all make napkins, crafts that they sell to make extra money.

loans.use: to buy milk, dairy products, sodas, salt, sugar, etc.

location.town: La Lagunita, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
El Sr Denis tiene 24 años proviene de una familia muy trabajadora y sacrificada. El mismo se dedica al servicios de fletes hace dos años, y comenta que se sacrificó mucho para comprar para su camión, se dedica también a la plantación de tomates, dice que tuvo q trabajar dos años para juntar para la entrega de su camión que por suerte y con orgullo manifiesta que ya pago todo.
Su mayor sueño es ahora independizarse y construir para su casa propia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de tomates y locotes, de manera a poder tener una mayor cantidad de los mismos que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Denis is 24 years old and comes from a very hard-working and self-sacrificing family. He has worked in freight services for the past two years and says that he sacrificed a lot to purchase his truck. He also works growing tomatoes and says that he had to work two years to save up for the payment on the truck that with luck and with pride he says he has already paid all of it.

His greatest dream is to now become independent and build his own house.

He asks for this loan to purchase tomatoes and peppers, so that he can have a larger quantity of these to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and peppers.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una chica muy seria, responsable y muy entregada a su negocio; tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y aún vive con sus padres. Platica que desde muy pequeña su papá la llevaba a vender muebles a otro lugar fuera de su comunidad, este fue su primer acercamiento a la vida de comerciante. 
Desde hace ocho años Gaby, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la compra de macetas de barro para después decorarlas y venderlas. A Gaby le gustaría fabricar ella misma las macetas, pero por el momento no cuenta con los recursos necesarios. Esta vez está solicitando un crédito para comprar mercancía y pinturas para decorar. Explica que en solo cuatro sencillos pasos, sus macetas quedan perfectas: primero aplica una base blanca, después el decorado con pintura de distintos colores y con mucha imaginación, después se aplica el sellador y finalmente, chapopote para que el decorado dure mucho más.
El reto de Gaby es cuando viaja a lugares retirados para vender sus macetas y la imposibilidad de llevar suficiente mercancía para no tener que hacer más viajes.  Sin embargo, Gaby se muestra muy contenta y agradecida con KIVA y VisionFund México por la oportunidad de obtener un préstamo porque este ayudará a contribuir a que su negocio crezca y pueda mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a very serious and responsible girl, very dedicated to her business. She is 27 years old, single, and still lives with her parents. She says that since she was very young, her father brought her to sell furniture in other places outside the community. This was her first exposure to the merchant life.

For the past eight years, Gaby, as she is called with love, has worked purchasing clay flowerpots to later decorate and sell. Gaby would like to make the flowerpots herself, but at the moment she doesn't have the necessary resources. This time she asks for a loan to purchase merchandise and paints for decorating. She explains that in only four simple steps, her flowerpots are perfect. First she applies a white base, then the decoration with paint in a variety of colors and a lot of imagination, later she applies the sealant, and finally oil which makes the decoration last much longer.

Gaby's challenge is that when she travels to distant locations to sell her flowerpots it is impossible to carry enough merchandise without having to make additional trips. However, Gaby is very happy and grateful to Kiva and VisionFund México for the opportunity to get a loan because it will help her contribute to her business's growth and she will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase clay flowerpots and paint.

loans.name: Japal Ma Jap Group

texts.fr: JAPAL MA JAP est un groupement de promotion féminin qui est composé de 5 personnes. Elles habitent toutes dans le meme quartier et pratiquent les memes activités. Elles se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin et font des tontines mensuelles. Madame NDEYE est leur présidente, c’est la dame qui a levé la main sur la photo.  Mariée et mère de famille, elle est agée de 49 ans et évolue dans la commercialisation des denrées alimentaires. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans et aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle a besoin de ce montant pour acheter et vendre des denrées de 1er nécessités comme le riz, le sucre, le savon, lait etc.…….NDEYE démarre sa journée à 9h pour la finir à 12h. Grace au crédit de l’institution, elle pourra augmenter son fond de roulement et gagner plus d’argent qu’elle pourra mettre de coté et épargner.
texts.en: Japal Ma Jap is a group of five women.  They all live in the same neighborhood and run the same type of business. They have gathered each time there has been a need to create a monthly savings group.  Ms. Ndeye is the president; she has her hand raised in the photo. She is 49 years old, married and a mother.  She sells food.  She has more than five years of experience and helps her husband with the management of their family's daily expenses. She needs this loan to buy and sell food staples, like rice, sugar, soap, milk, etc.  Ndeye starts her day at 9 am and finishes at 12 noon.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to increase her working capital and earn more money that she will be able to set aside and save.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à SANZANA un village dans la commune de DOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame AMINATA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI II. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The seven members of Benkadi II Group are married women with an average age of 34. They have an average of four children and mostly live in traditional families in Sanzana, one of the villages in the commune of Dogoni, in the area of Sikasso, the third largest administrative region in Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan; the previous loans were fully repaid. Aminata, standing at the far right in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kg bags of fertilizer, two canisters of herbicide and to pay for the labor costs of maintaining of 0.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the output is sold at the village level, in Sikasso, to a clientele of men and women for cash and credit. She expects to earn an average profit of 74,000 FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and interest, as well as help her husband with their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicide, and labor costs.

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe BENKADI III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à SANZANA un village dans la commune de DOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame YAMA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI III. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The six members of Benkadi III Group are married women with an average age of 35. They have an average of four children and mostly live in traditional families in Sanzana, one of the villages in the commune of Dogoni, in the area of Sikasso, the third largest administrative region in Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan; the previous loans were fully repaid. Yama, standing second at the far right in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kg bags of fertilizer, two canisters of herbicide and to pay for the labor costs of maintaining of 0.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the output is sold at the village level, in Sikasso, to a clientele of men and women for cash and credit. She expects to earn an average profit of 74,000 FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and interest, as well as help her husband with their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicide, and labor costs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 62 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling nipa roofing (thatched roofing made from the leaves of the Nipa palm) in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of nipa to sell.
 
In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of nipa to sell

loans.name: Judith Abigail

texts.es: Judith, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre, tiene 3 hijos, reside actualmente con su familia, en el municipio de Intibucá. Se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de granos básicos, carnes de cerdo y pollo. Esta actividad la realiza  hace 3 años .Anteriormente se dedicaba a la cría de aves. Solicita el segundo ciclo de préstamo que es por 15,000 lempiras, este préstamo lo invertirá en la siembra y fertilizacion de granos básicos de maiz y frijoles. Su meta es incrementar la producción de sus cultivos y mantener siempre su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Judith is 33 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has 3 children. Right now, she lives in the town of Intibucá. She works in agriculture and sells basic grains and pork and chicken. She has done this activity for 3 years. Previously she raised poultry. She is asking for the second cycle loan, which is for 15,000 lempiras. This loan will be invested in planting and fertilizing basic grains, corn and beans. Her goal is to increase the yields of her crops and always maintain her source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods and items for the grocery

loans.name: Sheeda

texts.en:
Sheeda is 52, living with her five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son has been running a mobile shop for several years but he is earning insufficient income due to lack of mobile accessories. He troubleshoots the mobiles and sells mobile accessories such as chargers, bodies, data cables, etc. and provides recharge facilities for different networks as well. 

Nowadays there is a lot of demand for mobile accessories and for recharge, and sometimes he has to refuse his worthy customers. He does not have savings to further invest into business because he has already spent all his savings on household expenses.
 
Therefore, Sheeda has requested a loan for her son so that he can be empowered to buy additional accessories and extra credit for recharge facilities. Sheeda thanks Kiva and its field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy mobile accessories for reselling.

loans.name: San Ignacio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Ignacio está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante, es un grupo nuevo que tiene mucho entusiasmo y ganas de salir adelante.
La Sra. Teodolina es una de las integrantes de este grupo, y demás es la presidenta, pide este préstamo para la compra de  joyas de plata para su venta, como ser anillos, pulseras, cadenas, dijes, aros, etc., para que de esa manera pueda aumentar más su clientela y también pueda generar más ingresos en la familia, gracias al apoyo que le esta brindando la fundación y kiva pudiendo aumentar clientes.
texts.en:
The group called San Ignacio is in its 1rst cycle in the women's committee program. All of them work and help each other to get ahead. It is a new group with a lot of enthusiasm and eagerness to get ahead. 

Teodolina is one of the members of the group. She is also the president. She is asking for this loan to buy silver jewelry to sell, such as rings, bracelets, chains, pendants, hoops, etc. This way, she can increase her clientele and also generate more income for her family, thanks to the support offered by the foundation and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy rings, bracelets, chains, pendants, hoops, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase blankets, T-shirts, sheets, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Mboolo Liguey Group

texts.fr: MBOOLO LIGUEY est un groupement de promotion féminin qui est  composé de 5 personnes. Elles habitent dans le meme quartier et fond des tontines mensuelles. Elles ont comme présidente Madame SIRA,  c’est la dame qui a levée la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille, qui est agée de 43ans.  Etant à son 4ème prêt, elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans et demande ce montant pour acheter des tissus pour ensuite les revendre. Elle a comme charges particulière les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. A l’avenir, elle souhaite avoir sa propre magasin dans le marché afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mboolo Liguey is a group of five women who all live in the same neighborhood and participate in a monthly savings group. Ms. Sira is the president; she has her hand raised in the photo. She is 43 years old, married and a mother. On her fourth loan, she has more than five years of experience and is asking for this amount to buy fabric for resale. She is responsible for the daily expenses of her family. She starts her day at 8 am and finishes at 7 pm. In the future, she wishes to have her own store in the market so she can increase her revenues and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As one way of generating income, Ofelia has been engaged in buying and reselling used clothing within the public market to supplement her husband's income. She aims to generate a higher income to meet their daily necessities and save for future emergencies. 

She wants to acquire more stocks of the said used clothing to resell, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she wants to avail a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more stocks of used clothing (ukay-ukay) to resell. She hopes that she will receive her loan request to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Pwani Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha, who is in her early 40s, is single and has two children who are still at school.  

She has been running several businesses, selling clothes, bites, soda, juice and water for 20 years now.  She works from 5 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mwanaisha's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy clothes, bites, water juice and sodas to resell. She dreams of opening a shop for selling clothes.

Mwanaisha will share this loan with her loan group, "Pwani," which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes, bites, water, juice and sodas to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy handbags, satchels and travelling bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing items and footwear.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. Nida is married and has a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Nida  has been in this business for 30 years now.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa to sell.

In the future, Nida  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa to sell.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuevo Amanecer está en su ciclo número 5 del programa, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas.
Edith integra este grupo, ella en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha mejorado, gracias al esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de ropas que hace de forma ambulante, comenta que es muy difícil por la competencia que hay, pero que ella no hace, para poder ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que ella no tuvo.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer group is in its fifth loan cycle with the program, where all are completing the poverty elimination tool, as a means of knowing the life situation of each one.

Edith is a member of this group. In her last questionnaire, she showed a poverty level within level three, which is to say that it has improved, thanks to her efforts and continuous work and by means of her clothing sales that she does as a street vendor. She says that it is very difficult because of the competition, but she doesn't do it, in order to help her family and give them everything that she didn't have. 

She asks for this loan to purchase an assortment of clothing to sell, which will help her to achieve her business plan which will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 53 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jesusa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

Jesusa has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Jesusa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 39 years old and married with five children, three of whom in school. Rosalie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Rosalie has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Rosalie would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice and other basic grocery items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Raul Fernando

texts.es: Raúl, tiene 22 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo, está en una relación de unión libre con su esposa y reside en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Se dedica a vender celulares, accesorios como baterías, cables, cargadores, cobertores, manos libres, memorias y otros, este negocio lo tiene hace 3 años, las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante utilizando su vehículo, Antes trabajaba en empresa privada. El préstamo que solicita es de 18,000 lempiras, este lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como accesorio para celulares y celulares para vender y podra aumentar sus ventas y ganancias. Tiene como meta tener un local o una tienda para su negocio.
texts.en: Raúl is 22 years old, has one child, is in a common-law marriage with his wife, and lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula. He works selling cell phones and accessories such as batteries, cables, chargers, covers, hands free devices, memory and others. He has had this business for 3 years, and he makes his sales from his vehicle. Before, he worked in a private business. The loan that he requests is for 18,000 lempiras. This will be invested in the purchase of merchandise such as cell phone accessories and cell phones to sell and will be able to increase his sales and earnings. He has as a goal to have a retail space or store for his business.

loans.use: to purchase cell phones and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es:
El Sr. Nicolás tiene 54 años de edad, está acompañado, tiene una familia conformada con dos hijos, vive en la ciudad de Itá.
Don Nicolás tiene un copetín en su casa donde vende empanadas, sándwich, bebidas y productos de primera necesidad para el hogar, tiene una muy buena cantidad de clientela formada gracias al buen servicio y calidad de productos que ofrece.
 Pide este préstamo para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, golosinas y demás para poder surtir su copetín y poder seguir dando a su clientela lo que pide.
texts.en:
Nicolás is 54 years old, partnered, has a family made up of two children, and lives in the city of Itá.

Nicolás has a snack bar in his house where he sells empanadas, sandwiches, drinks, and basic household goods. He has a very good quantity of regular customers thanks to his good services and the quality of the products he offers.

He asks for this loan to purchase drinks, food products, candies, and other products to stock his fast food bar and to be able to continue giving his customers what they ask for.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, food, candies, and other products.

loans.name: Joana Rose

texts.en:
Joana Rose is 24 years old, married and had two young children. 

She has a food-selling business for income. She cook and sell snacks. Though she only generates minimal income she still manages her small business well. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fishballs, eggs and hot dogs to cook and sell. Joana Rose will keep achieving good sales and income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishballs, eggs and hot dogs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, soap, cooking oil, drinks and other food for resale.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie works hard to support her family. 

She has a buy and sell nipa business in the Philippines. Josie has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa to sell.

In the future, Josie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement to renovate her house from the inside.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto siempre estudio con mucho sacrificio porque viene de una familia muy humilde. Actualmente está estudiando la tecnicatura en enfermería, con lo que quiere poder trabajar y salir adelante. Tiene un hijo y es por él que se está esforzando, para poder darle todo y que no tenga que pasar por necesidades.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder culminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Alberto always studies with much sacrifice because he comes from a very humble family. Currently, he is studying for a technical degree in nursing, with which he wants to be able to work and get ahead. He has a son and it is for him that he is working hard, to be able to give him everything and not have to do without necessities.  He asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the costs of his degree, and in this way be able to finish his studies.

loans.use: to pay the costs of his degree.

loans.name: Hoin Group

texts.en:
Hoin is 36 years old, a farmer and a married woman living with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1996. Her husband is a 40-year-old worker growing sugar cane for wages. One of her children is also a farmer and four others are students. Together, they can earn approximately $15 per day. 

Now Hoin would like to request a loan as a group of four members and she will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will help her family to live in better conditions. In the future, she is going to expand her rice cultivation, renovate her house, and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está estudiando la carrera de Administración de empresas, y cometa que tiene como objetivo recibirse como Licenciada En   administración y ser una de las mejores en el Paraguay Y gracias a su familia está llegando a su objetivo.
Quiere ser útil para la sociedad  y ayudar más a su familia. Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad.
texts.en:
Cecilia is from the city of Villarrica, and she is studying for a degree in Business Administration. She comments that her goal is to graduate with a bachelor’s degree in Administration and become one of the best in Paraguay; and thanks to her family, she is achieving her goal. 

She wants to be useful to society and help her family more. She is requesting this loan in order to pay her university fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Fantasía Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Fantasía” se ubica en una comunidad caracterizada por el cultivo de nopales, los habitantes son muy amables,  alegres y trabajadores. Las integrantes del grupo son señoras muy jóvenes y con muchas ganas de seguir laborando, cada una de ellas tiene un negocio que coordinan con su labor de amas de casa. María vende bisutería; Isabel y Aurora, frutas y verduras; Olga, juegos pirotécnicos; Concepción, artículos de temporada; doña Siberiana, bordados y Felipa, ropa.
Doña Felipa tiene 48 años de edad, es mamá de seis hijos de los cuales cuales tres aún dependen de ella porque se encuentran estudiando. Doña Felipa se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace ya 15 años y platica que inició como comerciante vendiendo productos de fantasía como accesorios para el cabello y bisutería en los tianguis. Después, el tipo de cambió tuvo un impacto negativo en su negocio, pero una de sus amigas le recomendó un lugar para comprar ropa a buen precio y así cambiar de línea de trabajo. Las primeras prendas que Felipa vendió fueron playeritas y pants para niños; entonces caminaba por su comunidad e incluso en otros estados ofreciendo la ropa, pero hace tres años, finalmente comenzó a vender en su propio local lo que le da la oportunidad de vender aun más prendas. El crédito lo quiere invertir para comprar más ropa para niños.
La meta de Felipa es que su negocio siga en pie para seguir ayudando a los tres hijos que todavía viven con ella “…pero mi mayor ilusión es tener la oportunidad de poder abrazar nuevamente a mis demás hijos” comparte acerca de los jóvenes que viajaron a Estados Unidos buscando mejorar su calidad de vida y que hace años no ha visto.
texts.en:
The group "Fantasia" is located in a community that is known for its nopal [prickly pear cacti] crops and its very friendly, happy and hardworking inhabitants. The members of this group are very young women with a great desire to continue working. Each of them has a business that they run in addition to their duties as homemakers. María sells jewelry, Isabel and Aurora sell fruits and vegetables, Olga sells fireworks, Concepción sells seasonal items, Doña Siberiana sells embroidered items and Felipa sells clothing.

Doña Felipa is 48 years old and is the mother of six children. Three of her children are still dependants because they are in school. Doña Felipa has been working selling clothing for 15 years now. She says that she started off selling decorative items, such as hair accessories and costume jewellery, at open-air markets. Later, the exchange rate had a negative impact on her business, but one of her friends recommended a place to her where she could buy clothing for a good price, and so she changed her line of work. The first items of clothing that Felipa sold were little tops and pants for children. Then, she walked around her community and other places selling the clothing. Three years ago, though, she finally started selling from her own storefront location, which gave her the opportunity to sell even more items of clothing. She would like to invest this this loan in the purchase of more children's clothes.

Felipa's goal is for her business to keep going so that she can can continue to help her three children who still live with her, "…but my biggest hope is that I'll someday have the opportunity to hug my other children." She shared this about her other children, who travelled to the United States seeking to improve their quality of life, and it has been years since she last saw them.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to re-sell.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María de 57 años de edad  vive en casa de un familiar y ella tiene un negocio de productos varios como venta de ropa, zapatos y lociones, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades y gastos que se le presentan en su hogar.  María solicita un crédito para la compra de más productos como ropa, zapatos, lociones, etc. por mayor para surtir aún más su negocio y  tener una mejor calidad de vida sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en: María is 57 years old, lives in a relative's house, and she has a business selling an assortment of products such as clothing, shoes and lotions. With what she earns from her sales, she manages to cover the necessities and expenses that come up in her household. María asks for this loan to purchase more products such as clothing, shoes, lotions, etc. in bulk to stock her business even more and have a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, lotions, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Dior

texts.fr: DIOR est une femme âgée de 42 ans qui évolue dans la commercialisation des chaussures et tissus. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans cette activité ; Etant à son 2ème, elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des tissus et chaussures qu’elle vend dans le marché de sa commune. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.  Elle démarre sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 14h et reprendre l’après midi à 16h pour finir à 20h. Elle souhaite grâce aux crédits de l’institution diversifier ses activités et augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir gagner plus d’argent et épargner.
texts.en: Dior is a 42-year old woman who has built up a business buying and selling shoes and fabrics. She has more than ten years' experience in this business. She is on her second loan and is requesting this to buy fabrics and shoes which she will sell in her municipality's market. She helps her husband with the daily expenses and her children's schooling costs. She begins her day at nine in the morning, finishes at two in the afternoon, and then she restarts at four o'clock in the afternoon, finishing at eight in the evening. Thanks to loans from the institution she would like to diversify her business and increase her income so that she can earn more money and save.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Kamanzi Group

texts.fr:
Cassilde  fait partie du groupe  Kamanzi  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 49 ans et est marié à Laurent,un commerçant.Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 11 à 25 ans, tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce des habits  depuis 10 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait construire une maison et   voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Cassilde belongs to the Kamanzi group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 49 years old and married to Laurent, who is a trader. They have five children together, ranging from 11 to 25 years old, all of whom are studying.

Cassilde has been buying and selling clothes for the past ten years, and this is her first loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she is granted, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of clothes for resale, so that she can earn more money.

Over the coming years she would like to build a house and see her children through school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of clothes for resale, so that she can earn more money.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto de 36 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su esposa y sus dos hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y responsable, se dedica a la venta de cocos, agua y gaseosas, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar algunas necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Roberto solicita un crédito para la compra de cocos y bebidas por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Roberto is 36 years old and lives in a rented house with his wife and two children. He is a hard-working and responsible person who works selling coconuts, water, and soft drinks. He works as a street vendor in the various neighborhoods that are near his house. With what he earns from his sales, he manages to cover some of the necessities that come up in his household. Roberto asks for a loan to purchase coconuts and drinks in bulk, since this is his only source of work, and in this way to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts and drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Nilda Araceli

texts.es:
La socia Nilda continua dedicándose al negocio de crianza y venta de animales menores, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes y alimentos para los animales.
La socia se siente agradecida con el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nilda continues to work in the business of raising and selling small animals. She has worked in this business for years, which is going well for her, thanks to the dedication that she puts into her business every day. She is a responsible and dedicated person, and wants to be able to continue working so in this way she can continue supporting her family.

She asks for a loan to purchase guinea pigs and food for the animals. 

She is grateful for the loan and commits to making the payments.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and food for the animals.

loans.name: Ediana

texts.es:
Ediana desde que empezó la universidad es una alumna regular con muy buenas notas y por sobre todo está haciendo lo que le gusta ya que la carrera de contabilidad siempre fue de su agrado.
De su familia siempre recibió la ayuda necesaria para poder estudiar y así cumplir sus sueños.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, ya que esta por recibirse y quiere cubrir ese gasto.
texts.en:
Since Ediana entered the university, she has been a regular student with very good grades and, above all, she is doing what she likes to do since the accounting degree has always been a pleasure. 

She always got the necessary help from her family to be able to study and achieve her dreams.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay the costs of her degree, since she is about to get it and wants to pay for this cost.

loans.use: to pay the costs of her degree.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa es soltera pero tiene 5 hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad peo solo tiene luz y agua Luisa es agricultora y quiere un credito para comprar semilla para plantar maiz Luisa es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Luisa is single but she has 5 children and lives in La Paz in a house made of brick and cement which is her own property but only has electricity and water. Luisa is a farmer and wants the loan to purchase seeds to plant corn. Luisa is the only source of income in her household and she needs its help.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant corn.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es estudiante de la carrera de contabilidad, actualmente está preparando su trabajo de grado para llegar a recibir su título de licenciada en contabilidad.
Sueña con poder abrir su propio estudio contable. La vida le inspira para salir adelante y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que son muchos los gastos de que debe cubrir.
texts.en: Eva is an accounting student, who is currently preparing her undergraduate work in order to receive her bachelor's degree in accounting. She dreams of being able to open her own accounting firm. Life inspires her to move forward and be able to help her loved ones. She's requesting this loan so that she can invest it in her graduation expenses, as there are already many expenses to be covered.

loans.use: pay graduation expenses.

loans.name: Mame Penda

texts.fr: MAME PENDA est une femme promotrice qui évolue dans l’aviculture. Elle habite aux environs du Guichet Elle est mariée e mère de famille qui est âgée de 48ans. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des poussins et de l’aliment pour volaille. Elle a comme charges particulières les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 22h. Elle souhaite avec l’aide de l’institution augmenter son périmètre d’aviculture et diversifier ses produits afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en: Mame Penda is a woman who has built up a poultry-farming activity. She lives in the area surrounding Guichet and is a 48-year old married mother. She has more than ten years' experience and is requesting this loan to buy chickens and food for poultry. She has the responsibility for her family's daily expenses and her children's schooling costs. She begins her day at eight o'clock in the morning and finishes at ten in the evening. With the help of the institution she would like to increase the area of her poultry-farming and diversify her products so that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chickens and food for poultry farming activity.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia Alicia pertenece al banco comunal MANOS JUNTAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia tiene 24 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza y venta de animales menores, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes.
La socia se siente agradecida con el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alicia belongs to the Manos Juntas communal bank. The bank is located in the province of Cusco. 

She is 24 years old, has 1 child, and is single. She spends part of her daily work with her business raising and selling small animals. She has worked in this business for years, which is going well for her thanks to the dedication that she puts into her business every day. She raises these animals to later sell them to her customers who ask for them.  She wants to be able to continue working and in this way to continue supporting her family.

The requested loan will be used to purchase guinea pigs.

She is grateful for the loan and commits to making the payments.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 51-year-old widow and mother of five children. She is receiving a loan to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins and pearls of various colours for embroidery work at home. 

She has been doing embroidery for many years and cherishing her children. She is a responsible mother; she knows very well about her duties and responsibilities regarding her children. She always keeps busy and is ready to provide better facilities for her dear children.

Her son does work for a small firm for very low daily wages and comes home very late at night. Shaheen has to manage her routine work and complete her emroidery  tasks as well. 

Her dream is to construct her house to accommodate her five children. For this purpose, she is making savings. Shaheen is very happy and relaxed after taking out this loan, because it will increase her monthly income and savings as well.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for embroidery work.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
La Señorita Ingrid es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es una persona que está luchando por poder salir adelante y crecer.
Con este préstamo, quiere comprar Instrumentos y Materiales para su carrera de Geología, ya que es muy indispensable para ella.
Ingrid está luchando por un futuro mejor por medio de sus estudios.
texts.en: Ingrid is from the city of San Lorenzo and is a a person that is fighting to get ahead and grow. With this loan she wants to buy tools and materials for her career in geology since it is very essential for her. Ingrid is fighting for a better future through her studies.

loans.use: To buy tools and materials for her career

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Juana del Carmen mayor de edad casada con dos hijos los cuales son independientes, originaria de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar estudios, terminando solo la secundaria, debido a que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante es que decide poner una pulpería donde ofrece productos de consumo diarios como:sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, arroz, azúcar, leche, frijoles, pan, huevos, detergente, salsas de tomates, aceite, productos congelados, gaseosas, jugos, galletas, golosinas entre otros, ubicada en su casa de habitación, desde hace 18 años que se dedica a este negocio al igual que ofrece mercadería en general como: ropa interior, prensapelos, colas, shampoo, talcos, variedades de ropa, cuadernos, pamperes, perfumenes, sandalias entre otros mas, sus compras son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, uno de sus sueños es poder incrementar su negocio y así obtener más rentabilidades para realizar otros proyectos futuros, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en su negocio debido a que su demanda ha crecido mas, y por lo tanto necesita surtir mas su inventario en ambos negocios en la compra de productos de consumo del hogar como: granos básicos, productos congelados, gaseosas, mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa, sobre camas, perfumenes, shampo entre otros y así poder ofrecerle un mejor servicios a sus clientes, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Juana del Carmen agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Juana del Carmen is an older lady, married, with two children who are independent. She is originally from Chinandega, located in the west of the country. She is characterized as being a hard-working, responsible woman with the desire for personal improvement.  Because of a lack of resources, she couldn't finish her schooling, ending only at the secondary level. Due to this, since she was very young, she has had to work to help with the household expenses. Thanks to her spirit and her desire to get ahead, she decided to open a general store where she offers products for daily consumption such as packets of coffee, packets of shampoo, rice, sugar, milk, beans, bread, eggs, detergent, tomato sauces, oil, frozen products, soft drinks, juices, cookies, and candies among others. The store is located in her house, and for 18 years she has worked in this business, which also offers general merchandise such as lingerie, barrettes, glue, shampoo, talcum powder, an assortment of clothing, notebooks, diapers, perfumes, and sandals among other products. She makes her purchases in cash and has regular and occasional customers. One of her dreams is to be able to expand her business and in this way get more profits to be able to do other future projects. The goal of this new loan is to invest in her business due to the increasing demand. For this, she needs to stock more inventory in both businesses by purchasing products for household consumption such as basic grains, frozen products, soft drinks and general merchandise such as an assortment of clothing styles, bed spreads, perfumes, and shampoo among others. In this way she will offer a better service to her customers so that in the not-so-distant future she can have increased income. Juana del Carmen is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua in order to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital in the purchase of products for household consumption such as basic grains, frozen products, soft drinks, juices, detergents, candies, and also general merchandise such as an assortment of clothing styles, sandals, shampoo, perfumes, creams, among other products.

loans.name: João

texts.pt:
Casado maritalmente é pai de três dos quais dois são de sexo feminino e um masculino e tem também na sua responsabilidade uma sobrinha de 14 anos de idade e sua mãe.Com. Ele trabalha na instância turística.
É cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema pela primeira vez, e com o valor do crédito o cliente pretende comprar uma geleira para seu uso doméstico. Sente se muito bem onde esta a trabalhar, te como seu maior sonho abrir uma pastelaria sendo ele profissional da área e seu desafio será de construir casa própria aqui na ponta de ouro.
texts.en:
João is married and the father of three children, two girls and one boy. He is also responsible for a 14 year old niece and her mother. He works at a tourist resort.

This is his first time as a client of Hluvuku-Adsema and with this loan he plans to buy a fridge for domestic use. He feels very good about his job but his biggest dream is to open a pastry shop as he is a professional in this industry already. His challenge will be to build his own house here in Ponta de Ouro.

loans.use: buy a fridge for domestic use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a laptop and a multipurpose printer for her studies, so that she can do more tasks in less time and will not have to pay to rent them.

loans.name: Imitima Group

texts.fr:
Lambert fait partie du groupe  Imitima et  habite à  Bujumbura.Il  a 35ans et est marié à Yollande ,une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 3 à 5ans, dont 1 étudie .

Il fait le commerce de  matériaux de constructions(ciment,tôles,clous , …)depuis depuis 6 ans. 


Il  est à un son deuxième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il va obtient,il va augmenter  son capital et acheter une grande quantité de ciment , de tôles , de clous ,...à revendre pour gagner plus. 


Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  construire des maisons , faire l’élevage de  porc et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Lambert belongs to the Imitima group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 35 years old and married to Yollande, who is a trader. They have three children together, ranging from three to five years old, one of whom is at school.

Lambert has been buying and selling building materials (cement, sheet metal, nails,...) for the past six years, and this is his second loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is granted, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of cement, sheet metal, nails,.. for resale, so that he can earn more money.

Over the coming years he would like to build houses, raise pigs and see his children through school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of cement, sheet metal, nails,... for resale, so that he can earn more money.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 58 years old and married with 11 children.  With three children in school, Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell nipa business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 38 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos  through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional stock of nipa to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of nipa to sell

loans.name: Al-Wafa 4 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Wafa 4. It consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 170,000 Yemini rial (YER) from AMB.

Maryam, 31, is the leader of the group. She is married with three children living in a poor area of Hodeidah city. She studied until elementary school. Due to the miserable condition of her family, she couldn't complete her studies. 

Maraym didn't surrender to her miserable condition, but decided instead to start a business to look after of her family. Her business is selling ready-made clothing for woman and children and many kinds of accessories door-to-door. She began this business more than seven years ago.

Maryam earns good profits from this business, but not enough to cover all of her family's expenses. To further expand in her business, Maryam has requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase more stylish ready-made clothing for women and children as well as many kinds of accessories and makeup to sell to her customers.

Maryam looks forward to expanding her business even further by opening a large shop that sells all kinds of stylish clothes and accessories to meet all the demands of customers that shop at supermarkets.

loans.use: to purchase more stylish ready-made clothing for women and children as well as many kinds of accessories and makeup to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rita

texts.pt:
Cliente é solteira e vive com seus dois filhos, um do sexo feminino e outro do sexo masculino com idades compreendidas entre os 4 e 11 anos. A cliente é trabalhadora num bar como cozinheira.
É uma cliente da instituição a 5 anos, e com o valor do crédito a cliente pretende comprar ferros 8mm, chapas de zinco, barrotes,estribos,arrame queimado, pregos e pagar a mao de obra. 
O seu maior desafio do momento é concluir sua casa. 
Seu maior sonho é abrir um negocio que possa ajudar no sustento de sua familia
texts.en:
Rita is single and lives with her two children, one girl and one boy, aged 4 and 11. She works in a bar as a cook.

She has been a client of this institution [Hluvuku-Adsema] for 5 years and with this loan plans to buy 8mm iron rods, sheets of zinc, beams, hooks, burnt wires, nails and to pay for labour costs.

Her biggest challenge is to complete the construction of her home.

Her biggest dream is to open a business that can support her family.

loans.use: buy 8mm iron rods, sheets of zinc, beams, hooks, burnt wires, nails and to pay for labour costs.

loans.name: Neieng Group

texts.en:
Neieng is 41 years old and a married woman, with four children. She lives in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She buys recyclable trash to resell. Her husband is 49 years old, and also a recyclable trash buyer. Both of them have been in this business since 2011. One of her children is a car mechanic, another works in a battery shop, and two others are students. Together, they can earn approximately $13 per day.

Now Neieng would like to request a loan, as one of a group of five members, and she will use her portion of the loan funds to build a latrine. This loan will help her family live in health and avoid illnesses. In the future, she is going to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Diego Armando

texts.es: Diego es un joven trabajador, cuenta que su padre se dedica a la agricultura y que por este motivo le enseñó a la agricultura, son 2 años de que Diego siembra papas esto es desde que termino la secundaria, dice Diego que desea  ingresar a la universidad pero que pese que ha intentado por algunas veces aun o lo logra,  diego también trabaja de estibador de tanques de gas doméstico, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para cuidar sus cultivos, la aspiración de Diego es seguir trabajando en  la agricultura para tener algunos ahorros y solventar los gastos que implica ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en: Diego is a hard-working young man. He says that his father works in agriculture and, for that reason, taught him farming. Diego has planted potatoes for 2 years, since he finished secondary school. Diego says that he wants to enter university but although he has tried several times, he still hasn't made it.  Diego also works as a stevedore with tanks of domestic gas. He will invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizer to care for his crops. Diego's aspiration is to continue to work in agriculture to have some savings and pay the costs that go with entering university.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is 20 years old. She and her family are residing at Tuguegarao City. She is a fourth year college student taking up a Bachelor of Science in teacher education. Her parents' income is not enough to cover all their expenses so she is now asking for a loan of P 7,000 to pay for her tuition fees. This will help her achieve her dream of becoming a teacher someday.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es: Julieta es casada, tiene un hijo y vive con su madre en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su madre La casa tiene luz y agua, el acceso al hogar es peligroso ya que no tiene entrada directa, se debe bajar por un camino peligroso Julieta se dedica a tejer y vender mantas de vicuña y necesita un credito para comprar lana para hacer mantas y chalinas El esposo de Julieta tambien confecciona prendas (en su caso son prendas deportivas) pero no tiene capital extra para colaborar con el negocio de su esposa por eso JUlieta necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Julieta is married. She has a son and lives with her mother in La Paz in a house of brick and cement that belongs to her mother. The house has electrical and water service. Access to the house is dangerous, since it doesn't have a direct entrance; one has to go down through a dangerous street. 

Julieta weaves and sells blankets of vicuña, and she needs a loan to buy wool to make blankets and shawls. Julieta's husband also makes clothing (in his case, sports clothing), but he doesn't have extra capital to help with his wife's business. For this reason, Julieta needs your help.

loans.use: to buy wool to make blankets and shawls

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 24 años vive en casa propia con su madre, el posee una tienda ubicada en su casa desde hace varios años, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra ayudar a su madre en todos los gastos  que se le presentan en el hogar, el cliente solicita un crédito para la compra de productos para su tienda como: azúcar, aceite, arroz, frijoles, pan, jabón, etc.  todo por mayor para tener junto a su madre un mejor nivel de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client, age 24, lives in his own house with his mother.  He has had a store in his house for several years.  With what he earns from his sales he manages to help his mother with all of the household expenses.

The client is requesting a loan to buy products for his store.  He will buy things like sugar, cooking oil, rice, beans, bread, and soap, etc.  He will buy everything in bulk.  He will make this purchases so that he and his mother have a better standard of living without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, rice, beans, bread, and soap, etc.

loans.name: Graciela Nora

texts.es: A sus 46 años de edad Graciela es una señora casada y tiene 3 hijos, el mayor de ellos ya trabaja,  el segundo se encuentra realizando la tesis, y la tercera asiste  al colegio, Graciela comenta que es muy duro  dar la educación a sus 3 hijos, ya que su economía no le alcanza para cubrir todos estos gastos, ella y su esposo trabajan duro para salir adelante, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de harina para hacer pan y otras productos que los ofrece en su pequeña panadería que ya la tiene 15 años, la meta que sea propuesto Graciela es que tiene que ver a sus hijos graduados para que ellas tengan una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Graciela, 46, is a married woman with three children. The eldest is already working, the second is doing their thesis and the this is at school. Graciela says it is very hard to give three children an education, because her job does not cover all of the expenses and so, she and her husband work hard to get ahead.
This loan is going to invest in buying flour to make bread and other products that are offered in their small bakery that they have had for 15 years.
Graciela would like to see her children graduate so they have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Sreyhorm's Group

texts.en:
Sreyhorm, 29, is from a rural village located in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She is widowed. To make a living she has been working as a garment worker for nine years. The current job earns her about 28,000 KHR per day. 
Sreyhorm has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader she wants to use her portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes to have a clean latrine for use by her family.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

loans.name: Dora Luz

texts.es:
Dora de 57 años de edad,  no estudio ya que sus padres decidieron ponerle a trabajar desde que era una niña, comenta que sus padres le decían que de las letras no comería; sino del trabajo que realizara.

Esta acompañada su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, con él han procreado 5 hijos, 2 mujeres y 3 hombres, todos ya son mayores de edad los hombres se dedican a la agricultura y el jornal, las hijas se dedican a los oficios del hogar y a la elaboración de tortillas las cuales venden en la comunidad. 
	
Dora se dedica a los oficios del hogar, también tiene un negocio de elaboración de tortillas junto a sus hijas, dicho producto lo comercializan en la misma comunidad, también se dedica a la cría de cerdos y a la agricultura, junto a su esposo e hijos, comenta que a pesar que sus padres no la pusieron a estudiar les agradece por enseñarle a trabajar la tierra y a ganarse el pan de cada día, el horario de trabajo es variado ya que unos días trabaja desde la madrugada y otros días desde más tarde.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar abonos y venenos para sus cultivos de maíz y frijol, ya que están cultivando 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 de frijol; estos trabajos los hace el esposo junto a sus hijos, teniendo estos productos en su casa ellos los podrán aplicar en el momento justo a sus cultivos y de esta manera asegurar una buena cosecha de granos básicos y el alimento para su familia.

Ella quiere mejorar su vivienda, construirla de un material más resistente ya que la actual es de bahareque y quiere construirla de bloque, esto le dará una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y una mejor seguridad.
texts.en:
Dora, 57 years old, never went to school because her parents decided to put her to work since she was a child. She says that her parents told her that you can't eat letters, but that with work, you make food.
 
She is partnered and her partner works in agriculture. With him, she has 5 children, 2 women and 3 men, all of whom are adults. The men work in agriculture and as daily laborers, the daughters take care of the household tasks and make tortillas which they sell in the community.

Dora works taking care of the household tasks, and also has a job making tortillas with her daughters. They sell this product in the same community, and also she works raising pigs and in agriculture with her husband and sons. She says that despite her parents not sending her to school, she thanks them for teaching her how to work the land and earn her daily bread. Her work schedule varies since some days she works from early morning and other days later.

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for their corn and bean crops, since they are cultivating 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 of beans. Her husband does this work with their children. Having these products in the house will allow them to apply them to their crops at the right moment and, in this way, assure themselves of a good harvest of basic grains and food for the family.

She wants to improve her house, build it from a stronger material, since it currently is made of daub and wattle and she wants to make it from cement blocks, which would give her family a better quality of life and more security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for their corn and bean crops, since they are cultivating 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 of beans. Her husband does this work with their children.

loans.name: Chen Group

texts.en: Chen is 47 years old, a farmer and a widower with two children living in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. He has been a farmer since 1980. One of his children is a garment worker and another is a grocer. Together, they can earn approximately $10 per day. Now Chen would like to request a loan as a group of four members and he will use his portion to build a latrine. This loan will help his family live healthily and avoid illnesses. In the future, he is going to renovate his house.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Raci

texts.pt:
Cliente é casada maritalmente, vive com seu marido e suas duas filhas com idades compreendidas entre os 7 e 10 anos. A cliente dedica seu dia a dia na venda de roupas usadas para o sustento da sua família, e num passado muito breve a cliente expandiu sua actividade arendando um estabelecimento para se dedicar se a  venda de bebidas.
É uma cliente da instituição a 8 anos, e com o valor do crédito a cliente pretende comprar um jogo de sofás pra a sua casa.
O seu maior desafio do momento é trabalhar bastante para ver seus negócios crescerem. 
Seu maior sonho é ter uma viatura que possa a ajudar na sua actividade.
texts.en:
Raci is married and lives with her husband and two daughters who are 7 and 10. She dedicates her day to day to selling used clothes to support her family and recently expanded her activities by renting out an establishment from which she sells drinks.

She has been a client of this institution [Hluvuku-Adsema] for the last 8 years and with this loan she plans to buy a set of sofas for her house.

Her biggest challenge is to work hard to see her businesses grow.

Her biggest dream is to buy a vehicle which can help her in her activities.

loans.use: buy a set of sofas for her house.

loans.name: Linda

texts.pt:
Cliente é solteira e mae de 2 filhos ambos do sexo masculino com iades compreendidas entre os 13 e 16 anos de idade. Esta cliente é trabalhadora duma empresa de golfinhos onde trabalha como governanta.
Ela é cliente da Hluvuku a 4 anos, e com o valor financiado o cliente pretende comprar chapas de zinco, arros para janelas e sacos de cimento para o rebuco das paredes.
 Seu maior sonho é ver sua casa concluída e anivel profissional sente se satisfeita.
O seu maior desafio é terminar a sua obra que já esta numa fase bastante avançada e a residir nela.
texts.en:
Linda is the single mother of 2 children who are both male and aged 13 and 16. She works for a dolphin company as a housekeeper.

She has been a client of Hluvuku's for 4 years and with this loan she plans to buy sheets of zinc, window frames and sacks of cement to reinforce her walls.

Her biggest dream is to finish building her house and on a professional level she already feels satisfied.

Her biggest challenge is to finish her house, which is already in quite an advanced state and to be able to live in it.

loans.use: to buy sheets of zinc, window frames and sacks of cement to reinforce her walls.

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.pt:
Clientecasado maritalmente e pai de um filho de 3 anos de idade que vive actualmente com seus pais na sua terá natal, para cuidar dele tem enviado valor aos pais. Ele trabalha na instancia turística como Chefe da Manutenção e actualmente terá recebido uma promoção para controlar também o armazém e seu maior sonho é construir uma casa de material convencional uma vez que vive numa de material precário.
É cliente da instituição a 3anos e já teve 3 empréstimos com a Hluvuku-Adsema, e com o valor do crédito o cliente pretende comprar 40 sacos de cimento e pagar mão-de-obra ao pedreiro para fazer blocos. 
O seu maior sonho e desafio do momento é construir sua casa.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo is married and the father of a 3 year old son who is currently living in his home town - to look after his son, he has been sending his parents money. He works at a tourist resort as the Chief of Maintenance and has just received a promotion to look after the warehouse as well.

His biggest dream is to build a house made out of conventional materials, as the one he currently lives in is made out of precarious materials.

He has been a client of this institution for 3 years and has had 3 loans with Hluvuku-Adsema. With this loan he plans to buy 40 sacks of cement and pay for stonemasons to make bricks.

His biggest dream and challenge at the moment is to build his house.

loans.use: buy 40 sacks of cement and pay for stonemasons to make bricks.

loans.name: Mom Group

texts.en: Mom is 57 years old, a farmer and a married woman living with her husband and five children in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1980. Her husband is 58 years old, a motor mechanic. All of her children are garment workers. Together, they can earn approximately $15 per day. Now Mom would like to apply for a loan as part of a group of five members, and she will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions and avoid illnesses. In the future, she is going to expand her rice cultivation and renovate her house.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz está trabando como docente en un Colegio Técnico, su padre trabaja y su mamá es docente, sus aspiraciones futuras son las de poder acceder a su licenciatura en Ciencias Ambientales para desempeñarse como Gestora Ambiental dentro del Departamento del país donde vive, ante las múltiples necesidades, esto sería en forma particular o en la Municipalidad de Pilar.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad.
texts.en: Liz is working as a teacher in a Technical College. Her father works and her mother is a teacher. Her future aspirations include being able to obtain her bachelor's degree in Environmental Science so that she can serve in the Environmental Management Department in the country where she lives, where there are many needs, or in the Municipality of Pilar. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay university fees.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia  Lucila se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura ya tambien la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva maiz y papa, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The borrower, Lucila, continues to making a living in the agriculture business. She also still works in the livestock business. She has a piece of land where she harvest corn and potatoes. The borrower works from 6 AM until 5 PM. She already has been years of experience in this business and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her farm land. The borrower is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the payment fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop to study

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en: Renalyn is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar. Renalyn has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns income from selling manicure and pedicure services and food vending. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has applied for an additional loan to further build her business. Renalyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell, including canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en:
Kamene thanks Yehu and Kiva at large for the support of the previous loan which helped her to boost her business and also the living standards of her family.
Kamene operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over 20 years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Kamene dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: purchase sacks of fish for resale..

loans.name: Babilyn

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Babilyn works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from growing rice. Babilyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Babilyn has been sustaining her business activities with her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and transport.

For the past three years she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 10,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra de 31 años de edad,  estudio hasta 7° grado no continuo con sus estudios ya que su familia se cambió de domicilio por el conflicto armado que vivió el país. 

 Ella es madre soltera tiene una hija de 10 años de edad, quien estudia 4° grado en el centro escolar ; Sandra vive junto a su hija, hermana, mamá y una tía, pero de ella solo depende su hija.

Ella se dedica a trabajar como doméstica en un comedor,  se levanta a las 4:00 am para preparar la comida que será comercializada en el comedor junto a su patrona y otra empleada, el horario de trabajo solo tiene hora de entrada pero no de salida; ya que su jornada termina cuando se vende todo el producto, ella decidió dedicarse a este rubro ya que hace años su mamá poseía un comedor y ella le ayudaba en la atención.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una refrigeradora, quiere darle un regalo a su mamá en agradecimiento a todas las noches de desvelo que ella tubo cuando Sandra era una niña y por todos los esfuerzos que ella hizo para sacarla a delante a ella y su familia. 

Ella desea en un futuro tener su vivienda propia, para poder formar una nueva vida junto a su hija, desea darle a ella todo el estudio que le fue negado por el conflicto armado, para que sea una persona preparada y tenga cuando este mayor un trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Sandra, 31 years old, went to school up to the 7th grade. She didn't continue with her schooling since her family moved to a new home due to the armed conflict that the country had.  

She is a single mother; she has a 10-year-old daughter, who is a 4th grade student in the local school. Sandra lives with her daughter, sister, mother and an aunt, but only her daughter depends on her.

She works as a assistant in a cafeteria. She gets up at 4:00 am to prepare the food that will be sold in the cafeteria with her boss and another employee. The work schedule only has a start time, not an ending time, since her day ends when they sell all their product. She decided to work in this line of work since her mother had a cafeteria and she helped her with serving.  

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase a refrigerator which she wants to give to her mother in thanks for all the sleepless nights that she had when Sandra was a girl and for all the efforts that she made to get her and her family ahead. 

She wants to have her own house in the future, in order to make a new life with her daughter. She wants to give her all the schooling that was denied her by the armed conflict, so that she will be a well-prepared person and have dignified work when she is older.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator which she wants to give to her mother in thanks for all the sleepless nights that she had when Sandra was a girl.

loans.name: Arwa Al- Kawkabani Group

texts.en: Arwa Al-Kawkabani is a group which is comprised of four members, women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB. Arwa is the leader of the group. She is a 26-year-old married woman and the mother of two children, living with them in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a. Arwa is very active and dynamic woman and works as a housewife, and her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. The income of the husband is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family.
