Also, the expenses of the Ied Holiday at the end of the month of Ramadhan cost them lot of money. This means that the family suffers from a shortage of some of foods in the house. Therefore Arwa has applied for a loan of 20,000 YER to purchase food for the house, including flour, sugar, meat, potato, and tomatoes, in order to face all the of the family's needs for food and to make delicious meals for them. Arwa looks forward to starting her own business, which can help her in improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy food for the house, including flour, sugar, meat, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Neam's Group

texts.en:
Neam is 39 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area located in the Presh Vihea province, Cambodia. She has been farming rice and growing soybean for 15 years. The current business earns her about 32,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs. 
Neam has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely repaid the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a solar panel for lighting in her house. She hopes to have enough household supply to use for her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel for lighting in her house

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Tbeng Meanchey District

loans.name: Arej Al- Rawdah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Arej Al-Rawdah. It is comprised of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 175,000 YER from AMB.

Layla is a 30-year-old, single woman. She lives with her parents, in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a. She works as a homemaker, and her father is the sole breadwinner of the family.

Despite the fact that she is an uneducated woman, Layla knows how she can run her life very well. She is a talented and respected, professional young woman. Layla wants to improve the living standard of her family, by purchasing many new home appliances and furniture. As a first step toward making her improvements to the house, Layla applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to purchase bed for the bedroom of the house.

Layla looks forward to improving the living conditions of her family. She hopes to build the second floor and renovate it, to make her house more comfortable and spacious.

loans.use: to purchase bed for the bedroom of the house.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana’s age is 25; she is married, and lives with her spouse and child in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. Rehana owns a small business, selling garments at home. She purchases garments from a market at low prices and sells them at higher prices in her community. The ladies of town like her garment collection and selection, a lot. Rehana's family members appreciate her, for her efforts.

Now, the winter season is about to start. She wants to buy winter season garments to sell. But she does not have cash in hand, due to household expenses.

Therefore, Rehana has requested a loan, so she can buy garments of winter season to fulfill the demand. She wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream is to provide better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy winter-season garments for reselling.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
For the last two years, Anna has been selling assorted vegetables for a living. She earns a monthly profit of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family. She is married to Mutuku and has been blessed with three, school-going children.

Anna has applied for her first loan of KES 10,000 from Visionfund Kenya. She intends to use the entire loan amount to buy more assorted vegetables to sell to her customers -- for example, sukuma wiki, cabbages, tomatoes, and potatoes.

Anna will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children. In future she would like to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more assorted vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy works hard to support her family. Daisy is married and has a rice farming business in the Philippines. Daisy applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Daisy has been in this business for 10 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has applied for an additional loan to further build her business. In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 18 years old and is the eighth of nine children in her family.  She is borrowing PHP 5,000 to pay her tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-15. Jennifer is currently in the third year of her four-year Bachelor of Science in Criminology course. When she graduates, Jennifer plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is 37 years old and married with three children, who are all in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Haide is borrowing PHP 7000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Haide has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from a general store and farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizes and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 38 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school. Cristita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 7000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She will use the loan to buy more groceries to sell.

Cristita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and earns additional income from farming rice.

Cristita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina is a 32-year-old married woman who lives with her family near Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children, three of whom go to school. One of her sons helps his father with raising cattle. Her husband is a cattle trader and does most of his trading within his home area. He breeds cattle in his yard and sells them at a local market. He has to feed each calf for one or two years until it is grown up and healthy, which is a very lengthy and expensive process. He wants to buy a heifer to continue breeding cattle, but he already invested his all savings to build a cowshed. Therefore, Rubina has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner Brac Pakistan, so her husband can buy bull calves and heifers for his cattle farming. Fetal diseases are the major challenge for him. He hopes that he will pay all the installments on time. With the profits he will buy fodder for his cattle and cures for diseases. Rubina is very pleased after receiving this loan and thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy bull calves and heifers for her husband's cattle farm.

loans.name: Al- Dhia 2 Group

texts.en: Al-Dhia 2 is a group comprised of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are applying for a loan of 290,000 YER from AMB. Mawaheb is the leader of the group. She is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. Her oldest child is 12 years old, and the youngest is 5. They live together in a rented house in the capital city, Sana'a. She has a secondary education certificate. Now, she is an employee in a private sector since she has that certificate. Her husband works outside the country. He rarely calls and connects with his family, and he does not spend much on it. Mawaheb cannot depend on the support of her husband. Mawaheb’s salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family, and her house lacks many home appliances. Therefore; Mawaheb is applying for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase many home appliances and furniture, in order to make her house very comfortable. Mawaheb looks forward to opening a saving account with  AMB to improve the living conditions of her family. She hopes to send her children to private schools.

loans.use: to buy many home appliances and furniture  in order to make her house very comfortable.

loans.name: Seema

texts.en: Seema is 49, living near Lahore, Pakistan. She has to work hard to feed her family. She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. One son has gotten married and lives separately. She is living with her two other children and her spouse. To manage her household expenses, she owns a small tailoring business with the help of her daughter at home. Seema and her daughter have been sewing clothes for many years. Her daughter has been learning the skills and helping in her tailoring work, and now she has acquired a lot of experience. She wants to buy a new Juki sewing machine for her daughter, so that the daughter can contribute to generating income by sewing clothes. Therefore, Seema has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner Brac Pakistan, so she can buy the new Juki machine for her daughter. Seema wants to save so that she can arrange the dowry for her daughter. Seema gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a Juki sewing machine for her daughter to use in contributing to the family's income.

loans.name: Frankie

texts.en: Frankie is a responsible father who aims to improve their status of living and educate his children. He is 50 years old and has four children. Together with his spouse, they own and manage a small eatery within the local community to generate additional income. Due to high cost of school fees, he would like to access educational loan from KIVA lenders through ASKI amounting to PHP 15,000.00 to pay for the tuition fee and miscellaneous fees of his daughter. He is hoping that he will obtain his loan request in order to support the education of his daughter, who is taking a Bachelor of Science in Public Administration.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee and miscellaneous fees of his daughter

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en: Fernando is 57 years old, married, and manages a small eatery for income. He cooks and sells snacks and meals. He had six children, and his daughter Farrah Mae is a college student studying Hotel and Restaurant Management. His income from the business is not enough to cover all their expenses, which is why he is now applying for a loan of PHP 13,000 to pay for the tuition fees and allowance of his child. This loan will help achieve his child's dream of being a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to pay for his child's tuition fees and allowance.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more accessories, makeup, and many kinds of perfumes for resale to women in her area.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es estudiante de enfermería  está haciendo su tesis y a la vez que estudia también trabaja, vive con su marido y su hija en la casa de sus  padres en la ciudad de San Lorenzo , su anhelo es trabajar en su profesión y esa manera generar más ingresos y poder comprar un terreno y edificar  su propia casa.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por sus metas y anhelos.
texts.en:
Maria is a nursing student. She is completing her thesis and while she's in school, she also works. She lives with her husband and daughter in her parents' house in the city of San Lorenzo. Her goal is to work in her profession and earn income so she can buy land and build her own home.

She is requesting this loan to make payments for school so she can keep fighting for her dreams and goals.

loans.use: to pay university costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay off a debt, pay her children's tuition, and purchase materials for her sales

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 44-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and a son in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
She belongs to a poor family, her family passing their lives by hand to mouth. Her son owns a small clothing shop in which he sells ladies and gent’s cloths. He has been running this business for many years and cherishing the whole family. It is his misfortune that he could not built up a good relationship among his customers, this is the reason he could not establish his enterprise. 
Due to an increase in family needs he considers it necessary to grow his business. But the lack of available of capital is the major problem for her son.  
Therefore, Shahnaz took a loan for her son’s clothing business. With the help of this loan he will purchase more clothing to sell. 
Shahnaz  thanks to the Kiva and field partner, brac Pakistan.

loans.use: a loan helps Shahnaz's son to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de queso y también la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de queso. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar queso.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria continues to sell cheese and farm. She works from 8:00am until 6:00pm, and has been in the business for several years. It's going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her business selling cheese, and she will use this loan to buy cheese. 

Gregoria is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it on time.

loans.use: buy cheese

loans.name: Melisa Glorizel

texts.es: Melisa, tiene 31 años de edad, está soltera, no tiene hijos,  vive con su madre y hermano, en el municipio de Tocoa, Colon.  Hace 2 años y 7 meses que estableció su propio negocio  de una  pulpería y también hace bisutería como aretes, pulseras, anillos para vender.  En la pulpería  ofrece productos como ser, arroz, azúcar, carne de pollo, harina, huevos, pan, café, manteca, pastas, churros, refrescos, etc.  Anteriormente trabajo en una empresa municipal. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 20,000 lempiras para comprar granos básicos, manteca, refrescos, azúcar, huevos, pan, churros, productos de aseo, jugos, carnes, productos lácteos y otros abarrotes para surtir y vender más.  Su sueño es tener su negocio grande y poder desarrollarse como empresaria.
texts.en:
Maria, 31, is single and has no children. She lives with her mother and brother in the municipality of Tocoa, Colon. Two years and seven months ago, she started her own grocery store business and she also makes jewelry including earrings, bracelets, and rings to sell. In her grocery store, she sells products such as rice, sugar, chicken, flour, eggs, bread, coffee, butter, pasta, churros, drinks, and more.

Previously, she worked for a business in the municipality. She is requesting a loan of HNL 20,000 to buy basic grains, butter, drinks, sugar, eggs, bread, churros, cleaning products, juice, meat, dairy products, and other groceries to stock up and sell more. Her dream is to have a large business and grow to be a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, butter, drinks, sugar, eggs, bread, churros, cleaning products, juice, meat, dairy products, and other groceries to stock up her store.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr.  Daniel trabaja como supervisor en una farmacéutica, y a la vez estudia por las noches la carrera de tecnología en producción.
Daniel está casado, y tiene una hija por quien él y su esposa están luchando para poder darle una vida digna y sin privaciones. Es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira a ser un buen profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene y estudiar con tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Daniel works as a supervisor at a pharmacy, and also goes to school in the evening studying a career in production technology.

Daniel is married and has a daughter for whom he and his wife are fighting to provide a dignified life without limitations. He is a very responsible person who is dedicated to school and family. He hopes to be a good professional and keep studying to serve other people.

He is requesting this loan to pay university costs. This will allow him to cover the costs he has and continue school with peace.

loans.use: to pay university costs.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is fees for school.
For the past three years, she has operated a households selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.
With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase new household items for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase new household items for resale.

loans.name: Gimena Lincena

texts.es:
Gimena es una mujer de 24 años de edad soltera, madre de un bebé y su negocio es el comercio de Quinua.
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, fuerte, perseverante, constante y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en el municipio de Batallas un lugar caracterizado por su altura (4000 metros sobre el nivel del mar) y su cercanía al lago Titicaca, distante a una hora y media de la ciudad capital
Gimena es de tez morena, cabello largo trenzado negro, su vestimenta es tradicional, sus manos son delgadas secas y duras, su negocio es el cultivo y comercio de la Quinua Real. La Quinua es un grano antiguo que contiene altas proporciones de proteína, crece en grandes cantidades, es fácil de cultivar y germina en temperaturas nocturnas que están por debajo de los 15.5 grados centígrados.
Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su bebé, ella desea mejorar los ingresos económicos para su familia realizando la compra de Quinua Real por mayor, para la venta y el cultivo.
Es por esos motivos que Gimena solicita un préstamo para la compra de Quinua por mayor y darle una mejor vida a su pequeño bebé.
texts.en:
Gimena, age 24, is the single mother of a small baby and is in the business of selling quinoa.  She is enterprising, fighting, perservering, dedicated, and always hard-working. She works in the city of Batallas, a place notable for its altitude (4000m / 13,100 feet above sea level) and its proximity to Lake Titicaca, an hour and a half from the capital.

Gimena has brown skin and a long, thick black braid. She dresses in traditional attire, and her hands are thin, dry, and strong. She works by growing and selling Quinoa Real, a particular strain of quinoa. Quinoa is an ancient grain that contains a high level of protein. It grows in large quantities, it's easy to raise, and it germinates even in areas where the overnight lows are less than 60 F (15.5 C). 

Her dream is to improve her and her baby's quality of life. She wants to improve her family's income by purchasing Quinoa Real at wholesale and selling and raising it. That's why she is requesting this loan.

loans.use: buy quinoa and provide for her baby

loans.name: Ruossath Group

texts.en:
In the photo, the small girl is a daughter of a group member. 

Ruossath is 36 years old, a farmer and a married woman living with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 2000. Her husband is 37 years old and is a construction worker. All of her children are students. Together, she and her husband can earn approximately $8.50 per day. 

Now Ruossath would like to request a loan as a group of three members, and she will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will help her family to live in better conditions and to live healthily. 

In the future, she wants to expand her rice cultivation and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Soeum

texts.en:
Soeum is 34 years old and a married man who has only one little child. He lives in the community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, he and his wife manage a rice farming business which is the sole source of their income. So far, they have been in this occupation for nearly ten years with the average income being USD 10.00 a day.
Soeum wants to improve the general living conditions for the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL that has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Virgen De Lourdes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “Virgen de Lourdes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Juana continua con su negocio de venta de zapatos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua distribuyendo y vendiendo a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatos para niños.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de venta de zapatos, comida, tienda de abarrotes, cereales y otros brindan servicios profesionales. 
Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These are the members of the community bank "Virgen de Lourdes" - part of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  One member, Juana, is continuing with her business selling shoes. She's been in the business for a good while now, and it's going well for her thanks to the drive that she brings to her business every day. She distributes and sells to all her customers, and she'd like to keep working in this business since it helps her support her family. She is requesting this loan to buy children's shoes.  

The other members are in a wide variety of businesses, including shoe sales, food sales, grocery stores, grain sales, and professional services. The members are grateful to the people who become part of their dream in this way and they are committed to repaying the loan on time within the established terms. The members who are pictured in the adjacent photo requested permission to be late for the meeting due to their jobs.

loans.use: buy children's shoes

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business. The previous loan enabled her to save money for her farming business. Besides farming, she operates a retail shop. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, soap, cooking oil and sugar for her business.
She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, soap, cooking oil and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Ikiraro Group

texts.fr:
Polycarpe fait partie du groupe  Ikiraro et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 33 ans et est marié à Schella ,un agent d'une pharmacie. Ensemble ils ont 2  enfants âgés de 1 à 3 ans. 

Il fait le commerce de bananes depuis 2 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  bananes, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Polycarpe is a member of the Ikiraro group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 33 years old and married to a pharmacy assistant called Schella. They have two children of one and three.

He has been a banana seller for two years.

This is his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan that he requests, he plans to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for resale to earn more.

Over the coming years he would like to see his children studying.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Ahmmed

texts.en:
Ahmmed is a 36-year-old married man and a father of three children. His oldest child is 9 years old and the youngest one is 1-year-old, and the family lives in their own house in Dhamar, Yemen. He has a university education and is an employee in the public sector. His salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Ahmmed accumulated a good amount of money and purchased a piece of land, and then he built his own house on that land that he had purchased. This cost him a lot of money and the expenses of the building were very high. Now, he is unable to continue building his house from the inside in order to make it ready and more suitable for living. Therefore, Ahmmed applied for a loan of 235,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase paints, electric cables, and other construction materials to construct and prepare his house for living.
Ahmmed looks forward to building the second floor to make his house more spacious and large. He is very dynamic and ambitious man.

loans.use: to purchase paints, electric cables, and other construction materials to build and prepare his house for living.

loans.name: Carolina Lisset

texts.es:
Carolina de 39 años de edad, es una señora emprendedora madre de cinco hijos (4 varones y 1 hembra), estudio hasta segundo grado, ya no siguió estudiando debido a que no tuvo el apoyo de sus padres. Dos de sus hijos ya se acompañaron en la comunidad y tienen sus propios hogares, en su casa solo viven tres de sus hijos, se acompaño hace once años su esposo trabaja en la albañilería y también es fontanero en la comunidad y trabaja los fines de semana en los siembros de maíz y frijoles. Un hermano le regalo un terreno donde tiene su casa. En su casa solo dependen sus tres hijos que viven con ella y su esposo quien le ayuda al sustento diario de la familia.

Carolina se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, llinas, sabanas, para todas las edades desde hace mas de nueve años gracias a que unas amigas que le motivaron para que emprendería su propio negocio y fuera independiente, antes trabajo por muchos años donde una señora vecina en la venta de tortillas de maíz que distribuían en la comunidad.
La venta de ropa y otras variedades las vende cuatro días a la semana, cuando sale a vender ella sola a los cantones de la comunidad, su esposo le apoya para ir a comprar la mercadería.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar mercadería como ropa, llinas, sabanas, cobijas, zapatos y otras variedades las cuales aumentaran su inventario para ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes. 
La mercadería la compra en la ciudad para lo cual tiene que viajar por mas de dos horas en transporte urbano para llegar al lugar donde compra la mercadería. El resto lo necesita para la compra de lamina y madera que necesita para el hogar que esta construyendo con su esposo en el terreno que le dono su hermano. 
Carolina sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda con su esposo, así tener donde vivir mas dignamente y mas seguros con su familia. También quiere seguir apoyando a sus hijos que están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Carolina, age 39, is an enterprising lady and the mother of five children (four boys and one girl).  She studied until the second grade--she did not continue studying because she did not have the support of her parents. Two of her children already live with their partners and have their own houses in the community, and only three of her children live in her house. 

She has lived with her partner for eleven years. Her husband works as a bricklayer and is also a plumber in the community. On the weekends he works cultivating corn and beans.  A brother gave her a plot of land where she has her house, in which only her three dependent children live with her and her husband, who helps her with the daily living expenses of their family.  

Carolina has been selling linens, sheets, and clothing for all age groups, for more than nine years, thanks to some girlfriends who motivated her to start her own business, and to be independent. Before, she worked for many years where a neighboring lady worked, selling corn tortillas that they distributed throughout the community. Four days a week she goes out alone to sell clothing and various items in the community cantons, and her husband supports her so that she can go to purchase the merchandise. 

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of merchandise such as clothing, linens, sheets, blankets, shoes, and various items which will expand her inventory so that she can offer more variety to her customers. She will purchase the merchandise in the city, to which she must travel for more than two hours by public transport in order to arrive at the place where she purchases the merchandise.   She will use the rest to purchase sheeting and wood that she needs for the home that she is building with her husband on the land that her brother gave her.

Carolina dreams of completing the construction of her house with her husband, so that she can live with her family in a home that is decent and safe.  She also wants to continue supporting her children who are studying in the community school.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as clothing, linens, sheets, blankets, shoes, and various items in order to have more variety to offer to her customers, and to purchase sheeting and wood for building her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to renovate the house and build new rooms.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
El socio Sabino se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte, el socio tiene un taxi donde hace servicio público, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Sabino continues in his transportation bussiness. He has a taxi and provides service to the general public. He works from 6:00am until 7:00pm. He has several years of experience in this work, and it's going well for him. His dream is to buy a new car. Sabino is requesting this loan so that he can buy new tires for his car. He is happy about the loan and is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: buy tires for his car

loans.name: Kilekani 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  KILEKANI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOMALABA un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame ROKIA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  KILEKANI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kilekani 1 group are married women who, on average, are 42 years old with five children. Most of them live in traditional families in Komalaba, which is a village in Kouoro in the Sikasso circle, in the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to manage their farming businesses during the winter period.
This is their third rural loan from the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, the previous loans have been duly repaid.
Mrs. Rokia grows peanuts. She is standing second from the left in this photo of the women of the Kilekani 1 group.
With her loan, she plans to buy two sacks of 50 kg of fertiliser, two cans of weed killer, and pay labour costs for the upkeep of 0.5 hectares.
After the harvest, she sells her product in the village, and in Sikasso to a mixed clientele for cash or for credit.
She hopes to make an average profit of 74 000 francs CFA per field.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and the interest, and help her husband with the daily family expenses.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser, weed killer, and pay for labour costs.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris really appreciated the previous loan that helped her to expand her business.

Now she wants to start a vegetable and fruit-selling business. Her main goal is to become one of the leading fruit-vending businesses in the area in order to raise her profits. For this reason she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, water melons and pawpaw with the KES 20,000.

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: To purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, water melons and pawpaw

loans.name: Jacqilyn

texts.en:
Jacqilyn is 34 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice and corn in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice and corn for 14 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store.

Jacqilyn is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: José Álvaro

texts.es:
José de 36 años de edad, padre de un hijo de 15 años y que estudia el nivel básico en la comunidad, se acompaño hace mas de diez año, su esposa quien trabaja en las artesanías de hilo,  hace hamacas de seda y de poliseda desde que era pequeña cuando sus padres le enseñaron el arte. José no estudio debido a que en la zona donde reside fue muy duro el conflicto armado en esa época en el país, tiene  nueve hermanos pero de él depende su esposa, su hijo y su madre a quien apoya mucho.

José se dedica actualmente a la siembra de maíz, frijoles y maicillo, aprendió el trabajo desde los doce años de edad cuando se iba a trabajar a las lomas de los cerros a sembrar los granos básicos.
 También trabaja de ayudante de albañil en la comunidad con un tío, quien en temporadas de trabajo de construcción le ayuda en los trabajos. Antes trabajo también en el manejo del cultivo de caña en la zona central de el país donde el cultivo es predominante.

Hoy en día, también su esposa le enseño el arte de tejer hamacas y trabaja por las tardes luego que viene de los cultivos de maíz y frijoles.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar  75 libras de hilo para tejer hamacas con su esposa, la libra esta valora en $4.5 cada una, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando con su esposa en la elaboración de hamacas de seda y de poliseda, las cuales comercializa en los pueblos aledaños y por encargos.

José sueña con seguir creciendo en la comercialización de hamacas en la zona, ya que le es rentable el negocio, lo que permite obtener mayores ingresos económicos para así lograr una mejor calidad de vida. 

Además, en el futuro quiere construir una vivienda en un terreno que compro gracias a sus ahorros. También quiere seguir ayudando a su hijo en los estudios.
texts.en:
Jose, 36, is the father of a 15-year-old son who is in primary school in the community. He has been married for over 10 years. His wife, who works in crafts with thread, has made silk and poly-silk hammocks since she was young when her parents taught her the art. Jose didn't go to school because the area he lived in was going through a very difficult armed conflict at the time in the country. He has nine siblings, but his wife, son and mother depend greatly on his support.

Jose currently plants corn, beans, and sorghum. He learned this work 12 years ago when he was working in the hills and planting basic grains.

He also helps as a construction worker in the community with an uncle who he helps with jobs during the construction work season. Before, he also worked in managing sugarcane crops in the central area of the country where this is the dominant crop.

Today, his wife also teaches the art of making hammocks and works in the afternoon after she comes from the corn and bean crops.

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy 75 pounds of thread to make hammocks with his wife. A pound is valued at $4.50, which would allow him to keep working with his wife making silk and poly-silk hammocks, which he sells in the surrounding villages and through orders.

Jose dreams of continuing to grow his business of selling hammocks in the area because it is a successful business that allows him to earn better income so he can have a better quality of life.

Also, in the future he wants to build a home on the land he bought from his savings. He also wants to keep helping his son with school.

loans.use: to buy 75 pounds of thread to sew hammocks with his wife. A pound is valued at $4.50, which allows him to keep working with his wife to make silk and poly-silk hammocks, which he sells in the surrounding villages and through orders.

loans.name: Kilekani 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KILEKANI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOMALABA un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame KADIA débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KILEKANI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kilekani 2 group are married women who, on average, are 41 years old with five children. Most of them live in traditional families in Komalaba, which is a village in the Kouoro commune in the Sikasso circle, in the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to manage their farming affairs during the winter period.
This is their third rural loan from the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, the previous loans have been duly repaid.
Mrs. Kadia grows peanuts. She is standing first on the left in this photo of the women of the Kilekani 2 group.
With her loan, she plans to buy two sacks of 50 kg of fertiliser, two cans of weed killer, and pay labour costs for the upkeep of 0.5 hectares.
After the harvest, she sells her product in the village, and in Sikasso to a mixed clientele for cash or for credit.
She hopes to make an average profit of 74 000 francs CFA per plot of land.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and the interest, and help her husband with the daily family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, weed killer, and pay for labour costs.

loans.name: Levi Joel

texts.es:
Levi de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato; luego decidió entrar a la academia de policía, en la cual obtuvo un puesto de trabajo y es de donde obtiene sus ingresos. 

Esta acompañado su esposa se dedica a la venta de productos por revista y a los oficios del hogar, con ella no tiene hijos aun.

Él se dedica a trabajar como agente de seguridad en la PNC,  desde hace varios años; él decidió dedicarse a este trabajo ya que su familia era de escasos recursos y quería ayudarles en los gastos del hogar, su horario de trabajo es de 24 horas seguidas entra a las 7:00 am de un día y sale a las 7:00 am del siguiente día,  él tiene trabaja 4 días por semana y descansa 3 y se traslada 15 kilómetros en autobús para llegar a su trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar madera, teja, cemento, arena, para la remodelación de la vivienda de su mamá ya que se encuentra en mal estado y él quiere reparársela, manifiesta que quiere que ella tenga una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor seguridad en ella. 

Levi desea poder comprar un terreno y construir su propia vivienda, ya que donde viven actualmente es alquilado, desea tener una buena infraestructura donde pueda darle a su esposa las condiciones que ella se merece y poder crecer a sus hijos, ya que pronto será papá, desea también que el trabajo que realizara en la vivienda de su madre sea excelente y que ella ya no tenga problemas que se moje cuando llueva.
texts.en:
Levi, 36, studied up to high school level and then decided to go to the Police Academy which he used to obtain a career and where he now gets his income from. He has a wife who sells magazine products and takes care of the household chores. They do not have any children yet.

He has worked as a security officer for PNC for several years. He decided to devote himself to this career since his family were poor and he wanted to help with household expenses. He works 24 hours straight, from 7 am one day to 7 am the next. He works four days a week and rests for three. He also has to travel 15 kilometers by bus to get to work.

He is requesting a loan to buy wood, tiles, cement and sand to remodel his mother's home as it is in a bad way and he wants to repair it, as he wants her to have a better quality of life with better security.

Levi wants to buy land and build his own home with good infrastructure because he currently lives in a rented home. He wants to give his wife the best quality of life and somewhere where she can bring up their children as he is going to be a father soon. He also wants the work that he does in his mother's house to be excellent so she no longer has trouble getting wet when it rains.

loans.use: buy wood, tiles, cement and sand to remodel his mother's home as it is in a bad way and he wants to repair it, as he wants her to have a better quality of life with better security.

loans.name: Milciades

texts.es:
Milciades es de una familia humilde, ya se recibió de militar y está trabajando hace más de dos años en ese trabajo, seguir estudiando y ahora estoy en el segundo año de la carrera de Ingeniería Civil, es una persona que quiere seguir estudiando y capacitándose.
Quiere tener su casa propia, ascender a un cargo de gran responsabilidad, formar una familia y ayudar a sus padres.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo y luchar por sus metas.
texts.en:
Miliciades is from a poor family. He was accepted into the military and has been there for more than two years. He is still studying and is now in his second year of Civil Engineering, wanting to further his education and training.
He wants to own his own home, to have great responsibility, raise a family and help his parents.
He is requesting this loan to pay his university fees and thus be able to continue with his studies and reach his goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing and school books for his daughters for the upcoming school year, and to make small repairs to their family home

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German es un hombre de 38 años de edad casado, sin hijos y se dedica a la pesca.
Él es emprendedor, constante, luchador, fuerte, y muy trabajador, su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad de batallas, un lugar caracterizado por su cercanía al lago Titicaca y por su altura (4000 metros sobre el nivel del mar).
German es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro corto, su negocio es la pesca, todos los días se encarga de transportar sus redes y desatarlas en medio del lago Titicaca donde espera durante horas antes de recogerlas, sus horarios varían de acuerdo a la especie y a la temporada climática.
Su sueño es poder mejorar su producción, para generar mejores ingresos económicos y construir un cuarto para su casa. El necesita realizar la compra de un motor fuera de borda para su bote pesquero, de esa manera realizaría búsquedas más profundas en el lago.
Es por esos motivos German solicita un préstamo para la compra de un motor de bote y con los beneficios construir un cuarto para su familia.
texts.en:
German is 38-year-old man. He is married without children, and his profession is fishing. 

He is enterprising, persevering, determined, strong, and very hard-working. He does his work in the community of Batallas, a place characterized by its proximity to Lake Titicaca and its altitude (4000 meters above sea level).

German is of medium height and has brown skin and short black hair. His business is fishing: every day he takes on the task of transporting his nets and casting them out in the waters of Lake Titicaca, where he waits hours and then pulls them in again. His working hours vary depending on the season, the weather and the species.

His dream is to increase his production in order to generate more income and build an additional room for his house. He needs to buy an outboard motor for his fishing boat, which will allow him to fish in deeper waters of the lake. 

For this reason, German is requesting a loan to buy a motor for his boat, and with the profits he will build a room for his family.

loans.use: to buy an outboard motor for his fishing boat.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre muy trabajador, es soltero, tiene 46 años y vive en Chincha junto a su familia.
Siempre labora con mucho entusiasmo, desde hace más de 5 años trabaja brindando servicios de soldadura y fabricación de cuerdas de pescar. Le va muy bien porque realiza excelentes labores y ha ganado bastante experiencia a lo largo de los años. Sus padres son su mayor motivación en la vida, es por ellos que siempre lucha para poder brindarles todas las comodidades ya que ahora son personas mayores y requieren cuidado y atención.
Julio quiere mejorar la atención que brinda y necesita comprar materiales como alambres, abrazaderas, entre otros para poder renovar los antiguos materiales que tiene y así mejorar sus ingresos. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá renovar sus equipos y así seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder formar una empresa de soldadura y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julio is a very hardworking man, single, 46 years old who lives in Chincha with his family. 

He always works with a lot of enthusiasm. 

For over five years, he has offered his services soldering and manufacturing ropes for fishing.

He has done quite well because he puts out excellent products. He has gathered a lot of experience throughout the years.

His parents are his main motivation in life; it is for them that he fights to provide them with all their eammenities, as they are older and require care and attention.

He needs to buy supplies like wires, clamps, etc. to replace his old equipment and that way generate more income.

He is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they have given him. He will be able to renew his equipment and thereby put in the effort to later on form a soldering company and expand his business.

loans.use: buy materials for soldering and fishing.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta 6º grado,esta acompañada su esposo vive en estados unidos, ella vive solo con sus 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 15 años de edad.

 Antonia se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar,su esposo le ayuda mensualmente para los gastos de la alimentación y otros gastos educativos de sus hijos.

El préstamo lo necesita para gastos de universidad de sus dos hijos,de esa forma lograra solventar su situación financiera y la necesidad quedara satisfecha.

El sueño de Antonia es que sus hijos se preparen y  sigan estudiando que sean profesionales y tengan un buen trabajo que se puedan ganar la vida por si solos y ella seguirá trabajando la institución.
texts.en:
Antonia, age 39, studied until the 6th grade. She has a common-law marriage, and her husband lives in the United States. She lives alone with her 3 children, ages 20, 18, and 15. Antonia is a housekeeper. Her husband helps her monthly with food expenses and other educational expenses for their children.

She needs the loan for university costs for her two children; this way she will be able to resolve their financial situation, and the need will be met.

The dream of Antonia is that her children may prepare themselves and continue studying so that they may be professionals, and have good jobs that will enable them to earn a living for themselves.  She will continue working at the institution.

loans.use: to pay university costs for her two children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for his grocery store to resell.

loans.name: Kilekani 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KILEKANI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOMALABA un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame ASSETOU débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KILEKANI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “KILEKANI 3” are married women, who average 35 years of age and five children each, living for the most part in traditional families in KOMALABA, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. ASSETOU (standing first at the right in the photo of this women’s group KILEKANI 3). With her loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and 2 containers of herbicide and to pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Freddy Francisco

texts.es: Freddy Francisco mayor de edad casado con cuatro hijos de los cuales solo uno esta bajo su responsabilidad, originario de uno de los municipios del norte de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, minera, ganadera, es un microempresario y administrador de su propio negocio el cual consisten la comercialización de cerdos en pie, y destace de este mismo para la venta de: nacatamales, pepena, fritos, moronga, charrasca entre otros, negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación, desde muy temprano sale a comprar cerdos en pie en comarcas aledañas a la suya las cuales son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su negocio con la venta de una vaca que tenia y como ya tenia experiencia en este negocio de comercio de cerdos es que decide incursionar en este,el cual le dedica bastante tiempo en el cuido y en la venta del mismo, debido a que la crianza de cerdos con lleva el cuido de su alimentación diaria, su limpieza de su corral para que los animales se conserven en un ambiente sano y atractivo para los clientes dando una buena presentación, Freddy se caracteriza por ser un hombre que ha luchado día a día  por salir adelante junto con su familia, el desde muy joven tuvo que comenzar a trabajar debido a que viene de una familia de pocos recursos económicos, perdiendo la oportunidad de estudiar y el cual solo termina su primaria ya que se dedico a este negocio, El objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en la compra de un lote de cerdos para la crianza y venta del mismo.
texts.en:
Freddy Francisco Senior is married with four children, with just one of them of the age to be under their responsibility. He originates from one of the northern municipalities of Chinandega, located in the west of the country, an area that is characterized by being productively commercial and a mining town with livestock. He is a micro-entrepreneur and is a manager of his own business which butchers pigs and sells them. This business is located in his house and from very early he has sold products to nearby regions where he has permanent and temporary cash customers.
He started his business by selling a cow and as he had experience in the trading business, he decided to turn to selling and also looking after pigs. He takes care of their daily feeds and cleans their pen to promote a healthy environment and give a good presentation to their customers. Freddy is a man who has fought every day to succeed for his family. Since he was very young, he had to start working as he comes from a poor family with few resources, missing the opportunity to study past primary school since he was dedicated to his business.

He is requesting this loan to invest in buying a bulk of pigs for breeding and then selling.

loans.use: to buy pigs for breeding and then selling.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia Nancy se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboración de productos lácteos como quesos, yogurt y manjares,  la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de queso,yogurt y manjares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche y azucar.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The borrower, Nancy, continues to dedicate herself to her business making dairy products such as cheese, yogurt and treats. She works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She has spent many years on this business and it is going very well. Her dream is to grow her business selling cheese, yogurt and treats. She is seeking this loan to purchase milk and sugar. Nancy is pleased with this loan and she promises to complete her share of the payments.

loans.use: to purchase milk and sugar.

loans.name: Heng Group

texts.en: Heng is 55 years old, a farmer and a widow with five children living in Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1980. All of her children are employed as garment workers and a blacksmith. Together, they can earn approximately 30 USD per day. Now, Heng would like to request a loan as a group of three members, and she will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will help her family to live in better conditions and to avoid illnesses. In the future, she is going to feed ducks for eggs to sell and build a new house.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es: Abrahan, se dedica a la elaboración de pan junto a su esposa para luego poner el producto a la venta; además presta servicios de transporte en su movilidad. El crédito lo requiere para la reparacion y mantenimiento general de su vehiculo. Abrahan está casado y tiene dos hijos .Vive en casa alquilada la misma queda ubicada en la zona  de Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en: Abrahan makes a living making bread with his wife. They later put their products up for sale. In addition, he offers transportation services using his vehicle. He is requesting a loan to repair and maintain his vehicle. Abrahan is married and has two children. He lives in a rented house, which is located in the area of Llojeta in the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Santiago Del Carmen

texts.es:
Santiago es una mujer de 59 años de edad,  estudio hasta 2º grado, su esposo ya murió quedando viuda. vive con dos hijos que le ayudan un poco en lo económico.

Ella se dedica a pintar mantas y las borda, ademas vende ropa mas que todo faldas y blusas,ella ya tiene cinco años de dedicarse a este negocio.
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar mas material como:manta por fardos,hilo, plumones,ropa. De esa forma, lograra incrementar sus ingresos y tener mas clientes cada día.

El sueño de Santiago es siempre tener las fuerzas y el trabajo para seguir adelante con su negocio,de esa forma cada día recibirá mejores ingresos y estar pendiente cada mes de su cuota.
texts.en: Santiago is a 59 year-old woman. She studied in school until the second grade. Her husband passed away, leaving her as a widow. She lives with two of her children who help her a little economically. Santiago works painting blankets and embroidering them. In addition, she sells clothes that are mostly skirts and blouses. By now she has spent 5 years working on this business. The loan that she is seeking from Credicampo is to purchase more materials such as: bales of blankets, yarn, pens and clothes. This way she will increase her income and obtain more clients each day. Santiago's dream is to always have the strength and jobs to get ahead with her business. This way she will receive better earnings each day and be able to keep track of her monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like bales of blankets, yarn, markers and clothing to increase her income and to obtain more clients each day.

loans.name: Rifat's Group

texts.en:
Rifat is a 33-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. 

She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has two years' experience in this field. Her son assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Riffat wants to increase her sales on a daily basis, so she requested a loan to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her repeated loan cycle, but it will be the first loan with Kiva. She has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for the general store.

loans.name: Kilekani 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KILEKANI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOMALABA un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame AMI débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KILEKANI 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “KILEKANI 4” are married women, who average 36 years of age and six children each, living for the most part in traditional families in KOMALABA, a village in Commune de KOUORO, Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. AMI (standing first at the right in the photo of this women’s group KILEKANI 4). With her loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and 2 containers of herbicide and to pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Kilekani 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe KILEKANI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOMALABA un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame KADIA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KILEKANI 5.

Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

The seven members of the group “KILEKANI 5” are married women, who average 42 years of age and six children each, living for the most part in traditional families in KOMALABA, a village in Commune de KOUORO, Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. KADIA (standing first at the right in the photo of this women’s group KILEKANI 5). With her loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and 2 containers of herbicide and to pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari appreciates the previous loan that helped her to expand her business.

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling goats to passersby and neighbors. She cites theft and competition as her major challenges in the business. 

Chari is requesting 10,000 KES to purchase goats to resell for a profit. She dreams of expanding her business to include butchery in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase goats to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Fadhl

texts.en:
Fadhl is a 40-year-old married man and a father of three children. His oldest child is 12 years old, and the youngest one is 7 years old. They live in their own house in Dhamar, Yemen. He has a university education, and he is an employee with a small salary. His salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. 

Over time, Fadhl accumulated a good amount of money and built his own house. That business cost him a lot of money, and he sold all the jewelry of his wife to achieve his business. Also, some of his family and his friends supported him financially, but the expenses of the building were very much, and now he is unable to make any renovation to his house from the inside to complete the rest of the building of the home. Therefore, Fadhl applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase cement, paints, electric cables, light switches, lamps and other materials to renovate and prepare his house.

Fadhl looks forward to building the second floor and renovating it to make his house more spacious and large. He is a very dynamic and ambitious man.

loans.use: to purchase cement, paints, electric cables, light switches, lamps and other materials to renovate and prepare his house.

loans.name: Al- Nahtha Tebah Group

texts.en:
Al-Nahtha Tebah is a group of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB.

Tebah is the leader of the group. She is a 43-year-old married woman, living with her spouse in their own house. She is an uneducated but very vigorous and dynamic woman. She works as a housewife, and she has a lot of work to do inside her house. Tebah's house lacks many home appliances, and she cannot afford them. Inside the kitchen of her house, her oven is very old, and she needs a new one in order to make good breads, cakes, and other delicious food for her family. For this reason, Tebah is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to purchase a new oven to prepare delicious food for her family inside the house.

Tebah looks forward to renovating her house to make it more suitable for better living.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven to prepare delicious food for her family.

loans.name: Kilekani 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe KILEKANI 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOMALABA un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame NOUMOUSSO débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KILEKANI 6. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the group “KILEKANI 6” are married women, who average 46 years of age and five children each, living for the most part in traditional families in KOMALABA, a village in Commune de KOUORO, Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. NOUMOUSSO (standing first at the right in the photo of this women’s group KILEKANI 6). With her loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and 2 containers of herbicide and to pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline is 32 years old. She is married to Titus and together they have been blessed with three children, 11, 6 and 2 years old. Mercyline runs a retail business where she sell cereals, detergents and other household items. She has run this business for the last six years, earning a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

Mercyline has requested a loan of 10,000 KES, which she will use to purchase goods like sugar, rice, cooking oil and paraffin in order to stock her business. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to expand her business further to become a wholesaler. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

Mercyline's hopes and dreams are to increase her earnings and to cater to her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sugar, rice, cooking oil and paraffin

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 44 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family running a general store in the Philippines, and requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

Prior to this loan, Emelita has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF.  She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns income from farming rice and fattening pigs.

She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 29 years old. She is married and has three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more materials, including nipa leaves and bamboo.

Lucena has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa roofing business for 10 years and also earns income from food vending and farming vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials, including nipa leaves and bamboo.

loans.name: Ma. Socorro

texts.en:
Ma. Socorro is 42 years old and married, with four children who attend school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She has operated a general store in the Philippines for one year, and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, chips, and noodles to sell .

In the future Ma. Socorro would like to grow her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, chips, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 27 years of age, very passionate and diligent about farming. He is considered a pacesetter when it comes to farming in his village of Bosamaro in the Nyamira area of Kenya. Having done mixed farming for the past five years, he has gained much experience and he offers free extension services to young upcoming farmers. He is happily married and is blessed with two lovely school-going children. 

Jared enjoys generating income from selling milk, his harvest, and produce from his farm. He finds dairy farming very fulfilling but the main challenge he faces is not being able to properly feed his dairy cows. He is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter. Through the loan he will be able to cut hay into small pieces before mixing it with other forage to feed his cattle. The chaff cutter will aid his cattle in digestion and will prevent his dairy cattle from rejecting any part of their food. Proper feeding of your cattle is one of the most important factors in maintaining high yield production of milk. Through proper feeding, his cow will produce more milk and this will translate to more profits and improved living standards. 

When he was asked how this loan will benefit his family, Jared said “more income”. Profits from the loan will be used in fully repaying the loan and improving standards of living for his parents, family, and his school-going children.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase many home appliances for the house.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor is a 23-year-old university student majoring in computer sciences, and she is in her third year. She lives with her family, which consists of seven members. Noor is planning to get her bachelor's degree so that she will be able to work in her field of study in the future and be able to help her family financially. But she doesn't have enough money to pay her upcoming semester fees. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Wouyessouly 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 8 membres du groupe WOUYESSOULY 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et ont en moyenne 7 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à KOUMALABA un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts anterieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur SOMA débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  WOUYESSOULY 1. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son interêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The eight members  of the group “WOUYESSOULY 1” are married men, who average 44 years of age and seven children each, living for the most part in traditional families in KOUMALABA, a village in Commune de KOUORO, Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second corn-producing loan with the institution. The previous loan was indeed paid back. 

The crop that Mr. SOMA grows is corn. He is the one standing first at the right in the photo of this men’s group OUYESSOULY 1. With this loan, he intends to purchase eight 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and ten containers of herbicide of different kinds and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village in and SIKASSO. This profit will enable him to pay back his loan with interest, as well as to help cover day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and plowing

loans.name: Mahina

texts.en:
Mahina lives in the northern part of Tajikistan.  She is married and a mother of two young children.  Mahina’s husband is an entrepreneur and she wanted to organize her own business to get ahead as well.  Four months ago she organized a sewing business out of her home, sewing national and European style women's dresses.  

In the future she dreams of opening her workshop in the center of her region.  She is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy two sewing machines to increase the working capital of her new business.  She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines to increase the working capital of her new business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia  Antonia   se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cacao y café, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The borrower, Antonia, continues dedicating herself to her agricultural business. She has a plot of land where she grows cacao and coffee. She works from 6:00am until 5:00pm. She has spent many years working on this business and it is going very well. Her dream is to increase the size of her plot for growing crops. She is seeking the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Antonia is pleased with the loan and she promises to complete her share of the payments.
