loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Domitilla

texts.en:
Domitilla is a hardworking mother.  She is married to Patrick, and together they have been blessed with four children.  Domitilla has a love for farming, and has practiced it for the last 24 years, earning a monthly income of 27,000 KES.

Domitilla has requested a 2nd loan of 30,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase seedlings for planting and to pay her workers.  With the anticipated profits, Domitilla will be able to educate her children as well as improve her family's living standards.  It is important to note that she successfully repaid her previous loan.

We all have dreams and hopes in life, and so does Domitilla.  Her dream is to become financially stable and her hope is to have a more productive farming business.  With her hard work, and with funding, we know she will get there.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings for planting and to pay her workers.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 47 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years.

Crisanta has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe works hard to support her family.  She is married and for 3 years has operated a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, and spices.

In the future, Maria Fe would like to grow her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, and spices.

loans.name: Chien's Group

texts.en:
Chien was born in 1970. She has three children. The oldest child is married. The middle child is a worker and the youngest is in fifth grade. Her husband is a builder. Chien sells fertilizers to earn a living. She has done this job for ten years. 

Chien has been a trustworthy client of SEDA since 2008; her last loan was for 10,976,000 VND. This is her eighth loan cycle. She would like to borrow 13,216,000 VND to buy fertilizers for her store. She hopes that she can make her business stronger and bigger over the time. 

Chien is the leader of a group with four other members, who are listed below: 

• Thuong was born in 1970. She has two children. She wants to borrow 13,216,000 VND to sell building materials. 
• Oanh was born in 1975. He has one child. He sells fruit at the market. Oanh is requesting a loan of 12,768,000 VND to buy more fruit to resell.
• Ha was born in 1973. She has two children. She would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to raise pigs. 
• Khuyen was born in 1967. She has four children. She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND to raise chickens.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is a 42-year-old married woman living in Southern Ghour-Jordan with her retired husband and nine sons and daughters. She noticed that her husbands's pension wasn't enough to cover their needs. For that reason, she started her own business selling clothes at her house one year ago. Huda is planning to open her own clothes store in the future to expand her business. Now she is requesting a loan to buy a new collection of clothes that will help her raise her profit and reach her future plan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
A loan of 250,000 Albanian Lek that Ramadan is seeking from Kiva lenders will help him buy construction materials needed in his construction business. He has been running this activity for almost ten years, building houses, stores, home fences, restaurants, etc. His son who has just turned 18 years old and has talents in construction as well, is helping him out. 

Ramadan has four children with the oldest one being 22 years old and the youngest 13 years old. In addition to his construction practice, they own around 15 dynym of agricultural land that they rent out on an annual basis to some locals.

Ramadan and his family live in rural northern Albania where vineyards and chicken farms were very much developed under the communist era. Due to the fact that in their little town there are so many mimosa trees, it is called “the town of mimosas”.

loans.use: to buy some building material for his construction activity that has been running for almost 10 years

loans.name: Asernal Group

texts.en:
Emelisiana, who is in her late 20s, is single with one small kid.  She has been running a beauty salon for three years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be Emelisiana's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy salon equipment and has paid back her loan successfully.  She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to take care of her kid, being a single parent. She also used her profit to take care of herself and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy salon equipment, especially the fast moving items, in order to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of making her business international.

Emelisiana will share this loan with her loan group "Asernal," which has 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. (One client's face is hidden behind the group in the photo).

loans.use: to buy salon equipment, especially the fast moving items, in order to meet her customers'  requirements

loans.name: Wouyessouly 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe WOUYESSOULY 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans et ont en moyenne 8 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à KOUMALABA un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts anterieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur ABOU assises à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  WOUYESSOULY 2. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son interêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members  of the group “WOUYESSOULY 2” are married men, who average 47 years of age and eight children each, living for the most part in traditional families in KOUMALABA, a village in Commune de KOUORO, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second corn-producing loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop that Mr. ABOU grows is corn. He is the one sitting first from the left in the photo of this men’s group WOUYESSOULY 2. With this loan, he intends to purchase eight 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and ten containers of herbicide of different kinds and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village in and SIKASSO. He plans on making an average profit of 160,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable him in part to pay back his loan with interest, as well as to help cover day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and plowing

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is a 19-year-old single young lady from a village near Jenin City. She lives with her family in a small house. Her father works raising sheep in a small barn next to their house. Haneen is a student in a local university where she studies Business Administration. She would like to take her BA degree and find a job in the future to help her family with part of their expenses.

Haneen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for the semester. By taking this loan, Haneen will be able to complete her studies and take the BA degree.

Haneen appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for the semester

loans.name: Irma Milagro

texts.es:
Irma de 33 años de edad, ha estudiado hasta 9º grado, esta acompañada,  su compañero de vida trabaja junto con ella vendiendo ropa, tienen dos hijos ya están adolescentes los dos estudian.


Irma tiene el negocio de ropa para todas las edades, ella lo tiene desde hace cinco años, lo aprendió debido a la necesidad de que sus hijos van creciendo y necesitan mucho mas,el negocio lo tiene en un pueblo cercano y su horario es de  5:00 am A 5: 00 pm.

   
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar mas ropa de todo tipo como:pantalones,camisas,ropa interior, jabón, rinso, lejía,debido a que tiene mucha demanda de clientes y son cosas que mas buscan,de esa forma al tener variedad obtendrá mas ingresos económicos.

El sueño de Irma es que sus hijos estudien, que vayan a la universidad y que en el futuro sean profesionales que se ganen la vida por si mismos.
texts.en:
Irma, age 33, went to school through the ninth grade.  She is in a relationship, and her life partner works with her selling clothes.  They have two adolescent children who go to school.

Irma has a business selling clothes for all ages.  She has had the business for five years.  She learned it out of necessity.  Her children are growing, and they need a lot more.  The business is in a nearby town.  Her schedule is from 5:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

She will use the loan to buy all types of clothes.  She will buy things like pants, shirts, underwear, soap, rinse, and bleach.  She will do this because she has a lot of customer demand, and these are the things that the look for the most.  This way she will have a variety, and she will get more income.

Irma’s dream is for her children to go to school and the university.  She dreams of them becoming professionals in the future and earning their own living.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: G.s. Aguacatal Group

texts.es: Oscar, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre con quien  tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia, en una aldea del municipio de Victoria, Yoro.  Se dedica a la siembra y producción de café.  Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años y cuenta con su propia finca de café.  Anteriormente cultivaba solo maíz y frijoles.  El café que produce lo vende en  grano en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicita es en forma grupal, personalmente solicita  15,000 lempiras  para  comprar fertilizantes y pago de limpieza para la finca de café para mejorar su cultivo. Sus planes son mejorar la finca, ser un gran productor de café y darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El grupo se llama Aguacatal, lo integra cuatro miembros que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma zona, ellos solicitan un préstamo grupal por 66,000 lempiras  para fertilizar sus cultivos.  En la foto esta Oscar a la izquierda, sigue Héctor, Eladio y Carlos a  la derecha.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 29, is in a common-law marriage.  They have three children.  He lives with his family in a village in the Victoria municipality in Yoro.  He plants and produces coffee.  He has been engaged in this business activity for five years.  He has his own coffee farm.

He previously grew only corn and beans.  He sells the coffee beans that he produces at the local market.

The loan that he is requesting is a group loan.  He is personally requesting 15,000 lempiras to buy fertilizers and to pay to clear the fields of his coffee farm.  He will do this to improve his crop.

His plans are to improve the farm, to be a great coffee producer, and to give his family a better quality of life.

The group is called Aguacatal.  It is comprised of four members who devote themselves to agriculture.  They live in the same area.  They are requesting a group loan for 66,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer for their crops.

In the photo Oscar is on the left followed by Héctor, Eladio, and Carlos is on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Al- Dora Omia Group

texts.en:
Al-Dora Omia is a group which comprises four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 150,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB.

Kawkab is the leader of the group. She is a 30-year-old married woman, living with her spouse in their own house. She studied till the secondary education, but she couldn't complete her studies because she got married when she was in the school. 

Now, Kawkab is an employee in a supermarket in the capital city with a certificate of the secondary education as a camera guard. The money that she receives from her job is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Kawkab's husband is unable to save for all the expenses of the family. Kawkab wants to help him in that responsibility. The house where Kawkab and her husband live lacks of many of the home appliances, and she can't afford them. For this reason, Kawkab is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase many of the home appliances for the house. 

Kawkab looks forward to improving the condition of her family. She hopes to build the second floor and renovate it to make her house more large.

loans.use: to purchase many home appliances for the house

loans.name: Yeredon 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe YEREDON 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à N'TJIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de DOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur quatrième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur AMADOU débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme YEREDON 1. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members  of the group “YEREDON 1” are married men, who average 40 years of age and six children each, living for the most part in traditional families in N'TJIBOUGOU, a village in Commune de DOGONI, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth corn-producing loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop that Mr. AMADOU grows is corn. He is the one standing first from the left in the photo of this men’s group YEREDON 1. With this loan, he intends to purchase eight 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and ten containers of herbicide of different kinds and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village in and SIKASSO. He plans on making an average profit of 160,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable him in part to pay back his loan with interest, as well as to help cover day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Yohana

texts.es:
Yohana es estudiante de la carrera de Diseño y Arte, vive con sus padres y cuenta con un taller de costura donde trabaja con su mamá y el padre es vendedor de productos varios.
Yohana tiene como objetivo abrir un instituto de alta costura y de esa manera mejor su nivel de ingresos y poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de su tesis, ya que será un gasto extra que tendrá. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Yohana is a student of Art and Design, she lives with her parents. She has a sewing workshop where she works with her mum and her father works selling various products. Yohana’s aim is to open a haute couture institute, thus improving her level of income and enabling her to help her family.

She is asking for this loan in order to invest in paying for her thesis, an extra expense she will encounter. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving, which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to pay her thesis expenses.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia  Lucila se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia vende cebollas, tomates y zapallos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las  verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar  verduras como cebollas, zanahorias y tomates. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Lucila continues to make a living by selling vegetables. She goes to different places to sell onions, tomatoes, and squash. Lucila has already worked for several years in this business and it goes very well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell vegetables. She requests the loan to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots, and tomatoes. Lucila is happy about the loan and promises to fulfill the payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 55 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Marilyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kalbubu

texts.ru: Калбубу 41 год, замужем, воспитывает 6 детей. Калбубу имеет среднее образование, по характеру она спокойный и общительный человек. Калбубу, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, в 2010 году начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Начав свой бизнес со стартовой суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Калбубу приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 5 овец и 1 кобыла. Также есть земельный надел мерою 1,60 ГА, где ежегодно Калбубу выращивает сено и картофель. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку жеребца для откорма с последующей реализацией. В будущем, Калбубу планирует расширить свою деятельность и сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en: Kalbubu is 41 years old, she is married and is raising six children. Kalbubu has secondary education and is a calm and social person. In 2010 while looking for addition source of income she started breeding livestock and cultivating plants. She started her business with 10,000 som (KGS). Kalbubu has given all she had to grow her business and now has one cow, five sheep and one mare. She also has a plot of land measuring 1,60 hectares where she annually grows hay and potatoes. For further growing of her business Kalbubu has come to the bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 son to buy a stallion for feeding and resale. In the future Kalbubu plans to expand her business and remodel her house.

loans.use: тo purchase stallion for fattening and resale in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º año de bachillerato. Esta casada su esposo trabaja en una empresa de cable, son padres de una hija que esta estudiando.


 María se dedica a vender pasteles todos los días a fuera de su casa,ademas vende gelatinas,flan,charamuscas y chocobananos, el negocio lo aprendió porque su madre la incentivo y la necesidad  de recibir otro ingreso económico a parte de lo que le da su esposo y ademas su hija le ayuda a vender los pasteles todas las tardes.

 El préstamo le ayudara porque quiere obtener otros ingresos, por eso se ha decidido a comprar una plancha para hacer pupusas, ya que ya tiene sus cliente y no le costaría venderlas,de esa forma lograra que ella y su familia vivan en mejores condiciones de vida.

El sueño de María es que con el tiempo tener una pupuseria mas grande en un local y mejorar cada día su negocio y que su hija se supere, que estudie y le ayude a ella en lo económico.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old, and studied until the 3rd year of high school.  She is married, her husband works for a cable company, and they are the parents of one daughter who is studying in school.

María works selling cakes everyday outside of her house.  She also sells gelatins, flan, charamuscas (candy twists), and chocolate-covered bananas.  She learned the business because her mother encouraged her, and also due to the necessity to receive another income apart from what her husband brings in.  Her daughter also helps her sell the cakes every afternoon.

The loan would help her because she wants to obtain additional income, and she has decided to purchase a grill to make pupusas (a stuffed corn-tortilla dish).  Since she already has customers it would not be difficult to sell them. It is in this way she and her family can obtain better living conditions.

María's dream is that with time she will have a larger pupusa shop in its own place, improve her business by the day, and that her daughter excels, that she studies and that she may help her financially.

loans.use: to purchase a grill to make pupusas (a stuffed corn-tortilla dish); since she already has customers, selling them would not be difficult.  In this way, she and her family can obtain better living conditions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Dilshoda

texts.en:
Dilshoda was born in 1995. She is a young and hardworking woman. Dilshoda is single and lives with her parents. She is going to start her own business, and in this way, get ahead. She is going to organize a business in buying and selling fabrics. She studied at the course called "To Get Ahead" with a women's organization with this aim. 

Dilshoda will manage with business alone. She will buy fabrics in bulk and sell in a local market. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy fabrics for organizing a new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for organizing a new business

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her early 40s, is single with three children and only one is still at school.  She has been running two projects, selling charcoal and plaiting her customers' hair.  She works from 7 am selling charcoal outside her house and during the day, customers come to plait their hair in her house as well.  She is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Fatuma's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to pay school fees, covered household expenses, built her house, bought a TV set, deck, a bed, a mattress, a kitchen cupboard and a wardrobe. She is really happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She will use this loan to buy a hairdryer and sacks of charcoal to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of opening a salon, and that is why she is buying a hairdryer, ready for a salon.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group "MPUNGA" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a hairdryer and sacks of charcoal to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Arenas Del Mar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARENAS DEL MAR” iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de jugo, servicio de orquesta, tienda de electricidad, tienda de barrio, venta de helado, venta de dulces, venta comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar la necesidad de un establecimiento comercial en su zona, mismo que podría apoyar económicamente a su familia. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideos, arroz y azúcar por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con sus compañeras en la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. [community association] Arenas Del Mar will begin their seventh lending cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada [Cascada Focal Centre]. It is composed of eight members and has a board of directors where María is the president. The businesses that the members of the community association have are varied and include: juice sales, orchestra services, electric equipment, neighbourhood stores, ice-cream sales, sweet sales and food sales.

The loan that they are requesting will benefit small-scale entrepreneurs, one of whom is María. She has indicated that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for six years, entering through an invitation of a backer of the institution that visited her in her domicile. She currently has a neighbourhood store business. She states that this business was started because she observed that there was a need for a commercial establishment in the area, which would also be able to support her family.

The loan that she is requesting is to increase her capital with a purchase of noodles, rice and sugar wholesale, which she will acquire from the wholesale distributors from the city of El Alto, and which she will later commercialise in her store. This endeavour will permit her to generate resources to support her family, since she lives with her partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes to share with her partners in the institution.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice and sugar wholesale

loans.name: Khamees

texts.en: Khamees is a 49-year-old single man living in Southern Ghour, Jordan with his brother and sister. He has been running his own business in the past selling hot drinks and herbal drinks at his house. Later on, he expanded his business to sell accessories and baby dolls in addition to cosmetic products . His goal is to open his own store in the future to build a stronger customer base. Now he is seeking a loan that will help him purchase a larger amount of accessories and baby dolls in addition to new types of products.

loans.use: To buy more accessories and baby dolls to sell

loans.name: Franco

texts.es:
Franco es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial y a la vez también trabaja como una forma de poder solventar sus estudios.
Está en el cuarto año de su carrera y comenta que en el futuro quiere poder aplicar todo lo que aprendió siendo un profesional útil a los demás.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de su tesis, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por su meta que es la de ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Franco is from the city of San Ignacio, is currently studying the degree of industrial engineering, and also works as a way to pay for his studies. He is in the fourth year of his studies, and states that in the future he wishes to be able to apply everything he has learned in order to be a useful professional to others.

He is requesting this loan in order to invest it in expenses for his thesis, and in this way he will be able to keep fighting to achieve his goal to be a good professional.

loans.use: to pay for thesis expenses

loans.name: Yeredon 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe YEREDON 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à N'TJIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de DOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur quatrième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur TIEMOGO assises à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme YEREDON 2. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members  of the group “YEREDON 2” are married men, who average 42 years of age and six children each, living for the most part in traditional families in N'TJIBOUGOU, a village in Commune de DOGONI, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth corn-producing loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop that Mr. TIEMOGO grows is corn. He is the one sitting first from the right in the photo of this men’s group YEREDON 2. With this loan, he intends to purchase eight 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and ten containers of herbicide of different kinds and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village in and SIKASSO. He plans on making an average profit of 160,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable him in part to pay back his loan with interest, as well as to help cover day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings for his agricultural land

loans.name: Zarnigor

texts.en: Zarnigor is a seamstress. She sews national women's dresses. Zarnigor sews dresses for local people and has offered this service for more than 3 years. She has a workshop in her house. Zarnigor has a lot of clients, mainly in summer season because many local women wear the national dress in the summer season. She manages with the business alone. Thanks to her good service she has regular customers. Zarnigor needs another sewing machine to increase productivity and in this way to develop her business. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to increase her productivity

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.en:
Saidniso is from a rural area. She was born in 1974. Saidniso is a very hardworking woman. She is married and brings up four children. Saidniso has been busy with farming. She grows potatoes. Saidniso began this business 10 years ago and grows potatoes in 0.50 hectare of land. Saidniso’s husband, Mamayunus, is a migrant in Russia. She lives poor with her children because her profit is small. 

Saidniso must buy school uniforms for her children because her children are schoolboys. She does not have enough money for it. Saidniso is asking for a loan of 3,500 Somoni to buy school uniforms and books and exercises for her children. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy school uniforms and books and exercises for her children

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 23-year-old university student majoring in Earth and Environmental Sciences, and he is in his fourth year. He lives in Mafraq, Jordan with his family that consists of eight members. Ibrahim is seeking to get his Bachelor's so that he will find a good job in his study field that will help him support his family financially because they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping him pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Betchiva

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Betchiva works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from furniture-making and raising pigs. Betchiva is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Betchiva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Nyame Dor Group

texts.en:
The Nyame Dor group is in the first cycle and are into the sale of foodstuffs, salt, pepper, lining, eggs, underwear and wigs, in order to improve living conditions for each member of the group. 

One of the members is Cathrene, who runs a foodstuff business. She sells at the market and buys the foodstuff from the farmers at moderate price. She works from the early hours of the morning every day. Cathrene is working hard to augment her business and generate better income for her family. She is married and the couple have four children.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her store, such as vegetables, fruit, meat, cassava, and plantains to sell to her customers.
The group members will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy the foodstuff from the farmers at moderate price and sell at the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood frames for his construction business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Joel, a husband, a proud father of five lovely adorable children, a farmer and a member of Tuiyobei self-help group in the Kitale area of Kenya. Being a small-hold farmer, Joel practices mixed farming on his small piece of inherited land. He has seven years of experience in this field, and his primary sources of income are milk, crops and some personal business that he does to make ends meet. 

Joel passionately loves poultry farming; as he likes to put it, “poultry is close to my heart”. He would like to buy more poultry, but raising money to do so is a challenge for him. Juhudi Kilimo is a micro finance organization that works with partners such as Kiva to help aspiring people like Joel improve their living conditions through training and financial support. 

Joel is seeking a loan from Kiva to buy more poultry in order to take advantage of the ready market that exists. Through the loan he is expecting to collect between three to five crates of eggs daily, and this will immediately increase his profit margins. As well, his family will benefit from an improved diet. Joel's farm will also benefit because poultry manure has high nitrogen, which will increase crop productivity. This will relieve Joel of the heavy burden of buying expensive fertilizer. 

Through this loan, Joel's family will never lack their basic needs, and they will have improved standards of living. He waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Benkadi  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 2 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à TIEBE un village dans la commune de KIGNAN dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur premier prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur ABDOUL KARIM  débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The two members  of the group “BENKADI 1” are married men, who average 40 years of age and six children each, living for the most part in traditional families in TIEBE, a village in Commune de KIGNAN, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their first corn-producing loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop that Mr. ABDOUL KARIM grows is corn. He is the one standing first from the right in the photo of this men’s group BENKADI 1. With this loan, he intends to purchase eight 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and ten containers of herbicide of different kinds and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village in and SIKASSO. He plans on making an average profit of 160,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable him in part to pay back his loan with interest, as well as to help cover day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and plowing

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 9 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à TIEBE un village dans la commune de KIGNA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame ASSITANBA débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The nine members of the group “BENKADI 1” are married women, who average 38 years of age and six children each, living for the most part in traditional families in TIEBE, a village in Commune de KIGNA, Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. ASSITANBA (standing second from the right in the photo of this women’s group BENKADI 1). With her loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and 2 containers of herbicide and to pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Selvin Jhony

texts.es:
Selvin es empleado en una cooperaiva crediticia,luego de haber salido de estudiar le salio inmediatamente el trabajo, y le queda a diez minutos de su casa, también Selvin trabaja como peluquero en su casa los fines de semana, este oficio lo aprendió desde que asistía a bachillerato.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una maquina nueva de cortar cabello,ya que la que tiene no le sirve y así no perderá sus clientes.

El sueño de Selvin es siempre mantener su trabajo para ayudarle a su madre y hermanos,ya que ellos estudian y necesitan un apoyo.
texts.en:
Selvin is employed in a cooperative credit institution.  After having left his studies, he left immediately to begin work, which is ten minutes from his house.  Selvin also works as a barber in his house on the weekends.  He learned this trade when he was attending high school. 

The loan that he is requesting is to purchase a new electric hair trimmer, since the one he has is out of service and in this way he will not lose his customers.

Selvin's dream is to always maintain his job, in order to help his mother and siblings, since they are studying in school and need his support.

loans.use: to purchase a new electric hair trimmer, since the one he has is out of service and in this way he will not lose his customers.

loans.name: Shawgy

texts.en: Shawgy applied for another loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more of goods and  food materials for his grocery to increase his business. The last loan assisted him very much to enlarge his business and that positively affected the living standards of his family. His income and profits became larger. From that profit he built the second floor of his house. He warmly thanks Kiva lenders for their loans. To further expand his business, Shawgy applied for another loan of 200,000 YER from Kiva Lenders to purchase many kinds of  food materials for his grocery to increase his business further. He hopes to be financed from Kiva lenders for this loan

loans.use: to purchase many kinds of  food materials for his grocery to increase his business

loans.name: María German

texts.es:
María de 44 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su casa y atiende un negocio de pupusería que es de su propiedad que esta ubicado frente a la escuela de la escuela de la comunidad.  Ella vivió y se creció con su abuela quien dedicó toda su vida a realizar esta actividad, su abuela era una persona muy humilde y trabajadora y fue ella quien le enseño valores morales y espirituales, y de esta forma poniendo en práctica todo lo aprendido de su abuela ha podido salir adelante. Ella trabajo en un cafetín en el centro escolar de su comunidad y fue allí donde aprendió y adquirió experiencia en el comercio.   Transcurrió el tiempo y la señora formo su hogar con su esposa, quien se dedica a la agricultura y son padres de 2 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.  


Ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas en un cafetín que es de su propiedad, también se dedica a los oficios domésticos se preocupa por mantener su hogar lo más higiénico posible ya que su prioridad son su familia, esta labor la aprendió de su abuela y ella continua haciéndolo porque le enorgullece que sus hijos se sientan cómodos estando en su casa, su principal fuente de ingresos depende las ganancias del cafetín.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar una refrigeradora y una plancha para hacer pupusas, de esta manera, tendrá un mejor ingreso y dará un mejor servicio a las personas de su comunidad.

Los planes que ella tiene para un futuro son las de ampliar su negocio y montar una pizzería.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old and spends her days taking care of the domestic chores of her household and running a business selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas) from her property which is located in front of the community's school. She lived and grew up with her grandmother who spent her whole life in the same business. Her grandmother was a very humble and hard working person, and it was she who taught Maria her moral and spiritual values. By putting into practice all that her grandmother taught her, she has been able to make progress. She worked in the school cafeteria in her community and it was there that she learned and acquired business experience. Time passed, and she made a home with her husband, who makes a living in farming. They are the parents of two children who are studying in the community school.

Maria makes a living selling pupusas in a cafeteria that she owns. She also takes care of the domestic chores and focusses on keeping her home as hygienic as possible since her family is her priority. She learned this work from her grandmother and will continue doing it because it makes her proud that her children feel comfortable in their home. Her main source of income is the earnings from the cafeteria.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy a refrigerator and a griddle to make pupusas, and by doing so, earn a better income and provide a better service to the people of her community.

Her future plans are to expand the business and start a pizzeria.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a griddle to make pupusas (stuffed tortillas), and by doing so, earn a better income and provide a better service to the people of her community.

loans.name: Sam 3 Group

texts.en:
Sam 3 is a group which consists of four members, women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

Rawdah is the leader of the group. She is a 28-year-old, married woman, and a mother of two children. Her oldest child is seven years old, and the youngest one is four years old. She lives with her family in the capital city of Sana'a. Rawdah is a very active and dynamic woman. She works as a housewife, and her husband is the breadwinner of the family. His income is unfixed and isn't enough to cover all the expenses of the family. That unfixed income affects negatively the living standard of the family, and causes shortages of necessary things, especially shortages of food for the household.

As a result, Rawdah applied for a loan of 10,000 YER, which she will use to purchase food materials for the household, including flour, sugar, meat, potatoes, and tomatoes. She needs to meet all the needs of the family for food in the house, and to make delicious meals for them. Rawdah looks forward to providing a secure future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase food for her family

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is age 31. She is married with five children aged between 13 years and 2 months. She sells potatoes and has been running the business for the past five years.  

With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve the living standards for their children and the welfare of the family.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Cancilida

texts.en: Cancilida, age 54, is married with three children between 20 and 27 years old. All of the children go to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, millet, sorghum and groundnuts and become a big supplier. The profit will be used to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more beans, millet, sorghum and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela tiene 21 años y está en el último año de la carrera de enfermería, sus padres son ganaderos y tiene 4 hermanos que no estudian y quiere servir de ejemplo para ellos y así poder incentivarlos a seguir alguna carrera y poder ayudar a su familia, aspira poder terminar la carrera y así poder trabajar en un sanatorio de renombre.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Gabriela is 21 years old and she is in the last year of her studies to become a nurse. Her parents are cattle herders and she has four siblings who are not in school. She wants to serve as an example for them and encourage them to work toward a career. In order to help her family, she will complete her studies and begin working in a well-known clinic. She is requesting this loan so that she will be able to pay university fees, enabling her to continue with her studies as she has in the past.

loans.use: to pay university costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay college tuition.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en: Faustin is aged 35. He is married with five children aged between 13 and 3 years; all of them go to school. He sells beans and has been in a business for the past 10 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children and buy land for farming.

loans.use: To buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Uwamariya

texts.en:
Uwamariya is 32 years old. She is married and has four children, aged between 1 and 10 years. She sells beans and has been working for the past seven years.

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans for sale. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees and to buy land for cultivation.

loans.use: To buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more blankets to sell and to add clothes to her sales

loans.name: Shmoa'a Al- Amal Group

texts.en:
Shmoa'a Al- Amal is a group which comprises five women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 250,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB.

Afrah is the leader of the group. She is a 24-year-old single woman who lives with her family in Sana'a city, Yemen. She has a secondary school education. 

Due to the miserable condition of her family, Afrah couldn't complete her studies. She is a very active and dynamic young woman. Now, she is an employee in a private sector.    

Afrah's house has a very old TV and it doesn't work well. After she comes back from her work, she likes to watch some of the programs and news in her house. Unfortunately, her TV doesn't work well. That thing makes her feel bored. She can't afford that condition. For this reason, Afrah is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new TV for the house.

Afrah looks forward to completing her studies in the university in order to make a secure future for herself.

loans.use: to purchase a new TV for the house.

loans.name: Al-Mehdar 2 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Mehdar 2. It is comprised of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They applied for a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB. Nabila is the leader of the group.

Nabila is a 44-year-old, married woman, and a mother of four children. They live in a rented house in Sana'a. She and her husband are employed as teachers, in the same school. The house where Nabila and her husband live lacks many home appliances, and the washing machine is very old and broken. For this reason, Nabila takes most of the family's clothes to the laundry store, outside the house. That costs her a lot of money, every week. Nabila cannot afford this condition. For this reason, Nabila applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to buy a washing machine, to help her in washing the clothes.

Nabila looks forward to furnishing the house of her family and, she hopes, to purchasing all new home appliances for her house.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Lester Roberto

texts.es: Lester Roberto, mayor de edad acompañado con un hijo menor de edad originario de uno de los municipios del norte de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es ademas un microempresario y administrador de su propio negocio el cual consiste en una agencia de distribuidora de gaseosas específicamente pepsi de todo tipo de tamaño como de 12 onzas, medio litro, litro, litro y medio, dos litros y tres litros y de todos los sabores, sus compras son al contado los cuales adquiere día de por medio y sus ventas son al contado Y al crédito los cuales recupera diario y cada ocho días, tiene clientes fijos como: pulperias, colegios, entre otros mas, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su casa de habitación para adecuar parte de ella su negocio ya que ha venido crecido mas porque su clientela ha incrementado, a pesar de los pocos estudios que tiene debido a que no logro terminar sus estudios concluyendo la secundaria se ha convertido en un buen comerciante que día a día lucha por salir adelante y que su hijo no pase lo que el paso, espera en un futuro no muy lejano que su hijo pueda concluir una carrera y ser todo un profesional, por lo que hoy en día Lester esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de gaseosas al crecer mas su inventario tendrá mejores ingresos, Lester agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Lester Roberto, an adult with one young son, is originally from one of the towns north of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. He's hard-working, honorable, responsible, and he has big dreams for personal improvement. He's also a businessman and the owner of his own small business as a distributor of Pepsi cola products. He sells all sizes, including 12 oz, 1/2 liter, 1 liter, 1 1/2 liter, 2 and 3 liters, and all flavors. Both his purchases, which he makes every other day, and his sales are on accounts. He is paid his credits daily and every eight days, and his regular clients include corner stores, high schools, and more.

One of his dreams is to improve part of his house so that he can use it for his business, since it's grown so much. He's managed to expand his customer base despite his lack of formal education. He had to leave school after completing his secondary, but he's become a good sales person, working hard every day to get ahead so that his son doesn't have to do what he did.  He hopes that in the not-distant future, his son can complete a degree and become a professional. That's why Lester is requesting this loan today, to invest in capital for his business, purchasing soda products to grow his inventory and increase his income. Lester is very grateful for the support that Kiva investors provide to people with few economic resources.

loans.use: purchase sodas and treats

loans.name: Deyla Elizabeth

texts.es:
Deyla de 18 años de edad, soltera estudio hasta el noveno grado en la comunidad, no ha seguido estudiando debido a que tiene que trabajar para apoyar a su madre en el sostén de la familia a su madre y dos de sus hermanos quienes trabajan en un negocio familiar de elaboración de pan.
Deyla se dedica a la elaboración de pan desde que tenia catorce años de edad, cuando su madre le enseño, gracias a sus pequeños ahorros compro un horno pequeño, pero industrial y una vitrina donde mostrar el pan que elabora.
Anteriormente trabajaban elaborando pan artesanal con su madre, quien fue la que le enseño el arte, y fue ella quien también le enseño  a sus hermanos ya que se han crecido sin padre. Salen a vender a la comunidad y a los cantones aledaños cuatro veces a la semana (domingos, martes, jueves y viernes) le ayuda su madre y sus hermanos.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar  15 latas donde colocan el pan valorado en $70.00 comprara rodos a $4 cada uno y necesita cuatro invertirá $16.00, comprara manteca $60.00,  jalea $50.00,  ocho quintales de harina $144.00, azúcar $100.00,  levadura $45 en diez libras.
De esta manera podrá  emprender su negocio familiar y elaborar mas pan para vender en la comunidad y lugares aledaños con lo cual pretende aumentar su oferta a los clientes y obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
Deyla planea seguir estudiando el año siguiente el bachillerato y aprender mas sobre panadería en el futuro para especializarse en el rubro y así poder expandirse en el negocio.
texts.en:
Deyla, 18 years old and single, studied until the ninth grade in the community. She has not continued to study because she has to work in order to help her mother support the family and two of her siblings, who work in a family business of making bread. 

Deyla has worked in bread making since she was 14 years old, when her mother taught her. Thanks to her small savings, she bought a small industrial oven and a display cabinet to show the bread that she makes. 

Previously she worked making artisanal bread with her mother, who was the one who taught her the art, and it was also her who taught her siblings since they have grown up without a father. They go out in the community and the bordering zones to sell four times a week (Sundays, Tuesdays, Thursdays and Fridays). Her mother and her siblings help her.

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy 15 baking sheets to place the bread on, at a value of $70.00. She will buy rolling pins at $4.00 a piece and she needs four ($16.00). She will buy butter ($60.00), gelatin ($50.00), eight quintals of flour ($144.00), sugar ($100.00), and ten pounds of yeast ($45.00). In this way she will be able to launch her family business and make more bread to sell in the community and nearby places with which she hopes to expand her sales to her customers and obtain better income. 

Deyla plans to continue studying next year and in the future learn more about baking in order to specialize in the topic and in that way be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for making bread.

loans.name: Jorge Omar

texts.es: Jorge, tiene 19 años de edad, está soltero, vive con sus padres, en el municipio de Gracias Lempira.  Hace tres años cultiva café en su propia finca.  El café lo vende en grano oro en la misma zona  o intermediarios. Desde pequeño se dedica a la agricultura cultivando maíz y frijol y ahora cultiva café. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento y mejorar su finca de café.   Su objetivo es mejorar la finca de café para sacar mejor cosecha y poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 19 years old, he is single and lives with his parents in the municipality of Gracias Lempira. He has been growing coffee on his own plantation for three years. He sells the green coffee beans in the same area or through a broker. 

Since he was small he has worked in agriculture growing corn and beans, and now he grows coffee. He has asked for a loan of 15,000 lempiras, which he will invest in fertilizers to maintain and improve his coffee plantation.

His aim is to is to improve the coffee plantation to achieve a better harvest and to be able to help his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to maintain his coffee plantation.

loans.name: God Be With Us Group

texts.en:
This group is made  five women who are selling ladies' wear, underwear, plates, fish and foodstuffs. The group has reached its sixth cycle with ID-Ghana. The women in this group show solidarity and team spirit among themselves. The group members’ main activity is retail.

Irene, the one standing on the far left in the photo, is a star borrower. She is 52 years old and the mother of two boys. She has been selling underwear for 12 years. She purchases her goods at the weekly market, from the central market at a wholesale price, in order to resell at a retail price. This new loan will allow her to buy more underwear for resale.

Her revenues will allow her to bolster her savings and contribute meaningfully to the school fees and healthcare costs for her children, hence help out her husband financially.

loans.use: To purchase her goods at the weekly market, from the central market at a wholesale price

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen es de la ciudad de Santaní, es estudiante de la carrera de Ciencias en la Educación, es una excelente estudiante, muy dedicada a sus estudios, siempre lucha por alcanzar sus metas. 
Su sueño es de terminar esta carrera y el día de mañana trabajar de forma independiente y enseñar en las Universidades así poder ayudar a su mama.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder cubrir los gastos que le generan ese trámite.
texts.en:
Karen is from the city of Santaní. She is a student in the field of Sciences and Education. She is an excellent student, very dedicated to her studies, and always fights to reach her goals. 

Her dream is to finish her degree and in the future work independently and teach in the universities so she can help her mother. She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in covering the expenses of her degree, and in that way be able to cover the expenses that this process generates.

loans.use: to pay her degree expenses.

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luís de 59 años de edad, es un agricultor que vive en la zona rural. Solo logro estudiar hasta 6° grado en la escuela. Está acompañado y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya no viven junto a él.

Luís tiene mucha experiencia ya tiene 15 años de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz y este año tiene planeado cultivar tres hectáreas de terreno, ya tiene una parte del dinero dado que solo necesita $1000;  porque ya tiene una parte para su capital de trabajo, el lugar donde le toca ir a trabajar le queda a una distancia de 3 km de distancia y esta actividad fue enseñada por su padre.

El crédito será invertido en la compra de insumos tales como abonos, insecticidas, herbicidas, entre otros, dado que la temporada de siembra está muy cerca y necesita el capital te trabajo para invertir en el cultivo de maíz, además la otra parte del crédito será para poder arrendar las tierras para cultivar el maíz.

Luís tiene planeado cultivar sus  tres hectáreas de terreno, ya que esta actividad le generara muchas ganancias y así podrá pagar su crédito sin problemas y sabe que todo esto lo puede lograr con la ayuda y financiación de su crédito.
texts.en:
Luis is a 59 year old farmer who lives in a rural area. He only managed to study until the sixth grade. He is married and has two children who no longer live with him.

Luis is very experienced given that he has already made a living growing corn for fifteen years. This year he plans to cultivate three hectares of land and has already paid for part of the cost. He only needs $1000 since he already has part of his working capital. The place that he needs to travel to to work the land is 3 km from his home. He was taught his trade by his father.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides, among others. Given that the planting season is very close, he needs the working capital to invest in the cultivation of corn. In addition, part of the loan will go towards leasing the land he needs to grow the corn.

Luis plans to cultivate three hectares of land since this activity will generate a lot of profit and he will therefore be able to pay his loan without any problems. He know that he will be able to accomplish all of this with the help and funding from his loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides, among other things, given that the planting season is very close, and he needs the working capital to invest in the cultivation of corn. In addition, part of the loan will go towards leasing the land he needs to grow the corn.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Josephat, a 38-year-old husband and father to five good-looking children. He is based in Kapomboi, a remote village in Kitale area of Kenya, which is an area with high poultry production and consumption. For 12 years he has been actively involved in mixed farming as a source of income. He has a beautiful and supporting wife who helps him with farm work and domestic chores. His primary source of income is from milk, crops and some personal business that he does to make ends meet. 

He passionately loves poultry farming and this can be noticed in how he takes good care of his poultry birds and feeds them. When asked what he enjoys about poultry farming he replied that he enjoys “picking the eggs every day in the morning.” However, this humble and honest man faces challenges of not meeting the demand for eggs and also not satisfying his ever-increasing client base. That is why he is requesting a loan - to buy good quality breeds of poultry. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture and the demand for chicken is always high, being such a popular meal for so many people. Other than increased profits he will benefit from poultry manure hence saving more money that could have been used in buying fertilizer. Through increased income from egg, poultry meat selling and feathers he will permanently change his living conditions and secure the future of his school going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.en:
Shafoat is a hard-working woman. She is widowed and bringing up a son. Her son is 21 years old. She is the only breadwinner of her family. She has been working in an organization for the last three years. 

Shafoat works hard from early morning. She cooks national foods. Shafoat is a good-natured woman. Her colleagues know her as a kind woman. Shafoat needs financial support because she is ill. Shafoat must buy medicines for treatment. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for her treatment

loans.name: G.s. Buenos Aires Yorito Ill Group

texts.es: Don Rafael, tiene 54 años de edad, vive en  unión libre con su esposa con quien  tiene 4 hijos, reside en el municipio de Yorito, Yoro.  Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva 30 años cultivando  granos básicos como maíz, frijol y café. Actualmente la producción del café es su fuente de ingresos  mayor.  La producción la vende en granos en el mercado de la zona. El préstamo es en forma grupal y es por 10,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y limpieza de la finca de café. Su plan es sembrar otra parcela de café para crecer y darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El grupo se llama Buenos Aires Yorito III, integrado por 7 miembros, que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la producción de café. el monto total del grupo es por 67,000 Lempiras para invertirlo en el mantenimiento de los cultivos. En la foto se identifican Así: a la izquierda esta Rafael, sigue Miramor, José, Saúl, Miguel, Ricardo y María a la derecha.
texts.en:
Rafael, who is 54 years old, lives in a civil union with his wife with whom he has four children. They reside in the municipality of Yorito, Yoro. He has always worked in agriculture. For 30 years he has cultivated basic grains like corn, beans and coffee. Currently, coffee production is his primary source of income. He sells the coffee beans in a local market. 

His portion of the group loan is for 10,000 Lempiras and will be used to buy fertilizers and clear land for a coffee plantation. His plan is to sow another plot of land with coffee to increase production and improve his family's quality of life. 

The group is called Buenos Aires Yorito III and it consists of seven members who live in the same community and also work in coffee production. The total amount of the group loan is 67,000 Lempiras and it will be invested in crop maintenance. In the photo above there is, beginning on the left, Rafael, and then Jose, Saul, Miguel, Ricardo and then Maria on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and clear the land of a coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is 23 years old,  married, and a father of two children, ages one and four years old.He has been farming for the last two years and earns a monthly income of KES.20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He has applied for his second loan of KES. 40,000 after having successfully repaid the previous loan. He will use the entire loan amount to buy farm inputs, e.g., fertilizer and seedlings.


In future he desires to grow his business and be able to give his children the best education.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, e.g., fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 55 years old. She is widowed but blessed with seven children. Josephine is a farmer, a business she has done for the last 35 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 25,000.

Josephine has requested her second loan of Kshs. 40,000 with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase spraying chemicals, fertilizers and pay laborers.

With the anticipated profits, Josephine will be able to improve her living standard as well as educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase spraying chemicals, fertilizers and pay laborers

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es:
Zulema es una mujer de 23 años de edad soltera, madre de un niño y se dedica a la venta de peluches.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, luchadora, fuerte, constante y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘16 de Julio’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas.
Zulema es de tez morena, cabello negro largo peinado a la moda, estatura media, su forma de vestir es moderna y combina el español con el aymara, tanto para el comercio como para las relaciones familiares. Su negocio es el comercio de osos de peluche, actividad que viene realizando desde hace un año; de lunes a domingo desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche. Ella desea mejorar sus ingresos económicos debido a los gastos que realiza para la educación de su niño de 5 años. Ella quiere realizar la compra de peluches por mayor para tener un mejor margen de ganancia generando mayores ingresos económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Zulema solicita un préstamo para la compra de osos de peluche por mayor y pagar la educación de su pequeño niño.
texts.en:
Zulema is a 23-year-old woman and a single mother with one child. She works selling stuffed animals. She is enterprising, independent, strong, dedicated, persistent and very hard working. She conducts business in the zone "16 de Julio," a place characterized by business in all areas. 

Zulema is dark skinned with long black styled fashionably and has a medium build. Her style of dress is modern and combines Spanish fashion with el Aymara, both at work and in casual settings. She sells stuffed bears and has been engaged in this work for a year; Monday to Sunday from 10 in the morning until 9 at night. 

She hopes to increase sales because she needs to cover the costs of education for her five year old son. She wants to buy stuffed animals primarily to increase her profit margin and generate more income. It is for this reason that Zulema is requesting a loan to buy stuffed bears and cover the cost of education for her young son.

loans.use: to purchase stuffed bears, primarily, and to cover education costs for her young son,

loans.name: Rula

texts.en: Rula is a 20-year-old lady living in Irbid, Jordan with her family that consists of five members. She is a university student majoring in Accounting, and she is in her third year. Rula is seeking to get her Bachelor's so that she will be able to continue her studies and get her Master's in the future. But she currently doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Angel David

texts.es: Ángel, tiene 36 años de edad, está soltero, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia, en una aldea del municipio de Victoria, Yoro.  Angel se dedica a la siembra y producción de café desde hace 5 años la que cuida mucho ya que es su fuente de ingresos. Anteriormente solo cultivaba maíz y frijoles. Esta producción es vendida en grano en el mercado local. Ha solicitado varios ciclos de prestamos actualmente solicita el octavo ciclo que es por 20,000 lempiras el cual lo invertirá, en la compra de fertilizantes y para limpieza de la finca. Con esta inversión espera  mejorar la producción de café.  Su plan es superarse como productor, y darle mayor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Ángel, age 36, is single and has two sons. He lives with his family in a village near the town of Victoria, Yoro. Ángel is in the business of planting and selling coffee, work he's done for five years now. It's very important work to him as it is his source of income. Before that, he only grew corn and beans. He sells his produce in grain form in a local market. He has had loans before an his currently in his eighth loan cycle. This loan is for 20,000 lempiras which he will invest in buying fertilizers and in cleaning the farm. With this investment he hopes to improve his coffee production. His plan is to improve himself as a producer and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay to clean his crop

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 54 years. She is married and, together with her spouse, has have been blessed with four children who are 38, 28, 24 and 17 years old, respectively.

Sabina is a tailor. She loves her business, which she has done for the last 20 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs 8,000.

Sabina has requested her first loan of Kshs 5,000, which she will use to buy supplies of clothing materials. With the anticipated profits, Sabina will be able to educate her last-born child who is 17 years old, as well as improve the living standards of her family.

Sabina's hopes and dreams are to have a prosperous life and business with satisfied, loyal clients.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make clothing

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is 36 years old. She is married with 1 child, who is 9 years old and going to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more Irish potatoes and cassavas. The profits from the business will be used to improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes and cassavas to sell.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is aged 43 years. She is married and has four children, aged between 9 and 18, and all of them go to school.

She has been selling foodstuffs for the past 12 years. With the loan; she would like to buy sorghum and beans, in a big quantity, for sale. The profit from the business will be used to buy a cow and pay school fees of the children.

loans.use: to buy sorghum and beans in a big quantity

loans.name: G.s. Aguacatal Il Group

texts.es: Osman, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien  tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia, en  una aldea del municipio de Victoria, Yoro. Se dedica a la siembra y producción de café.  Esta actividad la realiza  desde hace 8 años en un terreno que tiene. La producción de café la vende en grano en el mercado local.  Esta solicitando un préstamo en forma grupal el cual es por 5,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de insumos, como abonos y otros fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de la finca y limpieza de la misma.  Su plan es ser un buen productor de café y darle mejor vida a su familia.  El grupo se llama aguacatal ll y está organizado por 7 personas que se dedican  a la agricultura y viven en la misma zona. El monto de préstamo es por 35,000 lempiras para fertilizar la finca de café.  En la foto están a la izquierda Angel,  le sigue  Osman Ariel, Osman René, Pedro y Delvin a la derecha, las mujeres están sentadas de la izquierda es Gladis y a la derecha esta Santos.
texts.en:
Osman, age 22, lives in a common-law marriage with his wife; they have one son. The live in a village near the city of Victoria, Yoro. He is in the business of planting and producting coffee. He's been doing this on his land for eight years. He then sells his coffee produce in grain form a a local market.

Osman will invest his portion of the group loan, 5,000 lempiras, in purchasing supplies, such as manure and other fertilizers, and in labor, to clean his farm. His plan is to be a good producer of coffee and provide his family with a good life.

The group is called Aguacatal II and it is comprised of seven members who are all farmers and live in the area. The total loan is for 35,000 lempiras and will be used primarily to fertilize coffee crops. In the the photo, from left to right, are Angel, Osman Ariel, Osman René, Pedro, and Delvin. The seated women are, from the left, Gladis and Santos.

loans.use: pay for manure, fertilizer, and coffee crop cleaning.

loans.name: Yusuf Jimmy

texts.en: Yusuf Jimmy is a farmer from Ikara.  As a Babban Gona member, Yusuf Jimmy is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yusuf Jimmy can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14.
